loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is happily married to Herminigildo E. who is a farmer in their village. Rice and corn farming is the only source of income for their family. The couple lives in San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. They have been blessed with three children. Their eldest and youngest children were not able to finish their high school studies, while their second child is a graduate of education. Elizabeth and their youngest child are responsible for helping Herminigildo maintain their rice and corn farm. Elizabeth is also helps her husband in generating financial support for their farming needs.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP15,000 that they will utilize to buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds for their farming. They live by means of farming and it serves as their livelihood. They are always looking at increasing their harvest in order to increase their profits. Elizabeth has already re-paid her first loan from KIVA lenders and is now borrowing again for their farming sustainability.

The couple and their children are close. They always help each other especially in times of trouble. Elizabeth is doing her best to provide their basic needs. She is dreaming that someday they will able to uplift their poor living conditions with the help of the lenders and Almighty God.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia Gyesuwaa is a 56 year old mother of eight, all of whom are in school. She is very hard working and resourceful to her family. She trades in charcoal and fresh tomatoes in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Afia obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Dorma and retails them to her customers. 

She would like a loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory. This would enable her to increase her savings to pay for her children educational fees. She is grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Yewoha Nhyira’ which means Jehovah’s Blessing.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Tereza

texts.es: Doña Maria R. tiene la edad de 53 años, reside en el barrio Villa Fraternidad, casada y con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, su esposo de trabaja en auto lavados. La señora Maria es una mujer que ha apoyado a su familia en lo necesario, desde hade dieciocho años administra una pulpería que inicio con una liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Luego comenzó hacer préstamos en Afodenic el cual este es su sexto préstamo que ha sido de mucho beneficio ya que incremento su inventario lo cual le ha generado muchas ganancias. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz y productos lácteos como enlatado que es lo que los clientes demandan.
texts.en:
Maria R. is 53, and she lives in the Villa Fraternidad neighborhood. She is married and has four grown children. Her husband works washing cars. Maria is a woman who has supported her family in their necessities. She has run her mini market, which started from a liquidation of her previous work, for eighteen years. Then she began to get loans from Afodenic. Her sixth loan has been very beneficial by increasing her inventory and generating lots of earnings. This loan is to buy basic grains, beans, rice, and canned milk products to meet her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and milk products

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Mrs. Gemma M. of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 19 years old, married to a fisherman, and has one child. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since July 2008 and is engaged in fishing.

Having completed her 2nd loan, she is requesting a new loan of Php 10,000 for the repair of their fishing boat. The increased profit will enable them to send their child to school and allow them to have a decent life.

loans.use: To repair their fishing boat

loans.name: Sherlinita

texts.en:
Sherlinita N. is from the village of Southern Looc. She is 48 years old. Sherlinita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Sherlinita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling peanuts in the local community. Sherlinita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Sherlinita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlinita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Sherlinita is requesting a new loan, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Sherlinita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Sitan D. est une femme mariée de 40 ans et mère de quatre  enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
    Sitan D. mène cette activité d’achat et de vente de bois de chauffe et de poissons fumés il y a environ dix  ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison de pluies.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires pour satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans. Elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés  tous les  prêts précédents( 4 solidaires et 4 individuels). 
Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 3 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali) et 2 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso.
   Elle vend les bois de chauffe à domicile et les poissons fumés au marché de leur localité.  
    Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan D., a married woman of 40 and the mother of 4 children, lives with her husband and children in Sanoubougou I, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Sitan D. has been in the business of buying and selling firewood and smoked fish for about 10 years. She enjoys an excellent reputation in this business and gets a lot of orders, especially during the rainy season.

Looking for complementary financial resources to satisfy the needs of her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. She is on her fifth individual loan after having reimbursed the preceding ones (4 solidarity loans and 4 individual loans) appropriately.

She intends to use this new loan to buy 3 cartons of smoked fish in Gao (7th administrative region of Mali) and 2 cart loads of firewood in the surrounding communities of the town of Sikasso. She sells the firewood out of her home and the smoked fish in the market in their neighborhood.

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 85,000 F CFA which will be used to help support the family and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Killa Group

texts.es:
Loa socios son miembros del banco comunal “KILLA”, Killa es un nombre quechua, que significa traducido al castellano, Luna; que fuera la esposa del Dios Sol, para nuestros antepasados los inkas.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, los socios se dedican a diversas actividades, como por ejemplo algunas socias realizan llamadas a celulares nacionales, una socia es profesora de escuela, una pareja de esposos socios tienen un restaurante turístico en la calle recoleta, los otros socios tienen tienda abarrotes, venden licores en el centro comercial molino, todos los socios desean el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios  y así seguir apostando en el crecimiento de sus múltiples negocios.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos con el préstamo y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo programado.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo para reinvertir en sus negocios.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with six children. She lives in Mile 3 Nkwen, Cameroon. Helen and her entire family live in a one-roomed house. Helen has had to overcome many challenges in life, such as taking care of her children, especially as her husband is dead. She is responsible for paying their school fees. Helen farms crops such as cocoyams, beans and cassava. She plans to invest this loan in buying seeds, clearing the farm, paying the laborers to cultivate the farmland, and renting the farm.

This will be Helen's fourth loan from Kiva partner, GHAPE, of which she has been a member since 2004. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to its location and her reasonable prices. Moreover, with experience she is now receiving a good yield from her farm. Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family, and give them good medication whenever they sick. Another part will be put towards buying land for building a house.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff, and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy seeds, clear the farm, pay laborers and rent

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married to Melecio, a company driver and they were blessed with a three year old daughter and they are living in the village of Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela. Despite the hardships of life, the couple still strives to be successful in their own careers for the benefit of their child. She is glad that there is cooperation in their family and they have a good relationship with each other.

Cristina is a vegetable vendor in their village. She patiently sells them through house to house just to generate income which is being used for their daily needs. Christina is hoping to avail a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 for the growth of her business. She wanted to sell bigger amount of vegetables in order to gain more income to sustain all the growing needs of their child. She hopes that her business will be supported by the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie A. is a fisherman and at the same time a seaweed grower in their island. He has four children, with 9 years old as the eldest who inspire him always to pursue more on his seaweed business. He works whole day to take care of the seaweeds. He is doing the best he can to be able to sustain their livelihood because it is where his family depends on for food, clothes and other basic needs.

He requested a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc to fund his business. The loan will help a lot to buy more seaweed seedlings since he has expanded the size of his seaweed farm. In that way, he believes that he will be able to have more seaweeds and more income for his family in the future.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en: Cerelina D. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Cerelina owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to the whole community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Aside from this, she is also into a food-making and selling business. She wants to make a good income from these businesses. In 2009, Cerelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale as well as maintenance for her sewing equipment. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and to maintain her sewing equipment

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou H., 27, is married and has two children. She lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she earns a living as a requirement worker, while her husband (pictured) is a furniture seller. She is also hired by neighbors to plow or harvest their rice crops. Her husband also goes to buy beds in bulk from people who live in the rural area and then takes them to sell by retail from door-to-door. Ou H. finds that her husband’s business selling beds is a profitable one, so she would like to improve it by using the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: To improve a selling bed business.

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es: La señora Meyling M., madres de tres hijos, vende ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, lleva varios años en las ventas, lo cual le fue difícil por que cuando inicio le costo hacer clientela y mucha gente no le pago, poder estabilizarse fue algo bueno para ella esto lo logro con el financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo. También invirtió en la compra de joyas de plata ya que es la que se vende mucho. Su esposo es técnico aduanero y el también la apoyado para dar a sus hijos lo mejor en educación. Tiene 32 años de edad, vive en Villa Libertad, su plan es comprar ropa para dama, caballero, niños y muchas prendas de plata para poder cumplir con los encargos a si como vender lo cual espera que las ventas sean buenas en esta temporada. Sus planes es a corto plazo es poder tener una boutique y poder surtirla.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meyling M., a mother of three, has been selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes for several years. At the beginning it was difficult for her to create a clientele and many did not pay her. In order to stabilize she succeeded with a loan from Afodenic. She also invested in buying silver jewelry as it sells well. Her husband is a customs officer and he is very supportive in order to give his children a better education. She is 32 years old, she lives in Villa Libertad. It is her plan to buy clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children as well as many pieces of silver jewelry to meet her orders. She hopes sales will be good this season. Her short term plans are to have a boutique and stock up.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothes and silver jewelry

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda L. is from the village of Purok 4, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 33 years old. Glenda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Glenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Siliper

texts.en: Siliper is 53 years old and married. She sells vegetables in Mathare in Nairobi. She has been running the business for five years. Siliper really appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her develop her record keeping skills. She intends to add more vegetables to her stock using the loan of  10,000 Kenyan shillings. She hopes to have her own business premises and improve her standard of living. Her dream is to expand into a wholesale business in the future. She describes herself as hardworking and optimistic.

loans.use: To add more vegetables to her stock of produce

loans.name: Carlos Fonseca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Carlos Fonseca está integrado por cinco personas responsables y trabajadoras. Uno de ellos es Ervin Ernesto L. Pacheco de 37 años quien desde hace tiempo vende CD y en el 2000 logro obtener un tramo en el mercado. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Isabel R. R. quien desde hace siete años vende ropa, Elsa María C. desde hace tres año vende cosméticos, Marisol de los Ángeles desde 1993 tiene una pequeña pulpería y   Paula R. vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Carlos Fonseca Group is composed of 5 responsible and hard-working people. One of them is Ervin Ernesto L., 37 years old, who for some time has sold CDs, and in the year 2000, obtained a stall in the public market. His companions in the group are Isabel R. R., who for 7 years has sold clothing; Elsa María C., who for 3 years has sold cosmetics, Marisol de los Ángeles, who since 1993 has had a small general store, and Paula R., who sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CDs TO SELL

loans.name: Forever(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Forever está formado por mujeres trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos,  las socias viven la ciudad de Cuenca urbe que  se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Centro Sur del país.

Verónica M. es socia del banco comunal Forever,  tiene 31 años de edad es casada y madre de tres niños, su esposo trabaja en un taller de mecánica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella vende  productos Forever, productos naturales como: medicina, cremas, cosméticos, etc.  le va bastante bien ya que sus productos tiene acogida en el mercado,  lleva un año comercializando estos  productos y solo utiliza  tres  horas al día y el resto del tiempo se dedica a su familia. Las ventas las realiza principalmente a sus amigos y vecinos de  su barrio.

Este es su primer crédito y fue una amiga de su trabajo quien la invito a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres, con el crédito que reciba va a comprar vitaminas, medicinas, cosméticos, etc. para su exigente clientela.

Su meta es de llegar a ser Gerente de la empresa.

Libia Z. es socia éste banco, éste es su primer ciclo y fue incentivada a formar parte del mismo por el Gerente de productos Forever,  ella se dedica  a la venta de éstos productos  hace cuatro meses, inicialmente era consumidora de productos Forever y ahora   espera en poco tiempo tener mucha clientela.

Nuestra socia vive detrás del mercado Feria Libre (mercado de Cuenca), se encuentra divorciada hace siete años por  infidelidad de su marido, junto a quien procreó cuatro hijos que se encuentran de 17, 15, 13, 8 años de edad, no tiene casa propia vive arrendando.

Con el préstamo que reciba de la fundación va a pagar una parte de la entrada para su casa.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un carro.
texts.en:
The Forever Community Bank is composed of working women that are always looking for ways to advance. With their everyday work they ensure a better future for their children. The members live in Cuenca city, a charming city in the south central region of the country which is known for it's historic center and scenery. Verónica M. is a member of the Forever Community Bank; she is 31 years old, married and mother of 3 children. Her husband works at a mechanics workshop. They don't own their home and are currently renting. She sells Forever products, natural products like medicine, lotion, cosmetics, etc. Sales are rather good because there is demand in the market for these products. She has been selling for a year. Verónica sells 3 hours a day and spends the rest of her time taking care of her family. She primarily sells to friends and neighbors. This is her first loan. A work friend invited her to become part of this group of women. With the loan she receives, she will buy vitamins, medicine, cosmetics, etc. for her discerning clientele. Her goal is to become a manager in the business. Libia Z. is another member of the bank. This is her first loan and she was motivated to join the group by her manager at Forever. Libia has been selling these products for 4 months. Initially, she was a Forever client and she hopes to have many customers in very little time. This member lives behind the Cuenca open air market. She was divorced 7 years ago, because her husband was unfaithful. They have 4 children, ages 17, 15, 13, and 8. Libia doesn't own her house and is currently renting. With the loan she receives from the foundation she will pay for construction on the entrance of her home. Her dream is to one day own a car.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vitamins, cosmetics, medicine and payment for part of the construction of an entrance hallway (to buy a house).

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Лолаев Рахмон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Дети живут отдельно. У него возле своего дома есть магазин. Он продает продукты и хозяйственные товары. Рахмон одновременно занимается животноводством. В этой деятельности он более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Rahmon L. lives in the Yavan district. He is 57 years old, married and has 7 children. His wife is a homemaker. The children live separately. Rahmon has a store near his house, where he sells food products and household goods. He is also involved in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for over 20 years. Rahmon is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase their quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Hortencia Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia Francisca D. C., vive en la ciudad de las Flores Masaya, ella tiene 63 años de edad y vive en el Barrio Camilo Chamorro, es casada  y tiene 5 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y viven de forma independiente.

ella se dedica a la venta de pinolillo, cereal, ropa, plástico, comida, tiene una amplia gama de diferente productos  a ofrecer, dentro de los planes de la señora esta la rmodelacion total de los cuartos de us casa, el cual esta bastante deteriorado. Ella es una mujer muy humilde que vive en una casita que no posee los recursos óptimos de habitad. dentro de sus aspiraciones estqa la remodelacion de us hogar y para esto solicita el rpestamo para la reconstruccion y espera se le apoye economicamente, esto le traera la tranquilidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor lugar donde habitar o una herencia que dejarle a ellos.
texts.en:
Hortencia Francisca D. C., 63, lives in the city of Flores Masaya, in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood. She has 5 adult, independent, children. She sells pinolillo (a traditional Nicaraguan beverage based on toasted, ground corn and cocoa), cereal, clothing, plastics, prepared meals - she has a wide range of different products to offer. Within her plans is the total remodeling of the rooms in her house, which are in pretty deteriorated condition. She is a very humble woman who lives in a little house that lacks the basic conditions required for habitability. Within her dreams is the remodeling of her house and for this she needs financing. She hopes that she will receive the financial help she needs; this will bring her peace of mind in that it will make possible a better place for her children to live or for her to leave them as an inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For room remodel.

loans.name: Jesus David

texts.es: Jesús tiene 20 años es soltero y vive en la casa de sus abuelos, por quienes vela en agradecimiento por haberlo cuidado desde que nació.Sus cultivos están ubicados a 4 Km. de su comunidad, allí produce café y plátanos y a los que cada 15 días limpia, abona y les hecha insecticidas y fungicidas. La paciencia y cuidados adecuados que brinda a su vivero han logrado que todos sus vecinos soliciten sus plantas de café e incluso tiene pedidos que cubrir hasta setiembre próximo. Jesús tiene 3 años dedicado a la agricultura y ama su trabajo, pues las ganancias que percibe las vuelve a invertir en el mantenimiento de sus tierras. Asimismo está ahorrando para que más adelante pueda estudiar una carrera profesional y construir su casa propia en la ciudad, donde pueda instalar una bodega y con esos ingresos adquirir más terrenos para cultivar los frutos de su preferencia.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y no le preocupa las adversidades que se le puedan presentar en el camino, pues asegura que no quiere decepcionar a su banco comunal, ya que sus abuelos le enseñaron a resolver los problemas y ser siempre responsable.Con los setecientos soles que solicita contratará 3 operarios que le ayuden a plantar nuevas variedades de café en sus chacras.
texts.en:
Jesús is 20 years old, single, and lives in his grandparent's house. He is very grateful to them for having cared for him his whole life. His farmland is located 4 kilometers outside of his town, which is where he grows coffee and bananas. Every 15 days, he cleans them, fertilizes them, and sprays them with insecticide and anti-fungal remedies. The patience and care that he employs has earned him the respect of his neighbors, who all seek his coffee plants, and he has orders to fill through next September. Jesús has been working in agriculture for the past three years and he loves his work; he has been re-investing his profits in the maintenance of his land. He is also saving to someday be able to study a professional career and build his own house in the city where he can install a bodega and gain more income to buy more land to grow whichever fruits he prefers. This is his first loan with MFP and he is not worried about the challenges this represents – he is sure that he will be faithful and trustworthy with regards to his communal bank. His grandparents taught him how to solve problems and always be responsible. With the 700 soles he is seeking, he will hire three workers to help him plant new varieties of coffee on his farm land.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will hire works to help him plant new types of coffee on his farm land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain vehicle

loans.name: Medila

texts.en:
Medila A. is from the village of  Naawan, Misamis oriental. She is 52 years old and a widow with three adult children. To make a living, Medila operates an alteration and tailoring business. Medila has been engaged in this for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Medila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medila is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Medila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Burombe Twimukye, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
N. Francis, aged 55 years, has been selling cows and goats to earn a living from Kakoma in Rukungiri area in western Uganda. In this case Francis deals with farmers directly to purchase their livestock and then finds ready markets for them.

Francis’s main drawback in the course of doing this business has been the unstable prices of cattle and low capital input. With determination and efficient customer care skills, he has managed to keep his business going for over ten years. In a month, he makes profits to the tune of 200,000 Ugandan shillings.

Francis’s future plans are to fully expand his transactions which will earn him more revenue to pay for his children’s education requirements. With this loan, he anticipates making great strides in achieving this dream.

loans.use: To restock the animals on his farm

loans.name: Nkorias Ole

texts.en:
Nkorias Ole K. is 41-years-old. He is married to Naisuaku Ene K. and he is a father of four school-going children. 

Nkorias is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the funds to buy fertilizer and some chemicals for his twenty acres of wheat. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat production. 

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial and buy his own farm machinery.

He is a hardworking man who is focused on his goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and some chemicals for his twenty acres of wheat.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married to a ward assistant and has four children. She has been through junior high school.  Ekua sells provisions and soft drinks at Abura. Ekua uses the returns she gets from her business to help her husband take care of the home. Ekua will use the loan to purchase additional provisions to fill her shop. With the new income from her extended business, Ekua plans to build another shop in a different area.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions for her shop

loans.name: 06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Quyen L. T. (119) is a 30 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Chau - Hoang Hoa. Quyen is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa).

Quyen is married.  Her business involves raising cattL. for saL.. Quyen has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, Quyen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Quyen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 5000000 VND which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Quyen from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Oanh (118) is a 49 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2.  Hoa (115) is a 26 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3.  Nhung (116) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Quyen L. T. (119) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Chau - Hoang Hoa.  Quyen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Quyen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quyen kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2006, Quyen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quyen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,626,900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Oanh (118) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Hoa (115) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nhung (116) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha C. is a 29-year-old married woman and the leader of this group loan, having been selected by the other members. They all live in Doung Tum village in Takeo province. Each group member will use their part of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. Chantha C. and her husband, Mr. Ol Khoem, are farmers who work very hard to support their children. Mrs. Chantha C. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and also to hire laborers to plow her farm. The couple has four children, two who attend the local school and two who are still too young for school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to hire laborers for plowing.

loans.name: Radnaabazar

texts.en:
Radnaabazar R. is a 60-year-old woman who lives with her husband in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. Her family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Radnaabazar operates a dairy retail business with the help of her husband. She began her business in 1998 with working capital of 350,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Since then, she has created a wide customer base and now her working capital has grown to exceed 1,200,000 MNT. 

She would like to grow her business and be able to save money so that she can improve her quality of life. Radnaabazar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of products at wholesale prices and provide local customers with a high quality of dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Festus.  He is married, and has 2 children, aged 7 and 4. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because his parents believe Festus can help with his education. 

Festus established his pharmaceutical drugs business in 2001. He began his business because he was working before but deemed it fit and profitable if he started his own business.  In the rains many people fall ill, so that is the time he makes more money. He works 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, and he earns about 941,600 SLL every month from this business. 

Fetus has a very good loan repayment history.  He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Festus needs a loan in order to increase stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 141,240 SLL. In the future, Festus plans to increase stock in a way that could lead to an established pharmacy that could cater for all categories of people. Fetus’s pharmaceutical drugs business services the remote community with a large customer base.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more medicines

loans.name: Guillermo Joel

texts.es:
Guillermo Joel A. S., tiene 23 años.  Es soltero vive con la madre y la hermana,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Guillermo es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Guillermo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para comprar terreno para seguir trabajando. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Guillermo Joel A. S., 23, is single and lives with his mother and sister in Ventanas, Los Ríos province. He doesn’t have any children. He is a member of the “San Jose de los Amarillos” communal bank located in Los Amarillos an hour and a half from Ventanas. It has 23 members most of whom are farmers. This is their second loan with Cooperativa San José. Guillermo is a corn and cacao farmer. He makes his purchases monthly in Ventanas and his sales are done there too. He is asking for funds to buy corn and cacao. He feels that the loans are an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have enough money to buy land to continue farming. He faces challenges like pests and plant diseases like locusts in the hearts of the plants. He enjoys sports.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and cacao.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora B. is from the village of Labakid. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, She runs a general store,  selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chab K. married Mr. Sovanna Em and they live in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is the mother of two children, who are farmers. She is a soup and congee (rice porridge) seller who earns a large profit to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a 3.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell. He is also a duck breeder who makes a small income to support his family. Her husband is shown in the photo with her. 

Mrs. Chab K.'s problem is that her husband’s field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will rent a machine to plow the rice field and farm laborers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is part of the communal bank “Vida Nueva” (New Life) and resides by the commune Longaví.  For the past year and a half Yolanda has been running a small grocery store of non-perishable goods from her house.  Before this Yolanda worked in her mother´s business of leasing costumes. Her husband, who is also a borrower of Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, sells coal and vegetables from a cart (a horse-drawn carriage) in the commune of Longaví.

Yolanda and her husband are parents to a 4 year old daughter and her husband has two other young daughters from a previous marriage. 

With this loan Yolanda will purchase non-perishable merchandise to stock the grocery store and also sweets to sell.

Yolanda´s house suffered some damage from the last big earthquake (February 27, 2010) causing one of the walls of the house (which is made of adobe) to lean out of place only being sustained by the other side wall.  Fortunately, Yolanda has the money to make the repairs but is waiting for the warmer weather, as making the repairs would open would expose her entire house.

For Yolanda it has been helpful to work with Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, and she likes the system of weekly payments as she feel she gets out of debt more quickly and can still see some gains, too.  Yolanda is also grateful for the disposition of her loan officer.

Longaví is a commune in the Maule Region of central Chile.  Its name in Mapudungun (the Mapuche language) stands for “snake head.” Primarily a farming community, it is situated between mountains, foothills and mountains of lush natural beauty, with its highest point being Mount Longaví, with an altitude of 3,242 meters.

loans.use: to buy merchandise/non-perishable goods

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business from home, with neighbors being her potential customers. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the winter rainy season it becomes difficult for her to sell at an open-air market. She hopes to open a restaurant in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and paraffin.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and paraffin

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana Beatriz M. M. de 21 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su único hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una joven que a su edad cuenta con la enorme responsabilidad de sostener su hogar ella sola, por lo que se dedica a la venta de calzado para hombres, mujeres y niños. Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado sobre calle principal, y cuenta con muy buenas ventas debido a sus excelentes precios. Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y estilos de calzados, y de esta forma aumentar su inventario para este fin de año en el cual las ventas aumentan considerablemente, lo cual es muy importante para Ana aprovechar. El mayor deseo de ella es el de poder salir adelante y brindarle todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: Ana Beatriz M. M. is 21 years old.  She lives in Usulután department together with her 2 year-old son.  She is a woman who, at her young age, has the enormous responsibility of supporting her household alone.  For this reason she works selling men's, women's and children's shoes.  Her business is very well located on the main street and she has good sales owing to her excellent prices.  Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity and range of footwear and, in this way, increase her inventory for the upcoming end-of-year period in which sales increase considerably.  It is very important for Ana to be able to take advantage of this.  Her greatest wish is to be able to get ahead and provide her small son with everything he needs.

loans.use: To buy different styles of shoes to sell

loans.name: Tolgonai's Group

texts.en: Tolgonai G. is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married. Her husband works in construction and earns 5,000 soms per month. Together they are bringing up a son and three daughters. The son works in Bishkek in a sewing workshop, two daughters work in Kazakhstan and the third daughter is at school. Three years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, Tolgonai started to breed livestock animals. Selling some animals after fattening, she makes 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase farm animals in order to resell them at a higher price after fattening. In the near future, Tolgonai wants to start repairing her house and purchase household appliances in order to improve her living conditions. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 42 years old and married with eight children between four and 22. All of her children currently attend school. Zainabu’s husband works as an artist. 

For the past seven years, Zainabu has owned a business that sells palm oil. She will use her loan to buy more palm oil and also to buy women’s clothing. Zainabu hopes to use the profits from her business to provide food for her family. In the future, she would like to buy a market stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen C. Albino, es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, conocido por las aguas termales. Doña Carmen como es conocida en su localidad tiene 67 años de edad, comenta que sus papás nada mas le dieron estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria ya que antes los papás decían: “las mujeres no les sirve el estudio ya que es una perdida de tiempo, las mujeres tienen que aprender las labores del hogar ya que todas se casan y no trabajaban, tienen que estar al pendiente del esposo y de los hijos” es por eso que a ella ya no le dieron estudio. Dice que esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en una tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa, ella tiene con su tienda mas de 15 años y que se dedicó a esta actividad para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tenían muchos hijos, ella comprará pasta dental, papel higiénico, crema, shampoo, jabón, azúcar, huevo, leche, chiles enlatados, sopas instantáneas etc. Doña Carmen es viuda ella tubo 12 hijos ya todos casados, comenta que nada mas una de sus hijas vive con ella y es la que le ayuda económicamente y con el aseo de su casa. La meta que tiene para su negocio de abarrotes es remodelar el local donde vende ya que es muy pequeño y ya no le caben las cosas, también quiere vender verdura fresca ya que sus vecinas a veces le piden.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen C. Albino is from a place called San José Purua, which is located in the state of Michoacán.  It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths.  Carmen, as she is known is her area, is 67 years old.  

She says that her parents only gave her a third grade education.  At that time parents said, “An education is not for women, it is a waste of time.  Women have to learn how to do housework.  They all marry and do not work.  They have to look after their husbands and their children.”  That is why her parents did not give her an education. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the grocery store that she has in her house.  She has had the store for over 15 years.  She devoted herself to this business activity in order to help her husband with the household expenses because they had a lot of children.

She will buy toothpaste, toilet paper, cream, shampoo, soap, sugar, eggs, milk, canned hot peppers, and instant soup, etc.

Carmen is a widow, and she had 12 children.  They are all married, and only one of her daughters lives with her.  She helps her financially and with the housecleaning.  

Carmen’s goal is for her grocery business.  She wants to remodel the place where she sells because is it very small, and there is not enough room for everything.  Also, she wants to sell fresh vegetables because her neighbors sometimes ask for them.

loans.use: Invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Lucil

texts.en:
Lucil D. is from the city of Taboc Norte,Oroquieta City. She is 30 years old. Lucil is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucil owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Lucil has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucil is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lucil from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janete

texts.en:
Not everyone is comfortable dealing with change. Janete P., 42, feels quite the same, though she is sure that God will enable her to overcome. Janete is a college graduate, and now she applies what she learned from school and what she gets from her training in CCT* as a Community Partner to make her business prosper. She is married to Antonio, who has a regular work as a driver. They raise their children in Cavite--two college students and one high school student.

Janete is a water dealer, and by this she provides clean, distilled water to her community for almost five years now. She also sells electronic load (e-load) for mobile phones, since Filipinos are avid texters. Sometimes, she also buys and sells pawn tickets. With these she earns around Php 7,000 monthly. 

To help her grow her business, Janete decides to apply for a Php 9,000 loan. She plans to use the money to level up her water business, as well as to boost up her e-load business. She believes that by doing so, she increases the profitability of her businesses, which are the main sources of income of her family.
 
Admitting that a frequent change of business is troublesome for her is one thing Janete has to do in order to decide focusing on one or two and making it grow profitably. From there, she hopes to make her business really work. Janete simply wants her family to have better living conditions. 
 	

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of materials to increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children’s outfits, dresses, pants, jeans

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Qoya, provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Graciela La socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos 22,15,7 años; la socia trabaja administrando su bar restaurante, la socia tiene un restaurante es el único en el pueblo de Coya, ella trabaja con dos ayudantes y preparan todo tipo de platos caseros, desde el tradicional choclo con queso hasta los más elaborados, ella también vende cervezas y gaseosas a partir de las 7 de la noche y en poca cantidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir ene la compra de insumos y mejorar su establecimiento y abastecerse de bebidas, ella trae todo desde la ciudad del Cusco y esta ubicada a una hora desde Cusco.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Qoya, province of Calca, departament of Cuzco.

The member is Graciela. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children who are 22, 15 and 7 years old. She works managing her bar-restaurant. She has a restaurant which is the only one in the town of Coya. She works with two assistants and they make all kinds of homemade dishes, from the traditional corn and cheese to more complicated ones. She also sells beer and soft drinks from 7 p.m. on and in small quantities. The member is asking for the loan to invest in buying materials and in improving her establishment and buying a supply of beverages. She brings everything from the city of Cuzco, one hour away.  

The member is happy with the loan and is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: To invest in buying materials for the restaurant.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda V. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Criselda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Criselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Criselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Joumana

texts.ar: جومانا في عمر 35 سنة متزوجة ولها ولد تعمل في بيع الألبسة الولادية لها في عملها 14 سنة تحب عملها وتجيده كثيرا تريدان تزيد من مدخولها وتحسن وضع عائلتها المادي والاجتماعي لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد كان له الاثر الجيد على وضعها العملي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شاء بضاعة موسمية ثياب وغيره
texts.en: Joumana is 35 years old and married with one child. She has 14 years experience selling children's wear. She loves her business and excels in what she does. She aspires to increase her income and thereby improve her family's social and financial situation. She has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua and past loans have produced excellent results for her business. With this loan she wants to purchase in-season clothing and other items to sell at her store.

loans.use: to purchase in-season clothing to sell at her store.

loans.name: Nube Liliana

texts.es:
La Señora. Nube S. es socia del banco comunal en Sueños, vive en la comunidad de Uchupucum en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, su gente se dedica al comercio, es una ciudad que tiene muchos lugares para visitar.

Doña Nube tiene 63 años es casada y tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad,  casados y 4 de ellos viven independientes, una hija vive en su casa con quien comparte los gastos. Su esposo le ayuda en la atención de su bazar, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Nube es profesora jubilada y labora en su bazar hace 23 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia del mismo, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para su bazar como: regalos, tarjetas, peluches, bisutería, etc.

Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nube S. is a member of the communal bank named "In Dreams". She lives in the community of Uchupucum in the city of Azogues. This city enjoys a cold climate and it has a vastly beautiful architecture. The population is dedicated to commerce and it is a city that has many locales to visit.

Nube is 63 years old, married, and she has 5 grown and married children. Four of them live independently. One of her daughters lives at home and she shares expenses with her. Her husband helps her manage her general store and with their mutual work they have managed to build a house of their own. 

Nube is a retired teacher and she has had her general store for 23 years. She works from Monday to Saturday, 9 in the morning until 8 at night.

She is on her second loan with her communal bank. She was invited to join by a friend who is a member of the bank. She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise for her general store, such as: gifts, greeting cards, toys, jewelry, etc.

Her goal is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as gifts, greeting cards, toys, and jewelry

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es:
Lucia de 63 años, es un mujer trabajadora que desde hace 40 años lleva apoyándole a su esposo en la venta de pescado con el capital que gano por venta de pescado  puso su negocio de implementos de pesca.

Ellos trabajan de lunes a domingo delas las 5H00am hasta las 7H00pm, su esposo tiene su propia embarcación con el cual hace la pesca mientras ella está en la venta de implementos para la pesca. Con el préstamo va a comprar trasmallo, boyas, piolas artículos de pescas para mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucia, age 63, is a hardworking woman that has been helping her husband in realizing fish sales for over 40 years. With the capital that they earned from fish sales, she started a business selling fishing supplies.

They work from Monday to Sunday, from 5am to 7pm. Her husband has his own boat in which he goes fishing while Lucia works selling fishing supplies. She will use the loan to purchase an inventory of items such as nets, bobbers, and fishing line which would allow her to improve her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase nets, bobbers, and fishing line

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Manuel Jesus; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, el prepara panes y luego lo vende en su casa en forma independiente, el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de panadería.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, manteca y azúcar para preparar los panes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Manuel Jesus is a member of the "San Isidro de Yanahura 5to Paradero" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Manuel Jesus is 50 years old, married, and has two children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his bakery business.  He makes bread which he then sells at home independently.  Through his business, he manages to get his children ahead in life.  Manuel Jesus would like to expand and improve his bakery business.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour, butter and sugar to make bread.

Manuel Jesus is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter and sugar to make bread

loans.name: Yusifu S.

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Yusifu, a married father of two children aged 3 and 15 years. In 1989, Yusifu established his ready-made items business as a means of generating income to support his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 950,000 every month. 

Having already received and repaid one loan, Yusifu is requesting a new one in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to buy more ready-made clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Yusifu plans to open a shop for his wife, buy a car for commercial use, and educate his children to college level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ready-made clothing for his business.

loans.name: Jose Yoel Bladimir

texts.es:
José, se dedica a instalar cielos falsos, aprendió el oficio por un amigo, hoy día trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario fijo, y ya posee experiencia. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él.
Actualmente necesita invertir en materiales como la compra de losetas, aluminio, vidrio, estos materiales son los que utiliza a diario para ejecutar su trabajo, por lo que esta compra es muy importante para  José que le permita trabajar para los clientes atendiendo las demandas.
El sueño de él es montar un negocio grande, con mucha demanda, clientes satisfechos con la calidad y aportar para su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
José installs suspended ceilings.  He learned this trade from a friend, and now he works on his own.  He does not have a fixed schedule, and he does have experience.  He lives with his wife and two children who are economically dependent upon him.

He now needs to buy materials like tiles, aluminum, and glass.  These are the materials he uses every day in order to do his work.  That is why these purchases are very important for José.  They allow him to take care of his customers’ demands.

His dream is to put together a large business with great demand and customers who are satisfied with the quality he provides.  He also wants to give his family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy tiles, aluminum, and glass.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 39, años es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco,  vive en su propia casa al lado de su amado esposo Javier de 42 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena estabilidad para el mejor porvenir de su familia. Celia es una mujer de ardua labor, se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno para los miembros de su familia y luego se dirige a la chacra con su amado esposo. En sus tierras cultiva plantas de cacao, café, y bananos, productos importantes que le sirven de sustento para sobre salir y educar a sus menores hijos que se encuentran en época escolar. Celia cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno cultivados y en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ella necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar acabo sus actividades programadas, tiene planeado combatir la plaga de insectos que asechan los brotes de los frutos, por lo cual necesita comprar fertilizantes ya que ella no cuenta con recursos suficientes es por eso que ella acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a prosperar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante  su producción. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, es por ello que  espera de su colaboración para poder comprar los productos necesarios, a la vez se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará sustancias y fertilizantes para combatir la plaga de insectos que atacan los frutos de su cultivo.
texts.en: Celia is 39 years old and originally from the city of San Francisco. She lives in a house of her own together with her beloved husband, Javier, 42 years old, and their 3 beloved children. She wants to give them stability for a better future for the family. Celia is an arduous worker, started in the very early morning to prepare breakfast for the members of her family and later she sets out to the fields with her beloved husband. On their land they cultivate cocoa, coffee, and bananas. These are important products that help her to make ends meet and to educate her young children. During the harvest and when the fields need to be weeded she hires farm hands to help them advance faster in their scheduled tasks. She needs the support of the financial entity to help her carry out their scheduled activities. She plans on battling insect plagues that lurk in the fruit buds. She also needs to purchase fertilizers. She does not have sufficient resources which is why she accesses loans from MFP (Kiva Field Partner). This institution helps individuals of limited resources who wish to prosper. For the sake of her businesses, she hopes to have the same strength and impetus for which she is known, to advance production. This will be her second loan with MFP. She hopes to have your collaboration to be able to purchase the necessary products. She is compromised to make her payments according to the payment schedule, and she hopes to access other loans in the future. With the 2000 nuevos soles she requests, she will purchase materials and fertilizers she needs to combat insect plagues that attack the fruit of the cultivations.

loans.use: to purchase substances and fertilizers to combat insect plagues.

loans.name: Croet

texts.en: In Cambodia, there are many kinds of businesses but the most popular field is farming. One of them is Mrs. Croet. She has been a domestic rice cultivator for a long time in Kompong Cham Province. On average, she can make a little income from her crop-planting business. She makes approximately $2 each day. Her husband works in the fields frequently alongside her. For generating extra income, Mrs. Croet’s husband also works in the construction field as a construction worker. Traveling expenses always increase from day-to-day and she really wants to decrease the expenses. Mrs. Croet would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel to his work place. Mrs. Croet has only one child who is attending school and living under to support with food, clothes and education. Mrs. Croet and her husband are shown in the photo in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel to his work place.

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: La señora Adelayda se dedica a la venta de frutas y su esposo trabaja en la Cámara Oficial Española. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir frutas al por mayor (naranjas, mandarinas, piñas, manzanas, plátanos, y otras frutas de la estación) y también para variar las mismas ya que su clientela le exige otro tipo de frutas. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la zona de Tahuantinsuyo  de la ciudad de La Paz. Es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Adelayda sells fruit and her husband works in the official Spanish Chamber of Commerce in Bolivia.  She needs this loan to acquire fruit wholesale (oranges, mandarins, pineapples, apples, bananas and other seasonal fruit).  She would also like to vary the fruit that she sells as her customers are requesting other types of fruit.

Adelayda lives in her own home which is located in Tuhuantinsuyo district, in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has four children.  This is the third time that she has received a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges, mandarins, pineapples, etc. wholesale for her fruit stall

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina, aged 58, is married and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She has a piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Rufina has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano de 42 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta no tiene servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pítipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Mariano es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra yuca, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Lambayeque y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicas para su familia.  Mariano es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que los suyos tengan comodidades y mejores oportunidades para seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Mariano is 42 years old.  He lives with his family in their own home, which does not have running water or electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Pítipo  district, which is part of Lambayeque department.  This area is characterized by agriculture and livestock.

The activity that Mariano works in is farming; he has his own agricultural fields where he grows yucca.  Once his harvest is ready, he sells his products in different markets in Lambayeque, and so earns income to cover his household expenses.

He has requested a loan of 3,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy fertilizers to improve his fields and his crops, with the goal of being able to sell them for a better price to the retailers, and so earn better money for his family.

Mariano is a father, and he cares about his family's comfort and having better opportunities so they can continue moving ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his fields and his crops.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru:
Гулистон замужем и любящая мать 2 детей. Она добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Она занимается купля продажей продукты питания, а также хозяйственные товары, такие как порошок, шампунь, мыло и т.д. В этом бизнесе помогает ей её муж и сын. Гулистон хочет, чтобы её дети выросли в хороших условиях семьи и стали образованными и культурными людьми. Гулистон хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2300$ США для покупки муки и сахар оптом, который позволяет ей расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.
