Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Guliston is a married and loving mother of two children.  She is a conscientious and goal-oriented woman.  She is involved in buying and selling food products and also household products, such as detergent powder, shampoo, soap, etc.  Her husband and son help with this business.  Guliston wants her children to grow up in good family conditions and become educated and well-mannered people.  Guliston wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the wholesale purchase of flour and sugar, which will allow her to expand her business and receive desired profits.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar wholesale

loans.name: Surenhuu

texts.en: Surenhuu is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children in a house in the province of Hovd, Mongolia. Her husband works at a construction site. She started her business in 1998 by selling flour. She has many years of working experience. With the profits she earned, she is paying her two children's college tuition fees. In the future, she plans to redecorate her house. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase flour at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to purchase flour at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mry Claire

texts.en:
Mry Claire is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mry Claire has a garden where she plants & sells fruits & non-fruit tree seedlings. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for fruit tree seedlings.

Mry Claire has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mry Claire hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for fruit tree seedlings.

loans.name: Roufai

texts.fr:
Roufai est un homme âgé de 23 ans, il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a un enfant.
Roufai est un revendeur depuis 2009. Il a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il vend des articles électroniques. Il s’approvisionne au Ghana et quelques fois au Nigéria.
Roufai  sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de divers articles electronique.
texts.en:
Roufai is a 23-year old man who is married to a retailer. He has one child. He has been a retailer himself since 2009 and has opened his own shop in which he sells electronic products. He gets his supplies in Ghana and sometimes in Nigeria. 

Roufai is requesting his first loan from Wages in order to buy various electronic products

loans.use: to buy electronic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoos, soaps, canned goods, breads, junk foods, candies, soft drinks and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is married. His wife is a housekeeper. Although he would have liked to have a child with his wife, Romeo has not been blessed with one. At his age of 61, Romeo is getting old. His dream is to have good health and savings for the future emergencies that will happen to him and to his wife. 
Romeo has been running a rice farming business in the Philippines for 25 years. He always assures that his crop is in good condition to get high yields. The risks he encountered in farming are drought, pests, typhoons and flood.  That determines how much he will earn.

Romeo is requesting a loan of P27,000 to buy seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care. Applying all of this in his farming will have a positive result in production, and will gain higher income. He hopes to attain his dream while he operates his rice farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria luisa cuenta con 58 años de edad, esta casada con el señor diego y tiene 3 hijos miguel, amado y marcos, quienes están estudiando, el mayor esta cursando el primer año de la carrera en derecho, dos mas en segundo y tercer año de prepa, ella es alfarera se dedica a la elaboración de trastes de barro y también a la compra de los mismos, desde hacen 10 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este buen negocio ya que es muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias, las cuales le ayudaran para apoyar a su esposo, con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos, tanto para tener una mejor solvencia económica, como para tener un buen nivel de vida, el crédito que recibió lo continua invirtiendo en la compra de mas trastes como son: ollas, cazuelas, cantaros, vasijas, tinajas, cómales y leña.
Doña Mari (así es como la llama su familia) dice que una de las metas para su negocio, es la de continuar invirtiéndole mucho mas, ya que tiene como objetivo hacerlo crecer aun mas, para así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, para continuar ahorrando y poder asegurar la carrera profesional de sus hijos.
Ella está muy agradecida con fundación realidad, pero sobre todo con los prestatarios por la confianza y apoyo que le están brindando, ya que dice gracias a esta ayuda ahora tiene un mejor negocio y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Luisa is 58 years old and is married to Diego.  They have three children: Miguel, Amado and Marcos who are studying.  The oldest is in first year of Law School and the other two are in second and third year of high school.  She is a potter; she both manufactures clay kitchenware and also buys it.  She’s been in business ten years.

She says that she decided to start this business because it’s very profitable and it generates good profits that help her husband with the household's and their children’s expenses both to be solvent economically and to have a good standard of living.  She will use the loan she got to continue to invest in the purchase of kitchenware like: pots, stew pots, jugs, pitchers, tubs, griddles and firewood.

Doña Mari (this is what her family calls her) says that one of her business goals is to continue investing much more into it because her objective is to make it grow still more to improve and increase profits to continue to save and to assure her children’s professional careers.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad but above all to the lenders for the trust and support they are placing in her because thanks to this help she will now have a better business and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware: pots, stew pots, jugs, pitcher, buckents, griddles and firewood.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia believes that, "if there is patience there is progress". She is a hardworking mother who helps her husband in managing their upholstery business to generate income. She is 48 and has four adult children. They make and sell sidecars for motorcycle transport in their community. They mentioned that their business is difficult to manage for it requires a lot of patience and sacrifices. But through their strong determination and perseverance, they make their business profitable, and their income is sufficient to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children.

They aim to continue and improve the business because they have more customers who send orders to them, but due to inadequate capital, Cecilia is asking for an additional of P10,000 to buy steel, foams and other materials needed for making sidecars for motorcycle transport. They believe that the loan will help them to make more sidecars to meet their customers' orders. They are hoping that they will make their business grow and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy steel, foams and other materials needed for making sidecars for   motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca nació en la  ciudad de Cusco y desde hace 33 años que radica en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo. Francisca tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y fruta de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos.

Francisca tienda de abarrotes en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y también se dedica  a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos,  bordados y platería. Ya son 15 a 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Francisca en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes y para aumentar su artesanía. Sueño de Francisca es abrir un hotel en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo porque hay mucho movimiento de turistas. 

Francisca se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Francisca was born in the city of Cusco, and has lived in the city of Ollantaytambo for the past 33 years.  Francisca is 53 years old, married, and has four children from this union.

Francisca has a general store in one of the popular markets of the city of Ollantaytambo.  She also dedicates herself to selling handicrafts such as knitted goods, embroideries, and silver.  She has already dedicated herself to this business for 15 to 20 years, and things have gone well thanks to the effort she puts forth.  Francisca, at this time, requires a loan to buy merchandise for her general store and to increase her supply of handicrafts.  Her dream is to open a hotel in the city of Ollantaytambo because of the many tourists that move through the area.

Francisca finds herself grateful for the opportunity afforded her through this medium, and likewise commits to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her general store and increase her supply of handicrafts.

loans.name: Ajibay

texts.ru: Ажибаю 49 лет, женат, воспитывает четверых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Ажибай начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Ажибая, начатое с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Ажибай обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов. Доходы от кредита Ажибай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Ajibay is 49 years old, he is married and is raising four children.  In search of income for his family, in 2006 Ajibay started his business of fattening and reselling livestock.  Thanks to Ajibay's tenacity and perseverance his holdings, started with 15,000 Som (KGS), today bring in around 7,000 Som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy and meat products.  With the goal of further increasing his livestock count, Ajibay turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners company for a loan of 30,000 Som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep.  Ajibay plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing his livestock count.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Zoila Mariana

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer alegre, cordial, le gusta trabajar y ser emprendedora, es soltera, vive con sus dos hijas en Ibarra provincia de Imbabura en el Norte de Ecuador. Trabaja sola en una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.

Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de productos especialmente arroz de diversas marcas lo cual ayudará a su negocio a diversificar sus productos y así poder cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes y de la misma manera obtener buenos ingresos económicos que le servirán para el estudio y el diario vivir de sus hijas.

Zoila necesita tener más variedad de productos, para poder obtener un buen capital y de esta manera construir su propio local.
texts.en:
Zoila is a kind and cheerful woman who likes working and being resourceful. She is single and she lives with her two daughters in Ibarra, located in the Imbabura province in North Ecuador. She works alone in a general store.

This is the first loan she has asked to Fodemi, and she will invest it in the purchase of products such as rice of different brands to diversify her products in order to satisfy her customers’ necessities, as well as making good money she will need to pay for the education and the daily necessities of her daughters.

Zoila needs to have a wider variety of products in order to earn good money to build her own shop.

loans.use: To stock up her store with products such as rice of different brands.

loans.name: Adamsay G

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Adamsay G. She is married to a driver and has five children aged 17, 15, 10, 7 and 3 years. Four of the children are going to school. In 1993, Adamsay G. established her groundnut business. She began her business because her parents did not allow her to go to school and she had to take care of the younger ones and assist her mother in selling local foodstuffs.  After she was fully grown, her mother gave her some money to start her own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,349,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Adamsay G. has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan to purchase 10 bags of groundnuts @ Le 420,000. The remaining funds from the loan will be used for transport. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 269,920. 

In the future, Adamsay G. plans to build a house, educate her children to tertiary level and to have a store. She felt happy about taking this loan because it will help her to improve her business and earn more income.  Her major challenge is the frequent changes in the price of the goods.  Competition is keen and she overcomes her competitors by selling at a reduced cost. Adamsay G. serves 10 customers each day. Her business is popular because she has good interpersonal relationships with her customers.  She is assisted by family members. Her suppliers are located at Bamoi Town Lumor (Market Days Centre) and she transports her goods by public transport.  She buys four times a month. She uses part of her profit to pay her loan and reinvests the balance in the business. She is planning her business and this can be achieved through proper utilization of her profit. She is hard working and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Gurragchaa

texts.en: Gurragchaa wanted to renovate his ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The things he would like to renovate include the floor, cover, and other small parts. Because these parts have been becoming old and out of usage. Also heat-loss happens through the  undressed warm cover of ger. It increases the usage of coal fuel which raises extremely poisonous air all around of city. During last few years it has been one of biggest and essential issue in Mongolians. After the making the insulation to his ger, coal usage will be decreased notably as he planned. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase some parts of ger such as warm cover for his home renovation. It will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase some parts of ger such as warm cover for his home renovation.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – замужем, у нее есть взрослые сын и дочь. Светлана живет в Водяном. Это преимущественно сельскохозяйственный регион Украины, где многие занимаются выращиванием ранних овощных культур. У Светланы есть 3 теплицы под рассаду, одна большая теплица (70мх9мх3,5м) и еще 15 шестиметровых теплиц. В хозяйство вложено 35 000 гривен. Светлана занимается выращиванием овощей вот уже 20 лет. Затраты на семена и пленку составляют до 25 000 гривен.   

Светлане необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить материалы, необходимые для того, чтобы построить просторную большую дополнительную теплицу. У Светланы достаточно земли, но она пока под маленькими теплицами, а в них неудобно работать. В будущем Светлана хотела бы продолжать расширяться и ставить еще теплицы на свободной земле.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Svetlana is married and has an adult son and daughter.  Svetlana lives in the Vodyanoye village.  This is largely an agricultural region of Ukraine, where many people are involved in growing early vegetables.  Svetlana has three greenhouses for seedlings, one large greenhouse (70 meters x 9 meters x 3.5 meters) and 15 six-meter greenhouses.  She has 35,000 hryvnia invested into the business.  Svetlana has been involved in growing vegetables for 20 years.  Her expenses for seeds and plastic amount up to 25,000 hryvnia.  Svetlana needs a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase necessary materials for building an additional large and spacious greenhouse.  Svetlana has enough land, but it is being taken by small greenhouses, and it is uncomfortable to work there.  In the future, Svetlana wants to continue expanding and put more greenhouses on unused land.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for building an additional large and spacious greenhouse

loans.name: Minnie

texts.en:
Minnie is 70 years old, married and has five children. She has been in business for the last 24 years. Her business is doing very well. Faulu Kenya has helped her pay school fees for her children. 

She dreams of being financially stable so that she can support the orphans she is currently living with. Minnie requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy a cow and cow feed.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cow feed.

loans.name: Rasmas

texts.en: Rasmas is 36 years of age a married man who hails from Fort Portal-Uganda. He is involved in farming business growing bananas and peas for selling having been in business for five years now. He started farming on small scale but later on expanded his farms and he has attained a big increment on his harvests. However, he complains of seasonality changes in addition to expensive labor to work on the farm. He sings the same tune for his dream of educating his children till they get employment. Rasmas will use the loan to pay labor for planting sweet potatoes.

loans.use: to pay labor for planting sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en: My name is Rafaela, and my business is called Central Supplies, which I have owned and run for 17 years.  I started out selling just ice cream, and then just a few other Ã­tems, slowly growing into this little market I now have.  I sell milk, bread, oil, chicken, cheese and ice cream, and other daily use items.  My business is located on the main street in the main market in the town of Danli, so there are many people that pass by.  They stop into my little market for the delicious treats I make, but then they stay to do their monthly shopping, so that is how I have build my business.

loans.use: Compra de pollo, queso, leche, pan, dulces, papel, espaguetis y otros (Buying chicken, cheese, milk, bread, sweets, paper, spaghetti and others.)

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. She is a married mother of two children. She began to sell cosmetics via catalog after the marriage of her children. Her husband’s income alone was not enough, as they were no longer receiving support from their children. María Guadalupe works harder every day to help her husband and cover the costs of the household, as well as to continue to grow professionally. She recently received a promotion and if she continues to increase her sales she will be able to achieve even more.

For these reasons, she is in need of a loan of $750 to acquire more merchandise and continue to increase her sales volume. Don’t hesitate any longer. María Guadalupe needs and sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe vive en la localidad de Monterrey Nuevo León, es casada y madre de dos hijos. Ella comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo debido a que sus hijos se casarón y solamente con el sueldo de sus esposo no le alcanzaba, pues ya no reciben el apoyo de sus hijos como antes. Cada día María Guadalupe trabaja más duro para ayudar a su esposo y poder solventar los gastos de la casa y también para seguir creciendo profesionalmente, ya que recientemente la ascendieron de puesto y si continua vendiendo más puede lograr algo mejor.

Es por todo esto que ella requiere de un préstamo por l cantidad de $ 750 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para comprar más mercancía y seguir aumentando su volumen de ventas. No lo dudes más María Guadalupe necesita de tu apoyo y te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mercy O.

texts.en: A woman of age 38, Mercy O. is married and has four children. She lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, where she started her business in the year 1998. Mercy O. specializes in the sale of drugs. She believes that a loan of US$400 will be a good help to her in expanding the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 35 years old. He was jobless two years ago. Now he has a small mini-market beside his house in Kirkuk. He applied for the loan from AL-Aman to get $1000 to make some changes in his shop and bring up new goods for his shop. He also wants to paint the shop and develop it.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, oil, beans, milk and other food products for resale

loans.name: Victoria Lorenza

texts.es:
Victoria is a young mother who emigrated from a small rural area to the city along with her husband in order to create a better future. As the fruit of their love Victoria and her husband have two children, a five year-old son and a two year-old daughter. Currently Victoria raises chickens and guinea pigs in facilities in her home in the hope of contributing to the full satisfaction of the family’s needs. For this reason she works very hard every day in order to reap the benefits of her labor. Her husband is a professor, but the salary he receives is insufficient. As a result, Victoria’s dream is to be able to open a small store in the future in order to continue watching over the well-being of her small children. For that reason she wants to increase her number of animals with the goal of augmenting her income with the sale of the animals once they reach maturity. Let’s support a strained young mother so that she can continue sheltering in her heart many plans for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria es una joven madre que emigró de un pueblito de la zona rural a la ciudad junto a su esposo para forjarse un futuro mejor, fruto de ese amor tiene dos hijos, un niño de 5 años y una pequeña de 2 años. Actualmente cría pollos y cuyes en las instalaciones de su hogar con el afán de contribuir para la satisfacción plena de sus necesidades por esta razón cada día se esfuerza mucho para el buen desempeño de su labor.Su esposo es profesor, pero el sueldo que recibe es insuficiente. Por eso su anhelo es poder abrir en un futuro una pequeña tienda para seguir velando por el bienestar de sus pequeños.Por este motivo desea incrementar el número de animalitos con el propósito de acrecentar sus ingresos con la venta de los mismos cuando alcancen plena madurez.Apoyemos a una joven madre esforzada para que siga cobijando en su corazón muchos planes de superación.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en: Gibrilla is 49 years old and married with 5 children.  4 children are in school and his business is the sole source of income for their school costs. He learned soap production skills 11 years ago and started his business.  With his previous loans, Gibrilla expanded the production and could sell wholesale to retailers who are mainly women.  He would like to increase his production and extend his market to other districts.  Gibrilla would also like to buy modern appropriate soap production equipment.  He is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: He would like to expand his business by entering new markets in other districts.  To do this he will have to increase his production.

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vo Thi L., 36 years old, is living with her husband and 3 children in Nghi Loc, Nghe An. She joined TYM fund in 2001. Besides working on the famiL.'s rice field (0.7 acre), her main activity is to raise pigs. In order to buy piglets and mash, she decided to join the fund. Her first loan was 60 USD, enough for her to breed 2 pigs. Now, she has 6-7 pigs already. After 5 loans, her repayment and business are very advantageous. With an income of 150 USD/month, she intends to borrow 950 USD to buy more piglets and mash to expand and improve her pig-breeding model.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Võ Thị Lý, 36 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2001. Ngoài việc làm 7 sào ruộng, công việc chính của chị Lý là chăn nuôi lợn. Để có tiền mua lợn con và thức ăn, chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương. Mức vay đầu tiên là 60USD đủ để chị nuôi 2 con lợn, đến nay đàn lợn đã tăng lên 6-7 con. Sau 5 vòng vốn việc hoàn trả và kinh doanh với chị đều diễn ra thuận lợi. Với mức thu nhập là 150USD/tháng, chị đang định xin vay thêm 950USD để mua thêm lợn con và thức ăn gia súc nhằm mở rộng, phát triển mô hình chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs and mash

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.en:
Khisrav is a 25-year old father of three children.

Four years ago Khisrav, obtained a plot of land on which he grows wheat and potatoes. This land is the only source of income for the family. Khisrav is a good farmer and manages to produce a reasonable yield and generate enough income to support not only his children and wife, but his parents as well.

Khisrav is requesting a loan of 3000.00 Somoni (US$875) for a term of 12 months. Khisrav believes it is better to get prepared for the spring hot season now. Thus, he is going to use the loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds. As a client with good credit history, Khisrav assures everyone that he will repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong H., 26, a mother of four children, is employed as a garment worker at a salary of $90 a month. Her husband, Mr. Hem Mao, 30, owns a plot of land where he grows rice. He earns from his work about $1 a day. Four of their children are currently employed by the garment factory and every month they each earn $80.  To produce greater yield for the family, Mr. Hem Mao is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a tractor for  his rice field.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja V. S., member of the Community Bank “The Virgen of the Rosary, sells "salchipollo" (a traditional roasted chicken dish), soft drinks and snacks. She operates her business out of her house on one of the main streets of Bellavista, where a great amount of customers come daily to enjoy her type of food. She started her business after receiving encouragement and borrowed materials from a family member. Using her first loan from the Community Bank, she bought a mobile stand and thus began growing her business.

She now has steady daily sales, and with a six month $1,075 loan plans to buy more chairs and tables to expand her business. She also plans to stock more food with daily grocery items such as rice, sugar, bagged vegetables, canned food, and cleaning supplies, among other goods with high demand.

Maruja is an enthusiastic woman of 43 years, with one of her six children still living with her at home. She is happy to be reaching her personal goals. La señora Maruja V. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario ”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Bellavista y distrito de Bellavista, se dedica a ala venta de Salchi-papa y salchi-pollo , bebidas gaseosas y golosinas, desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa ubicada en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de esta tipo de comidas.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maruja V. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario ”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Bellavista y distrito de Bellavista, se dedica a ala venta de Salchi-papa y salchi-pollo , bebidas gaseosas y golosinas, desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa ubicada en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de esta tipo de comidas. Se inicio en este negocio motivada por un familiar, quien le presto los materiales necesarios, luego al recibir el primer préstamo en el Banco Comunal compro su carrito salchipapero, iniciando así su crecimiento económico, hay en día tiene asegurada su venta diaria. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 3000.00 que devolverá en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, comprará mas sillas y mesas para ampliar su negocio, y los insumos para la preparación de los productos que vende, además incrementara su venta de golosinas, con abarrotes de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar y menestras en bolsas, conservas en latas, productos de limpieza para el hogar y personal, y otros de mayor demanda entre sus clientes. Maruja es una mujer entusiasta de 43años, tiene 6 hijos, uno de los cuales vive con ella, se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables to accomodate more customers; to buy more food goods to stock her business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma R. is married and her husband works as a driver in a foundry. She has three children. The two oldest are already married. The youngest, Sofía, is 18 years old and she is still a student. She began 22 years ago with her business of preparing food for the employees of a company and so she helps her husband with the family expenses. Also, she has always enjoyed cooking.

Now she is asking for a loan of US $500 that she will repay in 5 months to paint her business and put in order some details that will help her improve the image of her business. With your help, Irma will achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma R. esta casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer en una ferretería, tiene 3 hijos los 2 mayores ya están casadas y la mas pequeña Sofía de 18 años quien esta estudiando. Inicio hace 22 años con su negocio preparando comida a empleados de una empresa y así ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares además que siempre le ha gustado la cocina.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para pintar su negocio y arreglar algunos detalles que le ayuden mejorar la imagen del negocio. Con tu apoyo Irma lograra sus metas,

loans.use: To remodel a business

loans.name: Jamileth Del Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Jamileth del Rosario N. G. has been a client of our institution for three years now, recieving four loans to invest in her business. You can see the improvement in her business and also her quality of life. Jamileth is married with three children. It’s good to mention that this business made it possible to educate her children—one of them graduated with a degree in psychology and two others are in middle school. Her husband helps out in the business and also sells cattle.

In Jamileth’s bar, she sells food like chicken, a daily dish and steak. With the loans they have improved their selection of products as well as the business’s infrastructure. They changed the location of the bar to better premises.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jamileth del Rosario N. G. es cliente de nuestra institución desde hace tres años donde ha obtenido cuatro prestamos, los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo, se puede observar mejoras en la calidad del negocio asi como en sus condiciones de vida, la cliente es casada con tres hijos cabe destacar que con este negocio ha logrado prepara a sus hijos ya que una de ellas se graduo de psicologa y dos estan en secundaria el esposo le ayuda en el negocio y ademas se dedica a la comercialización de ganado. En su bar ella vende comidas como Pollo, comida coriente, Churrasco. Con el prestamo han logrado mejorar tanto la oferta de productos asi como la infraestructura del negocio ya que se cambiaron de un local a otro con mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Invest in her bar restaurant: buy chicken, meat, soft drinks, beer and alcohol

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thi Toàn, 47 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She has 3 children. Two are still live with her. The oldest one has moved out. Her family is a traditional farmer family. She takes out loans to invest in raising poultry and pigs. The business earns her nice income of 3,000,000 VND a month that allows her to save enough to buy things for her house. Things like sewing machine, refrigerator. Her children also have jobs and bring in 3,000,000 VND a month. She is applying for a loan of 8,000,000 VND to invest more to her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thi Toàn 47 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003 chị sinh được 3 con hiên nay 2 con đang ở cùng chị, 1 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, gia đình chị làm nghề nông nghiệp khi tham gia Quỹ chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Với kịnh nghiệm nhiều năm chăn nuôi nên công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất hiệu quả, từ kết quả chăn nuôi được kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, gia đình chị đã tiết kiện để mua sắm được một số tiện nghi có giá trị như xe may, tủ lạnh…..Các con chị đã đi làm và có thu nhập phụ giúp gia đình bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 8.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Mrs. Sami Y. and her husband, Mr. Thon Kok, are farmers in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sami Y. is also a firewood seller and a pig breeder. She has two children who are too young to work or study. Her family lives in an old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sami Y. is asking for a loan to add to the profit from her businesses to build a new house. Mrs. Sami Y., her husband and her son are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 27 years old. She cares for her parent, who is 50 years old. She has been selling bread Chapati since 2003. Every day, she works from the morning to 1 PM at her business. She can earn a monthly profit or around $185 from her sales.

Rene is now requesting a loan to improve her business by purchasing more food items to increase her sale volume and expand her customer base.

loans.use: To restock her business

loans.name: Nieves Dina

texts.es:
Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.

Nieves es viuda, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos de los cuales una de sus hijas estudia en la ciudad de Lima, Nieves tiene un pequeño recreo en su casa, los días lunes a viernes vende menús y platos extras y los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde con la ayuda de empleadas y de su hijo, también vende bebidas variadas. Además Nieves tiene un salón grande que alquila para diferentes eventos y fiestas, Nieves en algunas oportunidades brinda el servicio de preparación de comida.

Nieves necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, cerveza, azúcar y aceite. Nieves sueña con ampliar su local, implementar y brindar más servicios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Virgin Mary Community Bank. She is 55 years old, a widow with 3 children;one of her daughters studies in the capital city of Lima. Nieves has a small food shop at home. Mondays through Fridays she sells menu items and extra dishes and on Saturdays and Sundays, she sells traditional food, an activity that she starts from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. with the help of some employees and her son. She also sells a variety of beverages as well. Nieves also has a big hall that she rents for different events and parties. In some occasions, Nieves provides catering service as well.

Nieves needs a 3000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan. The money will be invested in buying rice, beer, sugar and oil. Nieves dreams with expanding her hall, implement and offer more services, and that her children finish their professional studies.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nieves needs a 300 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that she will invest in buying rice, beer, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
P. Mukaddas is 21 years old. She is very entrepreneurial and hardworking, with innumerable plans for her future life. She doesn’t attend school, but in spite of this she is helping her parents get ahead. For 5 years, Mukaddas has been selling the national bread “lepeshka” and other types of bread in the local market in Khujand. Because she buys bread wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. She offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Mukaddas to make her business quite successful and provide a stable income for her family.

Mukaddas requests a loan of $600. She plans to purchase an greater assortment of baked good to expand her business. Mukaddas expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase more varieties of baked goods to increase sales

loans.name: Tifa

texts.en:
A Kiva Fellow recently interviewed Tifa`s mother-in-law. To see a clip from the interview, check out the YouTube video at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fvo6j84FKZ8. Tifa`s children are in the clip!

Tifa was born in 1982. She lives in Srebrenica, a village devastated by the Bosnian war in 1995.  In 1995, she was deported to Tuzla, where she lived until 2001 before returning to Srebrenica.  She is married, has two young daughters, and is studying law at a local university.  

To help support her family, Tifa requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to invest in an agricultural project with her mother-in-law. Together, they will purchase the seeds and materials needed to grow and prepare a special corn-based product. The product is a mix of corn and grasses, and can be stored to feed cattle in the winter time. This is considered a specialty food for cattle, and is in high demand in Srebrenica. The corn and grasses will largely be grown and prepared by her mother-in-law, because Tifa is busy studying and taking care of her children.

Tifa’s loan will be guaranteed by her mother-in-law, Muška E.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Kingsley

texts.en: Kingsley E. is 33 years old and married with 2 children. His wife is a school teacher. Kingsley sells planks both wholesale and retail to his customers. Kingsley is requesting a loan amount of $600 to purchase more planks to sell to his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is thirty years old. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel for three years. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits and the palm kernel is a by-product of the palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. 

Abena produces and supplies her product to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand becomes very high. She wants to use the loan to buy bags of palm nuts and gallon containers to store the oil, so she can increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. 

Fortunately, the government of Ghana has provided the community with a machine that most women can use to manufacture oil in bulk, saving them from using the antiquated method of getting the oil. She believes this will help to expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family, and finance her children’s education. 

She belongs to the community trust group called "Nyame Nhyira," meaning "God's Blessing," and her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: Abena wants the loan to buy more palm nuts

loans.name: Abdusaid

texts.ru: Хафизов Абдусаид Шукурович 1958 года рождения. Живет с женой и 3 детьми в селе.  Два года назад он начал свое дело в сфере животноводства. Он откармливает скот и продает. Ему иногда помогает жена. Для покупки еще одного теленка ей нужны дополнительные средства. Он купит телят, чтоб откормить ее и продать по выгодной цене. Абдусаид  хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdusaid Shukurovich Hafizov was born in 1958. He lives in a village with his wife and three children. Two years ago he started his own business in the field of animal husbandry. He breeds and resells cattle. Sometimes his wife helps him. He needs additional financing to buy another calf. He buys calves, then feeds and grows them and then resells at a better price. Abdusaid wants to take part in the Kiva program and get a loan for 3000 somoni (USD$825) for an eight month term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Horlinda

texts.es: Horlinda tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo en la casa que heredaron de sus padres hace muchos años atrás. El trabajo y su optimismo son rasgos que son muy evidentes en ella y que la ayudaron a tener no tan solo el negocio de abarrotes, sino algunas chacras de cultivo de uvas en la ciudad de Cañete (cuidad que se encuentra en el norte de la capital) donde viene trabajando junto a su esposo pues ella administra el negocio que instaló ahí (en la foto Herlinda nos muestra las imágenes de su bodega en Cañete) y que está iniciando ahora en la ciudad de Lima, lugares donde tiene que movilizarse cada quincena, pues las ventas son muy buenas por la temporada de verano. Es así que Horlinda viene trabajando más de 20 años en esta actividad  que le sirvió como alternativa para educar a sus hijos quienes ahora son profesionales y agradecen el esfuerzo de su madre y tratan de cooperar con ella. Sin embargo, desea incrementar el capital de su tienda y convertirla en un negocio familiar que sea herencia para sus hijos y nietos. Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, pues es una de las señoras que acompaña a la  institución desde su creación como agencia en esta parte de la ciudad. Horlinda necesita 2500 soles para instalar teléfonos públicos en su bodega y así tener mayor demanda y clientela.
texts.en:
Horlinda is 55 years old and lives with her husband in the house that they inherited from her parents. Hard work and optimism, traits that she clearly displays, have helped her set up not only a general store, but also some grape farms in the city of Cañete—a city that is located to the north of the capital. She has been working alongside her husband because she manages the business that she set up there. Herlinda is showing pictures of her general store in Cañete. She is now setting up a business in Lima, where she must travel every two weeks, since sales are good during this summer season. For over 20 years, Horlinda has been in business, which has served as a way to provide an education for her children who are now professionals and are grateful for their mother’s efforts, so they try to cooperate with her. Nevertheless, she needs to increase her capital so that she can turn her general store into a family business that her children and grandchildren will inherit. This is her tenth loan with MFP since she is one of the women who have been working with the institute since it was founded in this part of the city. Horlinda needs 2500.00 PEN in order to install some public telephones in her general store so that she can increase her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install public telephones in her general store

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela M. G. vive en Lourdes, Blanca tiene 41 años de edad. Blanca se dedica día a día en su negocio, que lo ha podido mantener ya por 4 años. Como se puede ver en la fotografía Blanca tiene una pequeña tienda con una escaza variedad en productos, el sueño de Blanca es poder surtir su negocio, ya que vive en una colonia con mucha afluencia de personas pero lastimosamente no logra satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes porque carece de muchos productos que las personas llegan a comprar, es por ello que Blanca solicita un crédito para surtir su tienda y que sus clientes estén satisfechos por que encuentran lo que buscan y también Blanca lograra percibir mejores ingresos que le ayudaran a seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela M. G. lives in Lourdes. She is 41. She dedicates herself day after day to her business, which she has had for 4 years now. As you can see in the picture, Blanca has a small store with a scarce variety of products. Blanca's dream is to be able to supply her business since she lives in a town with a lot of people. Unfortunately, she isn't able to satisfy the needs of her customers because she lacks a lot of the products that people come to buy. This is why Blanca is requesting a credit: to be able to supply her store so her customers will be satisfied and find what they are looking for. Blanca will also be able to gain a better income, which will help her keep investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem K. H. is 29 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she grows rice and vegetable crops.  She collects her mature produce and sells to her buyer four times a year.  She gains income to help meet her family's foods needs.  

She is married with three children who are single and go to school.  Her husband assists her in the farming business.  K. has requested a loan in order to support her business activities.  She will use the loan to buy seeds and to rent a cultivating machine for plowing farmland.

loans.use: Buy seeds and rent a cultivating machine.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Benita es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Benita vende comida actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas, la comida lo vende en la universidad a los obreros.
Benita necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y fideo.
Los sueños de Benita son mejorar su negocio, comprar una casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of Ayni Community Bank, which means Help in Quechua. She is a 50-year-old married mother of seven. She sells food to the workers at the local university, which she does with the help of her daughters. Benita is requesting a loan of 600 soles, which she will use to purchase rice and noodles. Her dreams are to improve her business, buy a home and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and noodles

loans.name: Truong's Group

texts.en:
Q. Trong T. is thirty years old and lives in the town of Yen Phong in Bac Ninh.  Q. is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by DINARI, one of Kiva's field partners.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.


Q. is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Q. has been engaged in this business for over eight years.


Q. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation through engaging in business activities.  She is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase medication for her livestock.  This will be the first loan taken out by this borrower.  Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Doan T. Bac is twenty-eight years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


2.  Trong T. Hong thirty-three years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


3.  Doan T. Tuyen is twenty-two years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.


4. Nguyen T. Cai is fifty-four years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


5.  Trong T. Q. is twenty-two years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business.


6.  Nguyen T. C. is twenty-seven years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


7.  Nguyen T. T. is twenty-three years old and is requesting a loan to support her business in the retail sector, running a general store.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

loans.use: To buy medication for her livestock.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
“Man is the architect of his own future,” is the quotation shared by Imelda D., which she learned from her friends. She realizes that this is true and has begun building her family’s future by patiently developing a sustainable business so that her family will not easily break down in times of life difficulties. Her family is happily living in the village of Pieza Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She has three children and has a good relationship with them and they are now attending elementary school.

Imelda is a soft drink dealer. She delivers soft drinks to stores in their village and nearby villages. The business is quite good and is generating average daily income. Imelda wants to improve her business further, so she wants to borrow from lenders the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional capital. She believes that someday her business will grow, and she will also diversify into other products through patience and the financial assistance of lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es:
El señor Otoniel vive con su esposa la señora Nancy y son padres de 3 hijos, uno de ellos con una discapacidad diferente, motivo que les da por luchar mas cada día para salir adelante.
El señor Otoniel es empleado en el área de maquinaria pesada en una empresa muy importante del país. 
El al igual que su esposa están tramitando este crédito para reinstalar el cableado eléctrico de la vivienda, que anteriormente la estaban rentando pero la dejaron en muy malas condiciones y ellos desean acondicionarla la casa para poder mudarse a ella.
texts.en:
Señor Otoniel lives with his wife, Señora Nancy, and they have three children. One of the children has a disability, and this motivates them to work harder every day to get ahead. Señor Otoniel is employed in the area of heavy equipment for one of his country's very important businesses. Both he and his wife are arranging this loan in order to replace the electrical wiring in their house. Previously they were renting it out but the tenants left it in bad condition and they would like to fix up the house so they can move into it.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install electrical wiring in his house.

loans.name: Ma. Rosemarie

texts.en: Ma. Rosemarie B. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Ma. Rosemarie owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling soft drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Ma. Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zaurbek

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Хамроев Заурбек родился 1978 году в г.Душанбе. Женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Три года как занимается продажей мужских одежд на  рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Он закупает товар из оптового рынка «Корвон». Заурбек кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Он успешно закончил  предыдущий займа и теперь запрашивает новый займ для закупки летней партии мужских одежд. Он хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zaurbek H. was born in 1978 in the city of Dushanbe. He is married and has one child. He has been selling men's clothing on the Korvon market in Dushanbe for three years now. He buys the merchandise in wholesale on the Korvon market. Zaurbek has been taking loans from us since 2008. He has successfully completed his previous loan and now asking for a new loan to buy a summer batch of men's wear. He wants to get a loan for 1500 somoni for a term of six months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's summer clothing

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo W. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells cooked food to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. sells roasted meat popularly known as kebab Cape coast. Ama has received no formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama has been selling roasted meat popularly known as kebab since 2007. She is responsible for paying of school fees and also feeding her family. Her loan will be used to buy grass cutters, antelopes and other live stock to prepare the kebab for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a new house for her family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy grass cutters, antelopes and other live stock to prepare the kebab for sale.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
M. Furkat is 25 years old and lives with his parents. He has dedicated himself to farming potato for more than 6 years. He enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of land for planting and protecting crop from insects that spoil his harvest. At the same time Furkat is engaged in the business of raising cattle. This is his fifth loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds, fertilizer for his plots and also young cattle. Furkat sincerely thankful to all lenders who support him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 29 years old. She is engaged in a hog-raising business, located in their backyard. They are living in Bolinao Aurora, Isabela. Managing her piggery business with the support of her husband is quite good because it helps her family a lot in providing most of their needs at home. She has been in the business for two years and dreams of continuing her business with improvements until her child reaches college studies.

She is asking from KIVA lenders the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional capital to provide her livestock their feed supply. She will utilize the loan in the maintenance of her business that will eventually be helpful in sending her child to school. She will work hard and be alert to help grow her business and reach out for her dreams someday.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
“ If there’s a will, there’s a way”  is the guiding principle of Monica L., a mother living in Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. High school was her highest educational attainment, as her parents could not afford to finance her college education. Despite of it, she found a job and helped her parents  earn a living. When she is 24, she married Julio L. and they are blessed with two children whom they called Julius L. and Jesica L.. Both of them are now in secondary school. They want that their children to finish a degree so that they will someday find good jobs and have a bright future. In this regard, this couple is striving hard to earn income to satisfy their needs and finance their childrens education. 

Her husband is one of the farmers in Brgy. He cultivates their farm by planting rice and variety of vegetables twice a year while Monica engages in selling soft drinks and ice in their village. She will use the loan that she has requested from one of the Microfinance organization, as capital in acquiring her products. Every week, she is able to sold 10-15 cases of soft drinks, earning a net income of Php 600.00 which she uses to acquire their daily needs, finance the school fees of their children, and pay her weekly loan amortization. Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, she needs to earn more income to satisfy and meet their needs. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of Php 8,000.00 to strengthen her capital in the improvement of her business. With the loan amount, she would able to purchase more soft drinks to sell. She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, she can improve her business and support the studies of their children.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase more soft drinks

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: This is Arlyn B., a young businesswoman who lives among the poor communities in Parola, Tondo, Manila. She is 33 years old and her husband, Emilio, 35, works for a construction firm. They have six children: the eldest is in high school, four are in grade school, and the youngest stays at home. Arlene started cooking and selling food items and other goodies to her neighbors last year. She sells rice cakes, finger foods, snacks, burgers and fruit shakes and earns close to P10,000 a month. Her earnings answer for their daily basic needs. Arlene is now in need of a loan of P8,000 to buy food ingredients. She is also set to buy a small grill for cooking burgers. She dreams of having her own permanent place of business, more like a restaurant. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients and a burger grill

loans.name: Viseth

texts.en:
Mr.Viseth E., 40 and his wife, Mrs. Muyteang Eang, 38, married in 1990. They have 4 children: 1 son and 3 daughters. One of thE. has full-time employment in Phnom Penh City, two are in school, and other one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Viseth has been a goldsmith since he was married. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Viseth doesn’t have enough material for operating the business, so he is requesting his first loan of US$ 300 to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his goldsmith business

loans.name: Exal Eviar

texts.es:
El señor Exal Evir R. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la renta de sonido y perifoneo, le está haciendo falta un mejor y moderno equipo de sonido, ya que tiene varios eventos para animaciones en las posados, desea que sus clientes tengan un buena presencia de su trabajo.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el equipo de sonido, y planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que su esposa la señora Esthela Isaura Juárez se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso de su trabaja como empleada de una compañía de autos.
texts.en:
Exal Evir R. has dedicated himself to the rental of audio (stereos, speakers) equipment for more than three years. He is in need of better and more modern equipment, as he has several events scheduled and wants his customers to have a good experience with regard to his work. He requests this loan to buy sound equipment, and he plans to make his payments using income generated from his business. He can accomplish this since his wife, Esthela Isaura Juárez, is in charge of covering the family’s household expenses using the income from her job at a car company.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for his work.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias D. is from the village of Purok 4, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. He is 54 years old. Jeremias is married. To make a living, Jeremias provides waste-management services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Jeremias has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jeremias joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeremias has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jeremias is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. It is Jeremias' discretion to lower his loan amount. This will be the second loan taken out by Jeremias from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 35 years old. He is married and has four children. He has a business in Gaza City in Palestine buying and selling electronics, such as televisions and DVDs. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his turnover of goods. In the future, he hopes to open more branches of his business.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo quesillo está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Rosa Carolina L. quien vende ropa, Anielka P. M. tiene una pulpería y Gladis María V. José tiene una modesta tortillería.

Ellas son tres señoras que desde muy jóvenes han aprendido a ganarse el pan de cada día y que han luchado mucho por el bienestar de sus hijos. Estas invertirán el crédito para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Quesillo" group is made up of three, hard-working, women: Rosa Carolina L., who sells clothing; Anielka P. M., who has a small grocery store, and Gladis María V. José, who has a modest tortilla shop. They are three women who learned from a very early age how to earn their daily bread and have struggled mightily for their children's well-being. They will use the funds to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial, de 30 años, vive feliz al lado de su esposa Elsa (26) y de sus 2 hijos; Jafet de 6 y Jhonfranco de 3 años, en una acogedora casa (propia) en un populoso distrito de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 4 años, este ingeniero civil de profesión, se dedica a la elaboración de moldes de madera para el encofrado de las veredas y sardineles de las calles. Las municipalidades distritales lo contratan para que trabaje en la construcción de nuevos proyectos para lo que contrata a personas que lo ayudan. A Marcial le gusta desempeñarse en esta labor porque las ganancias son muy buenas y lo hace con pasión. 
Para el futuro, tiene pensado constituir una empresa contratista de construcción, además ya está tramitando los que exige la ley para trabajar sin problemas.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, ya que tiene planeado sacar más préstamos con esta entidad. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar triplay y listones para seguir con la elaboración de sus moldes de construcción y terminar de tramitar los documentos para su empresa.
texts.en:
Marcial, 30, lives happily at the side of his 26 year old wife, Elsa, and their two children. Jafet is six, and Jhonfranco is 3. They live in a cozy house (their own) in a densely populated district in the city of Lima. He is a civil engineer, and for four years he has been making molds for the wood casings for the sidewalks and curbs on the streets. The district municipalities contract him to work on the construction of new projects. People are contracted to help him. Marcial likes to do this work because the earnings are very good. He is passionate about his work. In the future he plans to build a contract construction business. He is already dealing with what the law requires so that he can work without problems. This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to be punctual with each one of his payments because he plans on taking out more loans from this entity. He will use the money he is requesting to buy plywood and wooden strips to keep making his construction molds and to finish dealing with the documents for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and an eatery. She lives in Prk. Bombills, Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, with her husband Rodrigo, who is 53 years old.  She has six children, two of whom are adults.  The remaining four are currently attending school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and eatery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $150.

Myrna is now borrowing 13,000 PHP so that she can buy supplies and inventory for the general store and eatery. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Myrna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy supplies and restock inventory

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is from the village of Galingon, Tampilisan. She is 43 years old. Rosemarie is married and has adult children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juanita Nayiri

texts.es:
La señora es trabajador activo desde hace 4 años en un bufet desempeñándose como abogado dando servicios legales y gestión de cobro 

Este crédito que solicito es  para compra de materiales de contruccion como perlines, zinc, madera.
texts.en:
She has been an active worker for four years in a firm. She works as a lawyer, and she provides legal services and debt recovery. The loan she is requesting is to buy construction materials like beams, zinc, and wood.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like beams, zinc, and wood

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona G. is from the village of Aloran. She is 33 years old. Alona is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alona owns and operates a snack-vending business, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Alona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Alona is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alona from PMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory  and working capital

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela H., 58, is a single parent with three children. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been into managing a variety store for quite some time. She mainly buys and sells basic commodities like groceries, rice and the like to her neighbors.

Adela has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 16,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by allowing her to buy more stock to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying more stock to be incorporated into her current product inventory

loans.name: Siriyawathi

texts.en:
Siriyawathi is a 52-year-old  woman living in Telijjawila, part of the Matara district of Sri Lanka, with her husband and three children.  She has one son and two daughters, and they are ages 31, 28, and 26 years old.

Siriyawathi has managed her tea leaf business for three years.  She buys tea leaves from a tea factory, then packages and sells them to her customers. 

She has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business by purchasing more tea leaves.

Thank you for taking time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy tea leaves

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Monsieur Kokouvi K. owns a restaurant in Lomé, Togo. He has owned his restaurant since 2007. Kokouvi is married and his wife also works in the restaurant.  They have two children. He is 40 years-old. 

Kokouvi has requested a loan of 300,000 CFA to purchase a freezer and other products for his restaurant. This is his first time seeking a loan from Kiva partner WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and food products.

loans.name: Hilda
