texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Hilda, tiene 34 años,  es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, ella se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de tejidos  como mantas, fajas y chullos y vende a los turistas que visitan la ciudad, invierte 1000 de dólares en la mercadería que compra  de la ciudad de Lima o ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 8 años que lleva este oficio, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio y va comprar más mercadería. El anhelo de la socia es convertirse en una comerciante.
texts.en:
Upon visiting the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank we talked with a member, Hilda. She is 34, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of Chinchero in the Cusco department. She makes and sells weavings like blankets, shawls, and “chullos” (article of clothing for the head). She sells to the tourists who visit the city. She invests 1,000 dollars on the merchandise that she buys from the city of Lima or the city of Cusco. She has been in this occupation for eight years. Being a member of the Fundación has greatly helped her to improve herself and to make her business grow. She will use the new loan to stock her business and buy more merchandise. The member’s aspiration is to become a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like blankets and "chullos" (article of clothing for the head), etc.

loans.name: Efraín Ernesto

texts.es: Efraín Ernesto D. C. de 45 años de edad, es una persona muy alegre y responsable quien esta muy orgullos de su extensa familia, su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres D. hogar, y cuatro hijas de 15, 12, 9 y 8 años de edad, las cuales todas se dedican a estudiar, razón por la que Efraín hace siempre su mayor esfuerzo en su trabajo, ya que el desea que sus hijas tengan un mejor futuro. Efraín reside junto a su familia en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual esta ubicado su negocio, el cual es una panadería en donde elabora varios tipos de pan dulce y pan Frances, conocido también como pan baguette. A pesar que su negocio solo tiene cinco años de existir, el ha ido abriéndose camino y dándose a conocer de la mejor manera, ya que es muy responsable a la hora de entregar sus pedidos y por elaborar pan a muy buenos precios. Efraín solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de mejorar su negocio, comprando nuevas herramientas para la elaboración D. pan, así mismo realizar algunas mejoras a la zona asignada para la panadería, mejorando el techo, el piso y las paredes. De esta forma él espera mejorar su rendimiento en el trabajo, ya que podrá sentirse de una forma más cómoda en el lugar que realiza el pan. Efraín es un padre muy responsable quien trabaja muy duro para darle todo lo necesario a su familia, de manera que no les haga falta lo esencial en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Efraín Ernesto D. C., age 45, is a very happy and responsible person who is very proud of his extensive family. His wife devotes herself to the household chores and their four children; ages 15, 12, 9, and 8. The children go to school. This is the reason that Efraín always puts his greatest effort in his work. He wants his daughters to have a better future. Efraín lives with his family in the Ilopango municipality. This is where his business is located. He has a bakery where he makes various types of sweet breads and French breads, also know as baguettes. Even though he has only had his business for five years, he has been finding his way and getting to know the best way. He is very responsible about delivering his orders on time, and he makes bread at very good prices. Efraín is asking Integral for a loan in the hopes of improving his business. He will buy new tools for making bread. He will also make some improvements in the area allocated for the bakery. He will improve the roof, the floor, and the walls. This way he hopes to improve his work performance. He will be able to feel more comfortable in the place where he makes bread. Efraín is a very responsible father who works very hard to give his family the necessities. This way they will not lack the essentials in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for making bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy the essential materials for farming.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is 34 years old and married with two children.  Philomene is commonly known for selling clothes and she has been in this business for about one year.  Her business hours are from 8 am to 8 pm every day.

Philomene needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  Once given this loan, Philomene will purchase different styles of clothes.  With this additional business, Philomene will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.  In addition, she will create many sources of income in various areas, which will result in giving jobs to the people from her community.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothes

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta P. is into the sale of smoked fish at Takoradi. Atta has been educated to the senior high level.  She lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a palm wine tapper.  She helps her husband in educating her children. The acquisition of the loan will enable her to buy more fish to be able to supply more to her increasing customers. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy more fish to be processed for sale

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz;  La socia tiene 27 años de edad;  ella es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos y se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar e implementar su tienda abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.   

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for Victory), which is located in the district of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Luz is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She manages a grocery store and needs a loan to increase her inventory and keep her store in operation. Luz is requesting this loan so that she can purchase basic necessities.

She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities to restock her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 53 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she raises and sells pigs from her own farm. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for hog raising. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda D. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Imelda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. has four children and is a palm oil and kernel extractor at Abura. She has a senior high level of education. Elizabeth has been in this trade for five years. Elizabeth uses her income to see to the upkeep of the home. Elizabeth says the loan will help her to extend her business. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To help her to extend her business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 40 years old. Jovelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn grows and sells rice, which is her main source of income. Jovelyn has been farming for over 16 years.

Jovelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials

loans.name: Trần

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị (20213020013) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children.  To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs and spices in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by L. from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Trần Thị (20213020013) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  phụ thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda C. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Luzminda is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods,  beverages & instant noodles in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Victoria Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas. 

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Victoria, ella tiene 41 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijas de 16 y 5 años, la mayor esta en colegio y la menor en escuela.
 
 Al verse sola con los gastos de su familia y mucho mas con los gastos de la escuela ella decidió instalar en su casa un pequeño bazar en el que vende bisutería y otras cosas, en la actualidad desea comprar ropa para la venta ya que con lo que gana con los artículos que vende no le alcanza para los gastos que ella tiene, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 08h30 hasta las 16h00.

Este crédito es para comprar más cosas de bazar además de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otras prendas de vestir. Está en el banco comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta los créditos y la facilidad para conseguirlos. Sus sueños son tener un buen trabajo y darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Here we find Victoria, 41, a single mother of two daughters who are 16 and 5 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.

When she found herself alone with all the family expenses to take care of and later even more with educational costs she decided to set up a small store in her house to sell costume jewelry and other things.  She currently wants to buy clothes to sell because what she earns selling the other things just isn’t enough to cover her expenses.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8:30am until 4:00pm.

This loan is to buy more things for the store like pants, blouses, t-shirts and other articles of clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for two cycles and she likes the loans and the ease with which one can get them.  Her dreams are to have a good job and to provide the best for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store: costume jewelry, pants, blouses, t-shirts and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es: Nilo tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y ha demostrado ser un hombre muy trabajador. Su actividad económica es la venta de hot- dog, hamburguesas, refrescos naturales, además de tener este negocio también se dedica a brindar el servicio de recargas telefónicas. El se hace cargo de la buena administración de su negocio por lo que sabe muy bien cómo utilizar sus recursos.  Inicia este porque no tenía un medio ingreso para sufragar en su hogar. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de recargas, jugos gaseosas, bolsitas y refrescos naturales.
texts.en: Nilo has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and has shown he is a very hardworking man. His earns his living by selling hotdogs, hamburgers and natural juice drinks. In addition to this business, he also offers a phone credit top-up service. He is responsible for the correct administration of his business and is therefore well aware of how to use his resources. He started the business because he didn't have any means of earning income to cover his household costs. The loan he is requesting is to buy phone credit, fizzy drinks, small bags and natural juice drinks.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.es:
Karina tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Víctor Raul, una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, la zona en bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside y al público en general. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Karina desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales con la compra de alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión ella espera lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo para que sean vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old, married, and lives with her family in Víctor Raul sector: a marginal, urban area in Lambayeque region.  This area is quite well known for its commercial activity and is located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Karina works raising and selling young animals.  She raises poultry in an area behind her home.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.  She also sells to the general public.  She uses the profits she makes from this business to help her husband with their family's finances.

Karina would like to improve her feeding of her animals by purchasing balanced animal feed.  She hopes that this investment will help her animals to develop better and be sold for a better price.  In order to achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To improve her feeding of her animals by purchasing balanced animal feed

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
If one would dream for one’s self or one’s family, why not dream for the best? Anie Valerio, 40, dreams for the best, but more than that, she acts to make it a reality. Anie is married to Manolito Valerio, a Liason Officer. They have two children who are currently in high school and college.

Anie runs her own small restaurant for a year now.  She mobilizes members of her family to help her. It is quite easy for her to manage since it is a residential business, and there is not much need at present to hire employees.  Her customers are her neighbors and the entire community. She earns at least Php11,000 estimated net income every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a Php15,000 loan. She plans to use this to buy raw ingredients, sacks of rice, and other materials needed for her restaurant operation. Anie takes effort to maintain her business in good shape, because a profitable business translates to family needs being met and the schooling of her children being supported. 

She dreams of having good health for everyone in the family and able to send all her children all the way through college.  As CCT community partner, she is faithfully attending her weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.  She believes that if there is faith in God, and action, everything will be possible.
	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase needed ingredients and other materials to continue operation of her restaurant

loans.name: Nebasfeh

texts.en:
G. is married with two children. With a heavy responsibility on him as a husband to provide for his children and those of his family, he decided to become a GHAPE member. As a member he can obtain a loan and start up a business to raise money, to assist his wife, to pay school fees and to provide food for his children.

He was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline, and since then has shown a commitment to investing and repaying his loans. Given this loan, he plans to buy planks for furniture, and day old chicks. His business is very lucrative because he is in the commercial zone where he will always have customers. 

He plans to raise money to invest in an additional line of business and buy food for his family. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: day old chicks and planks

loans.name: Mirlet Del Pilar

texts.es:
Milrelt U. desde que  estudiaba en el colegio ayudaba a su madre en la comercialización de productos variados y siempre le fue muy bien,  por eso no fue difícil  que a sus 16 años lograra independizarse en el negocio y conseguir sus propios clientes especialmente en la línea  de cosméticos y productos de peluquería en general, a los que progresivamente ha ido agregando electrodomésticos menores y variados,  que exhibe directamente y/o mediante guías especializadas, eso si,  todos ellos  complementario a los productos que su madre  comercializa. 
Su máximo desafío es lograr integrar su crecimiento profesional con el empresarial, porque en la actualidad se prepara profesionalmente para construír un panorama futuro  muy exitosos. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a la línea de Kiva, para comprar planchas, cepillos, alicer, gorras perfumes, cremas y pulseras, esta inversión le generará aproximadamente el veinte por ciento de  utilidad,  desde el cual proyecta su crecimiento, porque  su meta es ampliar su negocio adicionando mejor infraestructura  y en el futuro  aspira  a tener su propia vivienda, por eso desde sus actuales 19 años de edad, trabaja persistentemente y con mucho entusiasmo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
After she finished her high school classes, Mirlet U. helped her mother sell various products and always did very well, so it was not difficult to manage the business on her own at the age of 16. She obtained her own customers, especially those who wanted to buy cosmetics and hair products. Mirlet added to her inventory various small appliances, which she demonstrated in person or through specialized catalogs. These products complement the merchandise being sold by her mother.

Her greatest challenge has been integrating her professional growth with her business. However, she is prepared to become a professional by building a successful outlook on her future. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as well as her first through Kiva. She will use the funds to buy irons, brushes, hair relaxers, hats, creams, and bracelets. This investment will generate approximately a 20% profit that will help her grow. Her goal is to expand her business by increasing her infrastructure. In the future, she aspires to own a home. Mirlet is currently 19 years old and works persistently and with great enthusiasm.

loans.use: Purchase irons, brushes, hair relaxers, hats, creams, and bracelets

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S. iis 30 years old and married, with three children. Two of them go to school. 

She is currently in the business of selling items like beans. She borrowed a loan to stock more items like beans to sell. 

She hopes to build a concrete house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more items like beans to sell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité pertenece al barrio Villa Bonita de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Unidas con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos hoy en día trabajan juntas para salir adelante.
Cada una de ellas dispone de sus propios microemprendimientos comerciales, tienen buena organización, sin embargo les es difícil realizar actividades grupales por los horarios, pues no coinciden, pero en la última reunión se comprometieron a realizarlas, ya que es un requisito de la Fundación dicha actividad.
Todos sus ahorros están depositados en una cooperativa, todas colaboran cuando una persona no está pudiendo pagar por algún inconveniente familiar.
Además se muestran muy agradecidas con nuestra empresa por la oportunidad brindada, ya que les sirve para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
La sra. Adelaida, quien es presidenta del comité, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y colonias, mediante este negocio ella se mantiene a si misma y a su familia, pero desea aumentar los ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida por ello solicita el crédito, para poder comprar en mayores cantidades los perfumes y a precios más económicos a modo de dejar un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
This committee is from Villa Bonita neighborhood, in the town of Villa Elisa.  Its members are united in their aim to increase their income.  They work together to get ahead.  Each one of the women has her own small business undertaking and their group is well organized.  However, it is difficult for them to carry out group activities because of their working hours which do not coincide.  During their last meeting, the women pledged to carry out some group activities since this is a requirement that Fundación Paraguaya imposes.  All the group's savings are deposited in a joint account.  They all work together when a member isn't able to pay due to family problems.  The members of this group are very grateful to our company for the opportunity we have offered them since it will help them to improve their income.

Adelaida is the president of this committee.  Her business is selling perfumes and cologne.  Through her business she supports herself and her family but she would like to increase her income so that she can improve her quality of life.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy her perfumes in larger quantities and for less money.  This will enable her to enjoy a larger profit margin.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cologne

loans.name: Hul's Group

texts.en:
There are five members making up this group loan. Mrs. Hul was born in 1974 and is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the others members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Hul is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice, peanuts and corn for a living. Currently, she wants to grow corn in the dry season, but she doesn't have enough money. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating corn.

Mrs. Hul is a widow with a child who is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating corn.

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eudocia; ella tiene 67 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y maíz, la socia también trabaja en la crianza de animales como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas y luego los vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Cusco y por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar sus negocios de venta de chicha, maíz y venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y para comprar maíz para hacer la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eudocia, age 67, is widowed and has one son. She is a member of the communal bank “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; the bank is located in the district Andahuaylillas of the Quispicanchis province which is part of the Cusco department.

Eudocia divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling chicha (a traditional drink made from corn). She also raises farm animals such as pigs and chickens, which she later sells in a market in the city of Cusco. By means of these small businesses, Eudocia has raised her son. 

Eudocia would like to improve her business and is looking for a loan to purchase feed for the animals and to buy corn for the production of chicha. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and to buy corn to make chicha (a traditiona corn-based drink)

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y ha sido muy productivo.  Tiene más de 4 años con este negocio, Carlos es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta  de su actividad ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre agradecen la atención y la buena calidad de sus productos. Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de repollo, bananos, naranjas, melones, mangos, sandias, papaya, pepinos, zanahorias, yuca entre otros.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel sells fruit and vegetables.  He’s been collaborating with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and he’s been very productive.  He’s had the business for over four years.  

Carlos is a very responsible man who enjoys his work since most of his customers always appreciate the attention and good quality of his products.

He will use the loan to buy cabbage, plantains, oranges, melons, mangoes, watermelons, papayas, cucumbers, carrots and manioc, among others.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, plantains, oranges, melons, mangoes, watermelons, papayas, cucumbers, carrots and manioc, among others.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a forty-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the hotel business for eight years. She started with 100,000 shillings and now has 800,000 shillings. Her biggest obstacle is lack of capital. Her vision is to own a big restuarant in town and educate her children. Janet needs the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Danilo Santiago

texts.en: Danilo Santiago is a 36-year-old married father of three children, ages 4, 9, and 12.  He owns a small tailoring business that produces various types of clothing.  The loan will be used to buy additional fabric to produce more clothes and grow the business.  Danilo Santiago’s dream is to be able to support and ultimately provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric to produce more clothes and grow the business

loans.name: Ilma

texts.es: Ilma de treinta y ocho años de edad vive con sus cuatro hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela cerca de la localidad. Ella posee un negocio de venta de zapatos y agua; ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene calzado de todo tipo y estilo para dama, caballero, niños y niñas por supuesto de muy buena calidad a un buen precio; Ilma es una mujer muy carismática y entregada a su trabajo su objetivo es hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a IINTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar variedad de zapatos para dama y caballero y de esta forma satisfacer siempre las necesidades de sus clientes. Ilma tiene fe que todo su trabajo le permita darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Ilma is 38 years old.  She lives with her four children who attend a school near their town.  Ilma has a business selling shoes and water.  She has a lot of customers.  People like her business because she has all kinds and styles of footwear for men, women, boys and girls.  Of course, they are very good quality and she sells them at a good price.

Ilma is a very charismatic woman who is committed to her work.  Her goal is to grow her business and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy a variety of shoes for men and women so that she can always meet her customers' needs.  Ilma believes that her work will allow her to provide her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy shoes and water

loans.name: Usmonali

texts.en:
Usmonali has a car and provides transportation services. He has been in this business for 2 years he has gained reach experience. The business is stable and generates the main considerable income for Usmoali’s family, allowing for improvement of their living conditions.  Currently Usmonali wants to buy a new car. That’s why he is seeking a loan of 4700 TJS.  Usmonali thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new car of “Tico” brand

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es: María Pilar, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casada  y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar una vaca para la producción de leche. Ella cuenta con el terreno para la explotación de ganado, ella quiere lograr producir leche para el consumo de la casa y lo demás venderlo para generar un ingreso extra. Ella tiene como meta ir generando ganancias para tal vez si se dan las cosas en el futuro seguir comprando vaquitas de leche y poder aumentar la producción y poder generar mayores ganancias para su bienestar familiar.  Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Pilar is 41 years old, married, and lives with her three children and husband who are her main priorities in life.  She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow for producing milk.  She has a plot of land suitable for raising cattle on.  She would like to manage to produce milk for her household's consumption and sell the rest to make additional income.  Her goal is to make profits so that, if things go well in the future, she will be able to continue buying dairy cows,  increase her production and make more profits for her family.

This is María Pilar's second loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have given her this loan with easier repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 47 years old and lives in Kakata. He is married and has four children ages 1 to 27. All of the children are presently in school. For the past three years, Jackson has been operating a provisions shop where he sells many items like candles, soap, and rice among other items. He is requesting a loan to purchase a motor bike to be used for commercial purposes. He plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a motor bike

loans.name: Goharik

texts.ru:
Гоарик родилась в 1959 г. в селе Дастакерт, Сюникского регона, где она окончила среднюю школу, а затем и Араратский химико-технологический техникум, где получила специальность химико-технолога. 
В данной момент Гоарик проживает в селе Доврус и работает в сельской общине. Гоарик замужем, имеет сына и дочь, которая уже замужем и живет отдельно от родителей. Муж Гоарик работает в Зангезурском медно-молибденовом комбинате строителем. 
На протяжении долгих лет Гоарик разводит крупный рогатый скот, овец, а также выращивает овощи и фрукты. Ее сын помагает Гоарик на ферме. Также они арендуют небольшой участок земли, где они пасут своих коров и овец.
Выращенные овощи и фрукты Гоарик и ее семья продают на Капанском городском рынке, а говядину, баранину и молоко они продают прямо на своей ферме, а также отдают скупщикам с городского рынка. 
Благодаря сельскохозяйственной деятельности Гоарик и ее семья смогли приобрести грузовичок, при помощи которого они перевозят свою продукцию с фермы на городской рынок. 
Сумма кредита в 1.000.000 необходима Гоарик для покупки нескольких свиней, комбинированного корма для них, приобретения дизельного топлива, а также для покупки сельскохозяйственных средств для уборки сена.
texts.en:
Goharik was born in 1959 in the village Dastakert, in the Syunik region, where she graduated from high school and then from the Wine and Chemical Engineering College, where she received her degree in chemical engineering. 

Now, Goharik lives in Dovrus village and works in a rural community. Goharik is married and has a son and a daughter who are both married and live separately from their parents. Her husband works in the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Factory as a builder. 

For many years Goharik has bred cattle and sheep and grown vegetables and fruit. Her son helps Goharik on the farm. Also, they rent a small plot of land where they graze their cows and sheep. 

Goharik and her family sell the vegetables and fruit they produce in the Kapan city market, and their beef, mutton, and milk they sell from their farm, often to buyers who take the products to the big city markets. 

Due to the work on the farm, Goharik and her family were able to purchase a truck with which they transport their produce from the farm to the city market. 

Goharik needs a loan of 1,000,000 drams to buy a few pigs, fodder for them, diesel fuel, and everything necessary to harvest hay.

loans.use: to buy a few pigs, fodder for them, diesel fuel, and everything necessary to harvest hay.

loans.name: Vecitascion

texts.en: Vecitascion, a 55-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has a food shop that sells viands such as afritada and caldereta. In business for 10 years, Vecitascion has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make more viands to sell. A new member of HSPFI, she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Madame Alima est une femme mariée de 51ans et mère de 5 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans la ville de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne, très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Alima après avoir tenté plusieurs activités notamment l’achat et la vente de chaussures, mais sans succès, décide de se spécialiser dans l’achat vente des produits céréaliers tels l’arachide. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son époux.
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 années, elle maîtrise bien son activité et est très appréciée des ménagères et des transformatrices d’arachides en pâte, cacahouète,  etc .
Pour agrandir son entreprise, elle décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est à sa première expérience.
Alima compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, 10 sacs d’arachides.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni auprès des grossistes et dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs en période des récoltes. Alima effectue sa vente en détail au comptant et à crédit au marché de Bougouni à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA servira payer le prêt, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et investir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Madame Alima is a 51 year-old married mother of five, who lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou quarter of Bougouni. She did not attend a modern school, and so soon began to generate profits by selling various goods for a living. Alima tried her hand at various types of work, including buying and selling shoes, but with limited success, so she decided to specialise in the sale of cereals such as peanuts. She learned her trade from her husband. 
With around 5 years' experience she is successful in her trade and highly regarded by housewives and peanut-butter producers. 
She is seeking her first loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to boost her business. She aims to use her loan to purchase 10 bags of peanuts. She sources her goods from wholesalers in Bougouni and from peanut growers in the neighbouring villages. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will repay the loan, contribute to her family's expenses and be invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его сын находится в России на заработках. Сам он более семи лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdulkosim, 56, lives in Tajikistan's Jomi region. He is married with four children. His son works in Russia. Abdulkosim breeds cattle. He is applying for a loan to purchase a few cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a few cattle

loans.name: Luz Andrea

texts.es:
A sus 31 años de edad Luz Andrea es una luchadora incansable que desde hace algunos meses tiene su propio negocio, vende comidas rápidas como perros calientes y hamburguesas, labor que desempeña diariamente de 5:00 p.m. 11:00 p.m. pues en este horario hay buenas ventas y ha tenido la ventaja de estar tener su negocio al lado del de su madre, pues así se apoyan entre ellas y se cuidan la una a la otra.

Luz Andrea actualmente debe comprar insumos para la producción de alimentos, como pan, carnes frías, desechables y gas, por lo cual hoy solicita un préstamo, con el cual hacer esta inversión, mejorar las ventas, y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 31, Luz Andrea is an incessant fighter who has had her own business for a few months. She sells fast foods, such as hot dogs and hamburgers. She works every day from 5pm to 11pm. This is the time when the sales are good and she has had the advantage of having a business beside her mother's. They help each other and they take care of one another. 

Luz Andrea currently needs to purchase ingredients to product her foods, such as bread, cold meats, disposable products and propane gas. This is why she requests a loan and upon making this investment she will improve her sales and consequently she will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare fast foods.

loans.name: Esa

texts.en:
Esa is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling chips.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    She needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or $83 per week) to improve the business.

In 2011, Esa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en: Abdel Karim is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and 6 children. He has been working as a construction laborer for the past 18 years, specializing in completing wall foliage work.  In parallel, he used to serve in the Lebanese army and is still benefiting from his retirement compensation.  Even so, he suffers from an unsatisfactory financiA. situation. So today, he is requesting to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A. l to purchase wood and cement for his business.  In the future he is planning to work closely with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy wood and cement

loans.name: Etanislada Norma

texts.es:
La señora Etanislada vive en el municipio de Telica en León donde trabaja con muchos niños siendo maestra de primaria de un colegio municipal y se siente muy contenta porque el trabajar con los niños le ha enseñado muchas cosas y siente que ésta es su vocación. 

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, hierro, cemento y pago de la mano de obra para mejorar la condición actual de su vivienda porque requiere mejorarla y así proporcionar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida. De esta manera logra sus metas y continúa dedicándose a la labor de maestra de los niños de la comunidad que tanto ama ella.
texts.en:
Etanislada lives in the Telica Municipality in León where she works with many children as a primary school teacher in a municipal school. She is very happy because she has learned a lot from teaching children, and she feels that this is the right career for her.  
 
She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as corrugated metal sheeting, iron, cement, and wages for hired help to improve the condition of her home because she needs to improve it. Thus she can provide a better quality of life to her family. This way, she will achieve her goals and continue dedicating herself to the work of being a teacher for the children in the community that she loves so much.

loans.use: purchase material for construction such as corrugated metal sheeting, iron, and cement.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Arlen has a shop that sells electronic loads for different networks such as GLOBE and SMART. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads for different networks.
Arlen has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads for different networks.

loans.name: Jamesetta

texts.en:
Jamesetta is 38 years old and lives in Paynesville,   She is a high school graduate and is married to an engineer with whom she has five children aged  two to 19 years old.  All of her children attend school, except for the youngest one.

For the past two years Jamesetta has been selling sugar, onions, and flour at the market.  She started her business with loan that she received from Kiva field partner BRAC.  Jamesetta plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy sugar, onions, and flour in bulk.  She hopes to become as international businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy sugar, onions, and flour in bulk

loans.name: Maharagwe A W Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Maharagwe A W. group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Beatrice takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her  family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Beatrice will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Maharagwe A W. group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Beatrice is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia, de 22 años de edad es casada tiene tres hjos,y se dedica a la venta de tortillas los tres tiempos desde hace tres años,nos cuenta que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña por mayor ya que esi se lo dan mas barato,y le que mas ganancia y otro de las cosas nos cuenta que sus clientes han aumentado,le da gracias a Dios por su negocio y le agradese a Fape y kiva por el apoyo que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia is 22 years old and married with three children. She makes a living selling tortillas during three seasons and has been doing so for three years. She is asking for a loan to purchase corn and firewood in bulk, as it is cheaper that way and she can make better profits. 

She has reported getting more customers. She thanks God for her business and is grateful to FAPE and Kiva for the support they provide.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood in bulk to make tortillas.

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de San Pedro se unieron con la esperanza de salir adelante, por medio del trabajo en conjunto y la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que se esfuerzan siempre por sus familias. Se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y desean llegar a máximo nivel.
Una de las miembros es la señora Mirtha, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser cerdos y gallinas. Por medio de esto ella puede salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Uno de sus sueños es tener una granja grande donde tener muchos animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños para la cría, como así también alimento para los mismos. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
12 women from the city of San Pedro got together hoping to get ahead by working together and by receiving help from the Paraguayan Foundation. They are very hard working and industrious women who always make an effort for their families. They are in the first level of the female entrepreneur program and want to get to the highest one.
Mirtha is one of the members. She works breeding animals such as pigs and chickens. By doing this she can get ahead and help her relatives. She describes herself as a very hard working and enterprising woman. She dreams of having a big farm in which to have many animals.
She is requesting the loan to buy young animals for breeding, as well as feed for them. She is thankful to the Foundation and Kiva for the opportunities they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding and selling and the feed for them.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Narciso buys vegetables such as eggplants and string-beans and peddles them. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Narciso is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Narciso hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca forma parte del Banco comunal “Esmeralda” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano.
Ella se dedica a preparar variedad de alimentos dependiendo de la temporada. Durante el año realiza empanadas, tortas, dulces, entre otras comidas. Actualmente realiza humitas (masa envuelta de hojas de maíz), pastel de choclo (pasta de maíz al horno) y también mote con huesillo. Se desempeña en éste rubro desde hace 12 años.
Comenta que tuvo un local de comida rápida, sin embargo posterior al terremoto del 27 de febrero de 2010, su negocio fue asolado. Por ahora prepara sus comidas en la comodidad de su casa. Hace entregas directas en los domicilios de sus clientes, de acuerdo a los pedidos que realicen. Francisca se dedica a su negocio de lunes a sábado con un horario flexible. Sus insumos los compra en la vega monumental (feria libre que abastece comerciantes).
Con el crédito comprará cebollas, choclos (maíz) y huevos, al por mayor.
Una de las metas para su negocio es instalarse nuevamente con un local establecido (amasandería), para esto debe esperar la reconstrucción de su casa.
Francisca vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 28 y 18 años de edad, el mayor estudia la carrera de pedagogía en filosofía y su hija menor comenzará a estudiar en la Universidad éste año.
El sueño de Francisca es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
El grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido, responsable y comprometido. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, comenta que le han servido para mejorar algunas estrategias de contabilidad.
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Biobío, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en:
Francisca is part of the communal bank "Esmeralda", which is in the city of Talchuaho.
She prepares a variety of food, depending on the season.  During the year, she makes empanadas, cakes, candies, and other foods.
She is currently making humitas (dough wrapped in corn leaves), pastel de choclo (baked corn pastry), and a peach and husked wheat drink.  She has been working in this way for 12 years.
She says that she had a fast food business.  However, the earthquake on the 27th of February, 2010, destroyed her business.  For now, she prepares her foods in the comfort of her home.  She delivers directly to the homes of her customers, according to the orders that they make.  Francisca works at her business from Monday through Saturday with a flexible schedule.  She buys her ingredients at the large market (an open air fair that the merchants set up).
She will buy onions, corn, and eggs at wholesale with the loan.
One of her goals for her business is to settle into a new business establishment.  She must wait for the reconstruction of her house, though.
Francisca lives with her husband and her two children who are 28 and 18 years old.  The older one studies philosophy and his younger sister will begin studying at the university this year.
Francisa's dream is that her children become professionals.
She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza is offering to her, since it will allow her to invest in her business.
The communal bank that she is part of is very tight-knit, responsible, and committed.  In respect to the training that is given at the communal bank meetings, she says that they have taught her to use better accounting strategies.
Talcahuano is a town and city-port in the Biobío region, in southern Chile.  It is know as one of the main ports in the country.  It's name, in mapudungun (the mapuche language) means "thundering sky".  It has a very attractive, natural passage, due to the combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows, and the mountainous bodies, with beautiful vegetation.  Its economy revolves around the port, its naval base, and an important industrial district with companies of iron and steel, petroleum refinery, petrochemistry, cement, gas, etc.

loans.use: buy onions, corn, and eggs at wholesale.

loans.name: Tannia Jacinta

texts.es: Tannia de 30 años vive (libertad ecuador)  el negocio que ella desempeña es familiar. Con mucho esfuerzo ella realiza su trabajo sola, limpiando y arregalando la paja para la venta de de sonbreros. Su trabajo no tiene horario ya que se queda hasta tarde. Lo que le impide trabajar bien es la lluvia . a futuro ella desea tener su casa propia. Con el préstamo desea comprar(paja toquilla) para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tannia is 30, and lives in Libertad, Ecuador. The business she carries on is a family business. She does her work alone and with a great deal of effort, cleaning and organizing straw for to make into hats.  She has no fixed hours for her work, as she stays working until late in the day. What can prevent her from working well is the rain. 

In the future she wishes to have her own house. She will use the loan to buy toquilla straw, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy toquilla straw.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 48 years old and a farmer who raises cattle. He is married and has four children, and all are in school. He has been raising cattle for the last ten years. He also earns an income through farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya his lifestyle has improved. He hopes that one day he will expand his business and raise more livestock. He requires a loan of 84,442 KES to buy sheep, cows and goats.

loans.use: to buy sheep, cows and goats.

loans.name: Jessica Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  21 De Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres  hijos de 8, 7 y 1  años de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Jessica con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar en el cual muchos comerciantes venden sus productos y donde hay una gran afluencia de personas que acuden a comprar lo que necesitan, ella trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h30 a 18h00,  lleva 5 años dedicada a esta actividad la misma que le deja lo necesario para que sus hijos tengan una buena crianza.
Este crédito es  para comprar carteras en muchas variedades. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó el negocio que hoy le permite ganarse la vida. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for years as the city of Reales Tamarindos, the partners of the Grupo de Crédito 21 De Julio meet every fifteen days. This is where Jessica lives. She is 30 years old, and is a single mother of three children, ages 8, 7, and 1. The older children are in school. She lives in her parents’ home.

Jessica, with the intention of earning a living and thus being able to get ahead, works in commerce. She has a stall in the center of the city, a place in which many merchants sell their products and where there is a large influx of people coming to buy what they need. She works from Monday to Saturday from 8:30 am to 6:00 pm. She has been in this occupation for 5 years; it gives her what is necessary for her children to have a good upbringing.

This loan is to buy purses in many varieties. She has been with the Grupo de Crédito for 9 years, and she likes it because with the loans she started the business that today allows her to earn a living. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: buy purses.

loans.name: Phillipsonne

texts.fr:
Phillipsonne va clôturer son prêt. Elle a pu augmenter et diversifier les marchandises à vendre dans son épicerie. Elle a deux points de vente maintenant avec un employé qui l’aide. Elle fait beaucoup d’épargne actuellement avec les bénéfices afin de construire une maison. 
Pour ce prêt, elle compte augmenter le stock de produits locaux et va acheter  du maïs, du riz et des haricots. En effet, avec les deux lieux de vente, elle a besoin de prêt pour renforcer son capital. Elle est très contente d’avoir bénéficié des prêts qui ont contribué à l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.

loans.use: Acheter des produits locaux tels que du riz, du maîs et des haricots pour renforcer le capital de son épicerie

loans.name: Santos Cornelia Casc

texts.en: My name is Santos Casco and I make and sell delicious nacatamelas, one of our typical foods.  In the last months my business has grown since I have received many more orders.  My business clients say that the flavour of my nacatamales is unique which is made better by my kind, charming customer service.  I also sell my nacatamales to my neighbours.

loans.use: Buying corn, banana leafs, raisins, potatoes, lard, string and condiments

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Madam Martha is a farmer. She produces lots of agricultural products such as garden eggs, green beans, black pepper, cabbages and lettuce among others. She has been trained in basic farm management skills using the TEACH lending methodology of Kraban Support Foundation. She wants a loan facility of $600 from Kiva to improve her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa D/O Burhan Din was born in 1963 and lives in District 6 of Kabul City. She is married and has five family members. She and her husband have a grocery and vegetable shop. In the beginning, her husband just sold vegetables, and it was difficult to meet their daily expenses. When Sharifa finished her first loan cycle, they were able to open a grocery store, buy groceries from the main market in Kabul and sell them at their shop. This made them better able to meet expenses. Now Sharifa is ready to begin her second loan cycle so they can continue to improve their business and meet the needs of their family.

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, flour, tea, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will invest the loan in buying two new computers and a photocopier.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary A. is a 43 year old woman  with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions & foodstuffs to her community. Mary has been with LAPO for 5 years and she is proud of being a client. She hopes to improve her business and purchase a refrigerator with the requested loan. She has been in this business since 1992.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale and to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: Alusine is 45 years old and married with 6 children. He has been running his business for 4 years, and the small loans from SMT enabled him to expand his business. Alusine is very grateful for the loans obtained from SMT because he is now able to generate income to meet his family’s expenses.  He is planning for a refrigerator to cool the drinks to enable him to make good sales during the summer.  He is therefore requesting a $375 loan to get a refrigerator.

loans.use: Expand his business to offer cold drinks during the summer months.

loans.name: Sarin Group

texts.en:
These three families live in a village along the Mekong River about thirty kilometers north of Phnom Penh.  They are requesting their first group loan from Maxima to buy silk material for silk production.  
  
1- Mrs. S. Sarin (age 48 – left in photo with her husband) and her husband (age 48) have been married since 1994.  They have one daughter who studies in the local school. Her husband has been repairing wooden houses since 1990. Sarin has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She is requesting her first loan from Maxima in the amount of $350. She will use this loan to purchase silk material for her weaving.

2- Mrs. S. Sarim (age 60- right in photo with her husband) and her husband (age 70) have been married since 1970.  They have six children—two sons and four daughters.  Like Asarin, Sarim has been weaving since she was young. Her husband grows rice. She is requesting her first loan from Maxima in the amount of $100. She will use this loan to purchase silk material for her weaving.
    
3- Miss. P. Sreyna (age 23- picture in the middle with her aunt) is single and lives with her aunt. Sreyna has been a silk weaver since she was 13 years old. It’s skill she leaned from her mother. She is requesting her first loan from Maxima in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk material for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Nabweru South Ii(B) Group

texts.en:
This group of women has been together for fifteen months. They each have their own businesses. Linda makes and sells snacks. She wants to pay the school fees for her children with the extra business profits she earns. Edith wants to increase the inventory in her retail shop. Madina sells fresh foods. Mariam sells raw foods.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add to their business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina T. is 48 years old, married, with five children, ages 7 to 30 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 30 years old. Paulina owns a food vending store that she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in furniture.

loans.name: Elsa Enedelia

texts.es:
Elsa is 38 years old and is married and has two children. Her husband is an employee at a company. She started her business because she has always liked sales and also to increase her income and be independent from the money her husband would give her. Three years ago she started selling perfumes, doing demonstrations for her co-workers and neighbors who have now become faithful clients that buy from her frequently.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300, to be paid in 5 months, to purchase merchandise and to be able to deliver her pending orders. With your help she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Elsa tiene 38 años y es casada su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, tienen 2 hijos. Inicio su negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas además para ser independiente a lo que su marido le daba y así incrementar las entradas de dinero. Hace 3 años empezó con la venta de perfumes haciendo demostraciones con compañeras de trabajo y vecinas logrando así clientes fieles que le compran con frecuencia.

Solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder entregar los pedidos que ya tiene a tiempo. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en:
Yalchin H. is a 35-year-old man who has owned and operated a small farm since 1989. He is married and he has two children. On his farm, he raises calves, and he later sells the calves to the local bazaar traders.

Breeding and selling calves is the only source of income for his family, so he is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to expand his business operation and to thereby generate additional income for his family. With the loan proceeds, he will purchase two calves ($300 each) and fodder with the remaining $100.

loans.use: To expand his business and to generate additional income for his family by purchasing two calves and fodder

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Huy E., 48, is married and lives with her four children in the Kampong Cham province. Her husband is a farmer who makes around $1.60 each day, and three of her children work as well. Two of her children are farmers and one is a taxi driver. The agriculture industry has really suffered in Cambodia over the past year, as the climate has had unfavorable conditions and inflation has been high. Huy E. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a small truck for her son to run his business. With this purchase, the family believes that it can increase its income and raise the standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a small truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a planing machine and materials

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina is K. is a hard working market vendor from Nikolaev, Ukraine. She runs a small business selling leather clothing items in the local market place called "Kolos".  Several years ago, she recognized the value of being self-employed. She chose to sell practical and durable items that are always in demand. 

Yekaterina has requested a loan of 2500 Grivnas to open another market stall and increase her available working capital. We have been happy to provide Yekaterina with financial assistance in the past and look for to continuing to help her business grow and thrive in the future.

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To open another market stall

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Las Señoras del banco Comunal con el nombre de las "Mujeres Trabajadores " del Paraje Coxom, del Cantón Patzarajmac, del Municipio y Departamento de Totonicapán mayores de edad,  Casadas, Hace más de cinco (5) años vienen trabajando de comerciantes, en la venta de cortes típicos y  otras  en la  venta de articulos de consumo diario en donde cuenta con variedad de productos la cual ha venido progresando y satisfaciendo la necesidad de ellas y la de los vecinos del paraje  y se  acercaron a las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar un crédito grupal que será invertido para ampliar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su producción,  actualmente tramitan el segundo crédito donde han demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos, ha este grupo de mujeres lamentablemente no acceden a un crédito bancario por la variedad de requisitos que se les imponen por lo que solicitan los servicios  de ASDIR.
texts.en:
The women of the Working Women Community Bank come from Paraje Coxom, Cantó Patzarajmac and Totonicapán and are married. They have been working as merchants for five years, some selling typical meats and others selling a variety of daily-use products, and they have continued progressing and satisfying their needs. They came to the offices of Kiva partner ASDIR to request a group loan that will increase their capital so they can afford to purchase more supplies for their businesses. Currently they are working on their second loan and have demonstrated responsibility in their repayments. This group of women sadly doesn't have the luxury of a bank loan due to the variety of requirements, which is why they have turned to ASDIR.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase more supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through Junior High. Cecilia sells saucepans and powdered fish and other food items at Kotokoraba which is the heart of Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1996.

Cecilia uses her income for the feeding of the family and to pay utility bills. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more saucepans. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: purchase more food items and saucepans for re-sale

loans.name: Noga

texts.es: Noga tiene 18 años, vive junto a su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de licores regionales (a base de raíces de árboles maceradas en aguardiente), desde hace ya 2 años, ocupándose en ello casi todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes. Le es rentable, ya que las personas compran estas bebidas frecuentemente, algunas para tratar alguna dolencia y otras para consumirlas entre amigos o festividades. También son buscadas por los visitantes de otras regiones. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP. Utilizará el dinero en la construcción de un kiosco, ambientarlo adecuadamente y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Noga is 18 years old and lives with her partner, who works driving passangers and supports her on her business. She works selling regional beverages (made out of tree’s roots mixed with liquor) for the last 2 years, working almost all day long. She likes to provide good service to her clients.
