Business is very profitable because some people buy beverages to reduce pain and others to consume them with friends or during holidays. Her beverages are also well known to visitors from other regions. This is the first time she solicits a loan from MFP. She will use the money to build a kiosk to provide better attention to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: Madeleine tiene 40 años de edad, estaba separada del padre de sus hijos, pero hace 6 años decidieron darse otra oportunidad de convivir, tienen 5 hijos, solo 3 viven con ella. Cuando era  muy niña veía que su madre preparaba tortas y las vendía, pero cuando ella tuvo 10 años su madre falleció, su padre no era tan responsable con sus hijos, entonces ella decidió poner en practica lo que su madre hacia, y poco a poco se fue perfeccionando en el oficio de la repostería, y ahora vive de ello, haciendo grandes decoraciones  para fiestas y eventos de gran significación, y también sigue ofreciendo tajaditas de queque por las calles, que fue como comenzó su negocio. A ella le agrada mucho su actividad, sobre todo ahora que ha tomado cursos de repostería ha adquirido mucha clientela y no encuentra dificultad alguna. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Este dinero que solicita será usado en la compra de decoraciones y acabados en la ciudad de Lima, porque en su localidad no hay este tipo de objetos.
texts.en:
Madeleine is 40 years old and was separated from the father of her children. However, six years ago, they decided to try living together again. They have five children, three of whom still live with her. When she was a young girl she observed that her mother made cakes and sold them. But, at the age of ten, her mother passed away and her father wasn’t as responsible with the children. At that point, she decided to put into practice what her mother did and little by little she perfected the art of baking. She now lives off this trade, making large decorations for parties and events of great significance. She also continues to offer small cakes on the streets, which is how she started her business. She gets great enjoyment from these activities and, especially now that she has taken some baking classes, she has attracted a good customer base and proceeds without any difficulty. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The funds she is requesting will be used to buy decorations and finishing touches in the city of Lima, because in her area there are no items of this type.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cake decorations.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que la aman mucho. Ella se dedica a la pintura, en sociedad con su esposo quien es maestro de arte. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años atrás, juntos pintan paisajes con detalles regionales y venden sus cuadros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es ver su arte realizado, ya que es su inspiración diaria y ver la satisfacción de quienes le compran. Es su 4to préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere poner su taller de pintura, y para eso necesita construir un local adecuado.
texts.en:
Miriam is 31 and lives with her husband and their three children, whom she loves very much. She earns her living as a painter, and is in business with her husband, who is an art teacher. They’ve been working together for the past 10 years painting regional landscapes, which they sell. What she likes about her work is seeing her art realized which, along with enjoying the satisfaction of her customers, gives her daily inspiration. This will be Miriam’s fourth loan with MFP and she has proven herself responsible in making her payments. She would like to open a painting studio, so she plans to use her loan to build out a suitable space.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct suitable space for her painting studio

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 42 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 25 and her youngest child is18 and attends the University of Ibadan. She sells clothes, bags and rechargeable phone cards. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase additional clothes and bags to sell. Victoria says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
S., 56, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling groceries from her house, selling items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has experience in this business for nine years. S. is a widow and has three children: one attends school, and the other two are married and live separately.

S. works very hard every day and is a very responsible mother to her family. Recently, she sold a lot of the groceries from her store, and because grocery selling is S.'s main way to earn an income to support her family, she asked for a loan. She would use any remaining amount to build additional grocery display space.

loans.use: To purchase a range of groceries for sale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie R. is a 41 year old married mother of two adopted children.  Her husband is a farmer and laborer.  One of her children is in elementary school and the other attends university.  Rosemarie started her 'sari sari' shop - a small store that sells food, beverages, and everyday household items - with money her father gave her when she graduated from college.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more inventory for her shop, which she runs out of her home.  Rosemarie hopes to grow her business and move operations from her house to the public market, where she would like to open a mini-grocery store.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a small general store.

loans.name: Zalve

texts.en: Zalve B. is 30 years old, married and a resident of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has two children; one is in school. The couple is engaged in farming and hog raising. She became a member and used the credit services. Her loan as of now is Php 14,900.00 to purchase fertilizer for her cornfields and to purchase piglets. The couple is hoping that they will always have a good harvest and her hog-raising project will expand and grow in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Antonia es casada, tiene 63 años y 4 hijos, Antonia venD. buzos, ropa variada, calzados, sus ventas son a pedido y a crédito a amigos familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima. Además alquila su casa que le genera algunos ingresos.
Antonia necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mayólicas para su casa.
Los sueños D. Antonia son mejorar su negocio, distraerse y descansar ya que sus hijos son mayores.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank. Antonia is married, is 63 years old and has 4 children. Antonia sells shawls, varied clothing, and shoes. Her sales are by order and on credit to friends and relatives. She gets her products in the city of Lima. In addition, she rents her house to generate additional income. Antonia needs a loan of 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of floor tiles for her house. Antonia's dreams are to improve her business, have leisure time and rest now that her children are older.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase floor tiles for her house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita, 25 years old and married with three children, has a store where she sells clothes and operates a beauty salon. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell and says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adom

texts.en:
Adom Y. is a 46-year-old man. He is married, with four children who are currently in school. His wife is a petty trader who sells foodstuffs in the community where they live at Dorma. He is an agro-chemical seller and sells various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. He started this business two years ago.

Many local farmers patronize his products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farm lands. With the loan, Adom wants to purchase more supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to serve the needs of his customers. He hopes to raise enough income to pay for his kids’ education. He would be very appreciative of your assistance. He belongs to a village bank called ‘God First’.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Sakina Ahmad Din Group

texts.en:
My name is Sakina and I have been living in a city of shrines named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. I'm a very sensitive lady and I care a lot for my family. I want to free my family members of all tensions so that we can lead a happy life. I operate an embroidered clothes business to share the financial burden of my husband. I am applying for a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, switch boards and tube lights) for my husband’s electric shop so that he can complete his customers' orders and earn good income.

I’m the group leader of three other women from my locality. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mahwish baji wants a loan to buy newspapers to sell. Sobia liaqat baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and creams) for her barber shop.

This is a group loan and, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is from the town of Solinog, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Fe is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fe operates a specialized retail store, where she primarily sells soft drinks and other products to the community. Fe has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is a 35-year-old mother of four. She sells building materials. Kehinde is requesting a loan of of 140,000 Nigerian naira (or about $950 US) to purchase more building materials to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Kola

texts.en:
Kola sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past eight years. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State.

Kola has been with LAPO for one year. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Edith Adelaida

texts.en:
Señora Edith is 65 years old.  She is a widow and has three adult children.  Edith lives in the city of Pucallpa and has a small farm along the Ucayali, the wiD. brown river that flows past the city and joins the Amazon to the north.  On her farm Edith raises chickens and ducks and also plants a variety of crops, including plantains and maize.  She works this farm together with her sisters. 
 
Edith has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for eight years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  Edith invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in a home-based restaurant that she had at that time.  She plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in maintaining her farm and in food for the chickens she raises.  

Edith is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support that the organization gives to low-income women.  Edith’s loans have helped her to improve her financial situation.  Edith’s goal is to increase the production of her farm.  She would like to plant other crops including yucca, beans, and rice in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Chicken feed; maintenance of a farm

loans.name: Charif

texts.en:
Charif is a 29 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife. Charif has owned a barber shop since 2003. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products and arrange the décor of his shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Charif is special in his work because he knows how to take good care of his clients, like he does than facial masks. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he didn’t face difficulties. Charif decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and arrange the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
S., 38, is a widow who has been living with her sister for many years; she has no children. Her sister is a garment worker. S. earns her living selling traditional cake for which she is famous. She is very skilled and everyone appreciates it. She has a small plot of land derived from her parents along the village road. She is a very kind person in the village. She wants to buy a motorbike for her sister's transportation with this loan.

S. said she will open a new small grocery store by her house when she can possibly earn enough for that. This is the rainy season and the month for flooding so her house is full of water underneath and the other houses are, too.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her sister's transportation.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita M., a 54-year-old single mother of one adult-aged child, is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" retail store whose main source of income comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Clarita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Clarita is now requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 38 años, ella es muy alegre y amorosa con su familia, a quienes desea brindar seguridad económica.

La venta de cosméticos es una de las actividades que más oportunidades le ha brindado, pues le era difícil ajustarse a los horarios de trabajos en otras labores sin descuidar a sus hijos. Por ello optó por dedicarse a vender cosméticos, teniendo muy buena acogida por sus vecinos y amigos, quienes se acostumbraron a realizar sus pedidos cada fin de mes, lo cual incrementaron sus ganas de seguir dedicándose al comercio.
Carmen considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en aprovechar las ofertas de los catálogos, para así vender los productos con otro costo que le ayude a incrementar sus ingresos.
Su deseo a futuro es de instalar un stand en algún mercado de su localidad, donde venda cómodamente, sin tener que movilizarse a distintos lugares.

Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se siente muy contenta de formar parte de un bonito equipo de trabajo dentro de su banco comunal junto a sus vecinas, quienes también están muy comprometidas con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita incrementar sus productos de belleza para aprovechar la demanda que habrá en las festividades próximas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old. She is a cheerful woman who adores her family, for whom she wants to provide financial security.

Selling cosmetics provided Carmen with many opportunities because she found it difficult adjusting to the work schedules of most jobs without having to neglect her children. Her products have been well-received by friends and neighbors, who usually place their orders by the end of each month. As her sales increased, Carmen became more motivated to continue with her business.

She believes selling cosmetics can be very profitable because she takes advantage of catalog offers. Selling products that are bundled with other items have helped to increase her earnings. In the future, Carmen would like to open a stand at one of the local markets so that she can manage her business comfortably without having to travel to different places.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Carmen is very excited of be part of a nice Communal Bank team in which she gets to work with her neighbors. The members are also very committed to the development of their group. She will use the money she requested to increase her supply of beauty products so that she can take advantage of the higher demand expected during the upcoming festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her supply of merchandise

loans.name: Hoàng Thị's Group
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling food and a variety of other products in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Golda

texts.en:
Golda K. is currently in the business of selling fish and beer, and is requesting a loan to purchase fish and sell them in another nearby market. Golda is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish and sell them in another nearby market.

loans.name: Kossa

texts.fr: Kossa G. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO depuis 6 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir contracté à 12 fois de suite. Elle développe un maraîchage et vend parallèlement sur table des condiments de cuisine et des légumes au marché. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossa G., 47, is married and the mother of 7 children for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the Village Bank of BAKIDIOTO for six years and has a good deal of experience in managing loans since she has had 12 in a row. She is developing her market gardening and also sells kitchen condiments and vegetables on a tabletop in the market. She is working at improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding her little businesses

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, es una socia muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es trabajador de la Municipalidad. Marina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevas Amigas”, desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de bebidas refrescantes.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será reinvertido en la venta de bebidas refrescantes. La meta de Marina es tener una fuente de soda bien implementado que le permita generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marina is a very punctual member. She lives in the Callería district in the Ucayali region. She is 55, and she has three grown and independent children. She sells cold drinks in her house. She has her husband’s support; he works for the municipality. Marina has been part of the Nuevas Amigas Communal Bank for six years. She bought cold drinks with her first loan for 300 PEN. Now she needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy cold drinks. Marina’s goal is to have a well equipped soda fountain, which would allow her to generate greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cold drinks to sell

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el caserío Lagunas, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia hizo que empezara a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales para subsistir. Ella cría cerdos y los vende a los negociantes que visitan su caserío de manera constante. Este negoco le ha brindado la suficiente ayuda para salir adelante durante este tiempo.

Debido a la demanda por sus animales Felicita desea mejorar la calidad de sus cerdos para así poder obtener más ganancias. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Felicita es una madre luchadora que siempre da todo de si para sacar a su familia adelante. Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos todas las posibilidades de desarrollo que estén a su alcance.
texts.en:
Felicita is 42 years old and is the single mother of three children. She lives in the Lagunas neighborhood, in Mórrope District, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. In order to help her family get ahead in life, Felicita decided to start raising and selling animals. She raises pigs, which she then sells to the traveling salespeople who regularly pass through her neighborhood. She has been able to make significant progress in life since launching this business. Because of the demand for her animals, Felicitas wants to improve the quality of her pigs in order to earn more. She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 Peruvian Soles; she plans to use the loan to buy animal feed. Felicita is a hard-working mother who always gives her all so that she can help her family get ahead in life. Her greatest dream is to provide her children with all of the available opportunities to develop themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Compra de alimento balanceado para cerdos.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli T., a 58-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Talusan, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by buying and selling vegetables. Araceli’s husband Mauriceo is 61 years old and works as a coconut sap extractor (Mananggete). They have ten children, eight of whom have their own families while two still live at home but are also gainfully employed and contribute toward the support of their household.

Arceli joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by buying and selling vegetables. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Araceli is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund her vegetable-vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 12th loan in the amount of Php 19,500 to buy more vegetables to resell. Araceli is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline A. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Jacqueline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jacqueline runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jacqueline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 55, is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She started planting rice in 1980.

Alicia joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008 to financially support her farm. Now she has requested a loan of 14,000 Php. This will be helpful to buy farm inputs necessary for her rice field.

Alicia is the mother of ten children. With rice farming, she provides the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia owns a rice field.  She’s 43 years old and has a rice farming business in Talibon, Bohol.  She started her business a long time ago.  With the income she receives from her farm, she can sustain the needs of her family.  

Lucia joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to take a loan for her farm.  She requested an amount of 16,000 PHP as additional capital to finance her business.  With this amount, she can buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase salon materials like shampoo, hair driers and other items

loans.name: Llegando Lejos 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana, 21, is the coordinator of her group Llegando Lejos (Going Far), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their children.

Ana is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling Empanadas (a fried treat usuallly involving meat or cheese encased in fried dough). She will be purchasing cooking oil, flour, meat, cheese and a freezer to store it in. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children and for saving towards, one day, owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase meat, cheese, cooking oil, flour and a freezer.

loans.name: Estrella Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 13 años de tener su negocio en que vende bebidas y fritangas para ofrecer a sus clientes.  Quiere este préstamo para Ella está casada y tiene 50 años de edad.
Deysi tiene 4 años de tener su negocio en que vende granos básicos y otros alimentos.  Quire este préstamo para comprar granos básicos y productos de consumo para el hogar.  Ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo quien es adulto.
Este es el 14 préstamo que saca el Grupo Solidario Estrella Del Mar, y los prestamos se han usado para invertir en negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia has had her business for 13 years now, selling beverages and snacks to her clients. She wants this loan to improve her business. She is 50 years old and married. Deysi has had her business for the past 4 years, selling basic grains and other food products. She wants this loan to buy more grains and products for the home. She is 66 years old, married and the mother of a grown-up son. This is the 14th loan for the Estrella del Mar Solidarity Group and they have used the money to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Paulina, tiene 34  años,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos,  vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, ella trabaja en una ONG contratada por el momento pero su actividad económica complementaria es ser técnica en gastronomía y restaurante en la playa de estacionamiento de los buses de que se dirigen de la ciudad de Chicheros a la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son siete años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socia de la fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere comprar insumos como por ejemplos papas, carne y muchos más.
texts.en:
When visiting the "Mateo Pumacahua" communal bank, we spoke with Paulina, a member who is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children and lives in the city of Chinchero, in the department of Cusco. She currently works on a contract basis for an NGO. However, her complementary economic activity is working in the restaurant and hospitality field at the parking area for buses traveling from Chinchero to Cusco. She has dedicated herself to this business for the past seven years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. Being a member of the foundation has helped her greatly in making economic progress and expanding her business. With this new loan, she will buy needed supplies such as potatoes, meat and much more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies such as potatoes, meat and much more

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie C.'s main source of income comes from making and selling "cue" such as barbecue, chicken feet, hotdogs and chicken intestine in the market. She is 40 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Pobalcion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Margie has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 24,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Авлякулова Муяссар проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует небольшой земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Muyassar A. lives in the Shahrituz area. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than ten years. She rents the small plot where she grows vegetables to sell. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers so that she will have a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ragheda

texts.en:
Ragheda is a 37-year-old mother who has a son, Wadei, who is two years old. Ragheda's husband owns a small store. Aala Din, Ragheda's husband, sells stationary, gifts, dolls, books, notebooks and other school supplies. Ala Din's store is next to a girls' school in Dir Al-Balah.

Ragheda and her husband need more new items for the store, so she took a $1,000 loan to buy the items and to prepare for the new school year.

Ala Din appears in the picture, because Raghida didn't approve of having her picture published.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda O. is a seamstress and also sells cement at Takoradi. She has been through junior high school. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a building contractor.

Linda supports her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cement to meet the increase in demand for it. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cement to meet the increase in demand for it

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 22 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su madre y 2 hermanos jóvenes, juntos trabajan para salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde muy joven este laborioso hombre se dedica a las labores agrícolas, pues ayudaba a sus padres para que las tierras produzcan en cantidad. En la actualidad siembra papa, arveja y algunas hortalizas, junto a sus hermanos, aunque sabe que la labor de campo es algo tediosa porque debe vigilar sus cultivos todos los días, con los primeros rayos del sol, para obtener una cosecha productiva. Pero se siente gratificado cuando recoge los pesados sacos repletos de sus productos naturales, y los comercializa a los mayoristas de la ciudad, que le pagan considerables precios porque conocen de la calidad de sus productos. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad papa, además quiere comprar algunas cabezas de reses, pues empezará con la comercialización de estos animales. Es el onceavo crédito con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, además esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero solicitado que le permitirá continuar adelante. Miguel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Miguel is 22 years old, he lives in his own home with his mother and 2 younger brothers, they work to get ahead and progress in life. From a very young age, this hardworking man has worked in agriculture to help his parents’ land produce to capacity. At present, he grows potatoes, peas and some vegetables with his brothers. Miguel knows that field work is somewhat tedious since he has to watch over his crops everyday from sunrise in order to have productive crops. Although it’s a tough job, Miguel feels satisfied when he collects the heavy sacks full of his natural products and sells them to the wholesalers in the city that pay him well since they know the quality of his products. Miguel is an enterprising man, and plans to grow more potatoes in the future, and to have some cattle to sell also. This is Miguel’s eleventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and he promises to pay his quotas on time and wants to keep working to get ahead. Miguel is very grateful to everyone who lent him money since that will allow him to keep progressing in life; he plans to use the loan to buy manure and fertilizers to improve the productivity of his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nickie

texts.en: Nickie P. of Sto. Niño has had a farming and hog raising business since 2007. She has one son who is only 3 years old. This loan will be used to buy more piglets and their vitamins and supplements, as well as pig feed. Aside from these businesses, she plans to try other business opportunities someday to prepare for her child’s education. The additional income will go to her family's daily consumption and savings for future investments.

loans.use: buying piglets, vitamins, supplements, and pig feed

loans.name: Step By Step Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Beat N.’s beauty salon in Kitega –Mukono has had mixed fortunes over the last decade. But the 40-year-old's own initiative and entrepreneurial versatility enabled her to begin this business, and all this while, she has given nothing but a credible account of her business abilities. The happily married mother of four credits a sense of diligence as one factor that has stood out for her as a stock in trade. In a month she makes 120,000 shillings, and with this loan she is planning to buy more hair products, weavers and other requisite beauty salon equipment.

Beat belongs to Step by Step Women's Group in Mukono.

loans.use: To purchase hair products, weavers and other salon equipment

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe P. D. E. D. 46 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija menor D. edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Ella vive junto a su familia en el departamento D. San Salvador. Morena posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su misma casa D. habitación, lo cual trae mucho beneficios, ya que pueD. dedicarse a su negocio al mismo tiempo que se dedica a su hija y a los quehaceres del hogar. Su negocio es uno D. los más surtidos del lugar y que cuenta con mayor cantidad D. clientes, tanto por su excelente servicio como por sus precios accesibles. Morena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir más en su negocio, aumentando la cantidad D. cada producto, y D. esta manera poder atender a mayor cantidad D. clientes. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien se siente muy agradecida por el hecho D. poder contar con un negocio propio el cual le permita brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe P. D. E., 46, lives with her husband and her youngest daughter, who is a student.  She and her family live in the department of San Salvador.  Morena has a shop selling perishables and basic goods.  The shop is attached to her home, which brings many benefits, since she can work and take care of her daughter and her home at the same time. Her business is one of the most varied in the area and has a large number of clients because of its excellent service and accessible prices.

Morena wants a loan to invest further in this business so she can increase her stock and thereby serve a greater number of clients.  She is a responsible woman, and she is happy that she has her own business, since it allows her to offer her family members what they need.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and household products

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
This is Ruby V., 35, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo V., a driver, and mother of their only child. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Ruby as she herself is a highschool graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents can leave to their children.

Ruby, who operates a rug-making business, offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers make every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are among the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while one is riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Ruby dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, the groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 38 years old. Rosie is married and has six children. Her eldest child is aged 15 and the youngest is only 1 year old. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business preparing and selling snacks like banana cue, cupcakes and others.

Rosie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is a widow  who lives in Brgy. Luray 2, Toledo City, Cebu . She earns her living by operating one business venture: buying and re-selling bananas.  She has 6 children who are 35 to 55 years old. 

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family's needs. 

Teresita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Narcisa Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Narcisa, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos uno de 26 y  21 años,  el menor de ellos vive en su casa y está estudiando en universidad. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella trabaja en las tardes en un centro de recreación vacacional en la ciudad de bahía, pero en las mañanas se dedica junto  a su esposo al comercio,  compran y venden de pollos, tienen un puesto en el mercado de Bahía en el cual venden el pollo por libras o entero a las personas que a diario asisten a este lugar a realizar sus compras, trabajan desde las 6am hasta las 12h00 ya que a la 13h00 ella tiene que presentarse en su trabajo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más pollos para la venta de la semana. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la seriedad de las socias. Su sueño es  llegar a ser la administradora de su propio centro vacacional.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We find Narcisa, 46, here.  She is married and has two children who are 26 and 21 years of age.  The youngest still lives at home and is going to the university.  Her husband is a merchant.

She works afternoons at a vacation recreational center in Bahía but in the mornings she works in commerce with her husband.  They are chicken merchants.  They have a stand in Bahía’s market where they sell chicken by the pound or whole to people who come by daily to shop.  They are open for business from 6am until noon because at 1pm she has to report to work.

This loan is to buy more chickens for the week’s sales.  She has been in the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because the members are committed.  Her dream is to become a manager of a vacation center.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: La señora Brenda Carolina tiene su negocio que es venta de la comercialización de ropa, productos plásticos y de vidrio y otros artículos en general. Un obstáculo que ha tenido últimamente es la falta de movimiento de parte de los clientes. Ella desea continuar invirtiendo en mercadería en general. Su sueño, es establecer una tienda en el mercado. La otra integrante es Cristian Isabel  su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, tal como ropa y calzado de manera ambulante. Ella tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos acaba de graduarse de sexto grado de primaria. Juntas se han unido con el fin de obtener un nuevo financiamiento y poder salir adelante y aprovechar estas festividades.
texts.en:
Señora Brenda Carolina has a business selling clothing, plastic and glass products and other general items. One obstacle that she has come up against lately is her customers' lack of cash flow. She wants to continue investing in general merchandise. Her dream is to set up a retail store in the market. 

The other group member is Cristian Isabel, who has a business selling general merchandise, such as clothing and footwear, as a street vendor. She has two children, one of whom has just graduated from sixth grade. These women have teamed up together to obtain new financing, so that they can make progress and take advantage of this festive period.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tima Ole

texts.en:
Tima Ole has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last one year.  He is 28 years old, married to Selina Tima and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep, which he will raise and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Tima hopes to practice dairy farming which according to him is more stable and profitable.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep which he will raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel B. is from the town of Dauis. He is 38 years old. Arnel is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a  fishing business, catching and selling assorted fish to the market. One of the reasons Arnel works so hard is because he wants to be able to sustain his children's education.

Arnel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Arnel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair his fishing boat. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
Born in l958, M. is married with four children. He has very little education because his parents were poor and there was nobody to support him to further his education. He joined GHAPE in 1999. He has proven beyond doubt his ability to receive, invest, repay loans, and provide quality goods including piglets, manure and food crops to his community.

M. has gained from the many people within GHAPE and his immediate environment mainly because of his leadership qualities demonstrated at all levels. His desire is to provide steady transportation services and keep up with customers demand. Given this loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle, pay the registration and obtained all required official documents. Since the roads are not in good conditions and transport vehicles hardly travel this road regularly. Motorcycles are the only alternatives to transport people and luggage. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: motorcycle and papers

loans.name: Lucy Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucy Zoraida; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia trabaja en el ministerio de agricultura lleva ya un buen tiempo en su trabajo ella trabaja de lunes a viernes, la socia a la vez vende productos de belleza de las líneas Avon, Unique y Esika ella vende cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros productos más de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante ella es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos de belleza para así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucy Zoraida is a member of the “CHASKA ÑAHUI” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is 42 years old, separated and has two children.  She works for the Ministry of Agriculture.  She’s been employed for quite some time; she works Monday through Friday.  She also sells beauty products of the Avon, Unique and Esika brands; she sells creams, perfumes and colognes, among other products.  This way she supports her family.  She is a very cheerful person with a strong wish to get ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy more beauty products so that she can have a wider variety available for her customers.  She is happy with the loan and commits to pay every installment.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to have a wider selection available for her customers.

loans.name: Irene Njoki

texts.en:
Irene has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town the last five years.  She is 32 years old, married to John Kamau, and they have four children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for the coming season of planting

In the future, Irene hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 42-year-old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the produce business for ten years. He started it with 500,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings. 

His hardship is price fluctuation and his vision is buying a processing machine and having a well educated family.

With the loan, Benard intends to renovate the food store.

loans.use: to rennovate the food store

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chheng I. and his wife, Mrs. Kunthea Sok, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple has been married since 1993, and they have two sons and one daughter, who are all in school. 

Mr. Chheng I. has been a construction worker for more than three years, while his wife produces rice wine and raises pigs. He is applying for his second loan of $1,200 to help with his wife’s business by purchasing more piglets to raise and buying rice to produce more rice wine.

Photo: Mr. Chheng I. and his wife

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and more rice to make rice wine.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz y también vende artesanía, ella hace trabajos de artesanía como muñecas y lo vende en lugares como Arequipa, ella también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y lo vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar sus negocios de artesanía y venta de maíz, para invertir en la cosecha de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar transporte y para pagar a las personas que trabajan en la cosecha.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "The Triumphant". The bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, located in the province of Quispinachis and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Roxana. She is 33 years old, married common-law, and she is the mother of 1 child. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling corn and she also sells crafts. She makes crafts such as dolls and she sells them in locales including Arequipa. She also has a cultivation field where she plants corn and she sells the product independently. She wants to expand her craft and corn business, to invest in her corn harvest business. She requests a loan to pay for transportation expenses and to hire help for the harvest.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to pay for transport expenses and to hire help for the harvest.

loans.name: Monserrate Soledad

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunas Unión y Solidaridad.
 
La señora Monserrate es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 18, 17 y 7 años de edad, los mayores ya son independientes, el menor estudia en escuela y es quien vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado número 1 de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Trabajan desde las 05h00  hasta las tres de la  tarde, ella atiende el negocio mientras él se desplaza a otro mercado mayorista a comprar los productos que necesita para darles a  sus clientes lo mejor, nos cuenta que esta es la clave para tener clientes contentos ya que  les ofrece un buen producto, limpio y al precio justo. Llevan 4 años dedicados a  esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas verduras y legumbres para su negocio.
 
Su  sueño es tener casa propia ya que donde viven es arrendado..
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the “Unión y Solidaridad” communal bank meet in the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Monserrate is a member of the communal bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other institutions.  She is 38 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has three children, ages 18, 17, and 7.  The oldest are on their own.  The youngest attends school and lives at home.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a fruit and vegetable business in the number 1 market in Portoviejo, where they work from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm.  There she tends to the business while he goes to a larger market to buy the products that they need in order to give their customers the best quality.  She tells us that this is the key to having happy customers.  She offers them a good, clean product at a fair price.  They have been doing this for four years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.  Her dream is to have her own home because they currently rent.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 29 years old, married to Obadiah, and they have three children. She has been in the transport industry as a primary business, and she also is involved in farming activities. She sells the farm produce, like green vegetables, to area residents. She earns an income of about $125 per month.

She is applying for a second loan from KADET LTD to buy tires for her vehicle. She will use the profit to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to purchase another vehicle in order to expand her transport business.

loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Vitelio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de dos años, él se dedica a la agricultura, lo inicio cuando era joven y ayudaba a su padre, aprendió el proceso y hoy en día es el trabajo que le ayuda para darle a su familia la alimentación, los cultivos los realiza en terreno alquilado, no tiene un horario fijo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, preparara la tierra, e iniciar la siembra, comprara abono y fertilizantes, esta compra le permitirá trabajar adecuadamente y realizar el cultivo con la esperanza de obtener una buena cosecha.
Los sueños de José son crecer y obtener una buena cosecha, para poder comercializar una parte y otra para el consumo de la familia.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who lives with his wife and 2 year-old son.  He started farming when he was young and used to help his father.  He learned the process and now this is the work that helps him to feed his family.  He grows his crops on rented land and doesn't work fixed hours.

José is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, prepare his land and start sowing his crops.  He will buy manure and fertilizers.  This purchase will allow him to work properly and grow his crops in the hope of obtaining a good harvest.

José's dreams are to grow and obtain a good harvest.  He will sell some of his crops and the rest will be eaten by his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, milk and grocery items.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosie is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosie has a souvenir sales business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her souvenir-making business.

Rosie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for souvenir-making business.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Balvina tiene 33 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Néstor de 38 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes cuida con mucho amor y cariño en el caserío de Cumutay. La actividad económica de la familia es la agricultura. Desde que formó su familia, comenzó a poner en práctica todas las enseñanzas de sus padres. Su esposo siempre le apoyaba en el cuidado y las decisiones de los cultivos. Recuerda que hace 20 años, compró unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera sembrar papa, arveja y maíz. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, pero ahora son mucho más productivos, ya que sus sembríos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer. Ahora ella tiene que dedicarse a tiempo completo, ya que gracias a la geografía del lugar; el estado esta erigiendo una hidroeléctrica, donde su esposo trabaja para obtener un dinero extra. Considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. En adelante, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar una movilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de cumutay” y este es el primer crédito con MFP; donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus planes. Balvina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Balvina is 33. She is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Nestor, age 38, and their 3 beloved daughters for whom they care with great love and tenderness in the hamlet of Cumutay. The family works in agriculture. From the beginning of their family life, she started putting all that her parents had taught her into practice. Her husband has always supported her in caring for their crops and making decisions. She says that they bought some land 20 years ago where they can sow potatoes, peas and corn. They are still working these lands, but they are now far more productive, and their crops are high quality. What Balvina most enjoys about her work is the close relationship that she has with the land. She greatly enjoys watching her crops grow. She now has to work the land full-time because, thanks to the geography of the area, the state is building a hydroelectric power station where her husband is working in order to obtain extra money. She finds her greatest challenge to be caring for her land in difficult weather, since everything can affect the harvest. In the future, she hopes to have the necessary funds to purchase a vehicle. She belongs to the "Pioneros de Cumutay" communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP. She hopes for the support of each one of you in order to continue with her plans. Balvina, with your support, will invest the requested loan in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds for her next crop.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto es un joven muy creativo dese hace 5 años comenzó su propio negocio para la elaboración de cintos, carteras, porta celulares y mas. Que hace con piel de animal donde hace variedad de dibujos que el mismo diseña. En este momento el quiere comprar una maquinaria que le facilitaría el trabajo con agilidad y rapidez, para que sus clientes queden satisfechos del tiempo e que es la entrega. Alberto no cuenta con el capital necesario por eso solicita un préstamo para poder comprar la maquina y e esta manera seguirá generando ingresos para sostener los gastos.
texts.en: Alberto is very young and has been very creative since he was five years old.  He started his own business making belts, wallets, cell phone carriers, and more.  He makes them out of leather and makes several of his own designs.  He wants to buy a machine to make his work easier and faster so that his customers can be better satisfied with delivery times.  Alberto doesn’t have the necessary capital, so he is asking for a loan to be able to buy the machine.  In this way he will continue to generate income to cover his living expenses.

loans.use: Comprar maquinaria

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila tiene la edad de 56 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 19 años que estudia la preparatoria. 

ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 6 años inicio a vender refrescos en su hogar para ganar un poco dinero extra para sacar a delante a su familia y poco a poco con el paso del tiempo su negocio fue cresindo e inicio tambien a vender abarrotes, ella realiza sus ventas desde su casa ha puest algunas mesas y anaqueles en los cuales exibe sus productos, tambien nos dice que la C. de una tienda de abarrotes es tenerla muy bien surtida ya que asi sus clientes siempre encontraran lo que buscan y volveran a su tienda a hacerle el gasto.

Doña domitila nesecita este credito para invertirlo en la copra de arroz, frijol, aceite, refrescos, galletas, dulces, jabon, papel higienico, productos en la tados, huevos, pasta dental, sal y azucar para resurtir su tienda.

ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y obtenga mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y asi poder construir un pequeño local y continuar la construccion de su casa.
texts.en:
Domitila is 56 years old, studied through high school, is single, and has a 19 year old son in high school.

She tells us that more than six years ago, she started to sell soft drinks in her home to earn a little extra money to get her family ahead.  Little by little with the passing of time, her business grew and she started to also sell groceries.  She sells from her home, where she has set up tables and shelves to display her products.  She says that the key to a grocery store is to have it very well stocked so that customers can find what they are looking for and will return to her store to make purchases.

Domitila needs this loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, soft drinks, cookies, sweets, ham, toilet paper, canned goods, eggs, toothpaste, salt, and sugar to restock her store.  

She hopes that this investment in her business will help it prosper and she will get more customers, which will increase her earnings.  She wants to build a small store and continue to do construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to restock her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying & selling of fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 27 years old, married and has two children who are in school.  She does tailoring to earn a living for her family.  She mainly makes bed covers and cushion covers. In addition, she sells hair braids and hair clips in the same business premise.

Through Faulu Kenya, Julia has been trained on business management skills. This has helped her to improve her business.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric and a sewing machine, and to install electricity in her business premise.

loans.use: To buy fabric,  sewing machine and install electricity

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 56 and owns a sari-sari store (a small retail shop), from which she sells snack food, cooking staples such as vinegar and cooking oil, and soft drinks.  According to Pacita, she is practiced the hardships of life and that’s why she keeps on working. Aside from her sari-sari store, Pacita sells sandwiches door-to-door in her village.  Pacita plans to use this loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy bread, sandwich spread, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes she will be able to buy enough merchandise for her sari-sari store to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy bread, sandwich spread, and soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años el cual está bajo su cargo. Desde hace 4 años que tiene este negocio que es una pulpería, fue por iniciativa propia que ha obtenido este medio de vida, la responsabilidad de brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios para su hogar hacen que Maria se esmere en el buen servicio para con sus clientes. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, pan, refrescos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados y  papel higiénico. Ella necesita comprar más insumos y productos para que su negocio tenga variedad para sus clientes y así pueda continuar creciendo.
texts.en: Maria Cristina is married and has a 4-year-old child in her care.  She has owned her general store business for four years.  She started out in this line of work through her own initiative.  The responsibility she has to provide her family with the income they need means that Maria takes care to provide her customers with good service.  She is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, bread, soft drinks, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper.  She needs to buy more supplies and products so that her business has a good range of products available for her customers and can therefore continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, soft drinks, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он шафер. Фуркат более пяти лет предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Furkat lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 44 years old, married and has six children.  He has a secondary-specialized education.  He is a driver.  Furkat has been providing a taxi service for five years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car and provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is 33 years old and lives with her 2 children and her husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as a bus conductor for a bus service company.  

Oyun-Erdene always tries to improve her living condition step by step. Therefore, she is planning to install a new electric heat furnace to replace the coal furnace which is being used currently.  She thinks this is a very economical and nature-oriented idea. Then, she will add insulation to the walls of her house because there is too much heat loss in her house.  The loan she is taking will be used to make adjustments to her old house. 

Oyun-Erdene needs MNT 3,500,000 to purchase and install an electric furnace and buy some building materials for insulation.

loans.use: buy and install an electric furnace and insulation

loans.name: Maria Estella

texts.es: María Estella se dedica al destace de carne de res, hace más de 10 años que tiene este medio de vida. Este negocio lo inicio por unas amigas de su Mama que le enseñaron esta actividad, con el paso del tiempo es que ella ha logrado mejorar cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de vacas pues siempre está ofreciendo una buena calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria Estella has worked as a butcher of beef for over 10 years now. The business was launched by a group of her mother's friends who taught her this activity. With the passage of time, she has improved each day.

The loan Maria Estella requests is for buying cattle, since she always wants to offer the best quality of her products.

loans.use: to buy cattle to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 32 years old and lives with three family members in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Her family goal is to build her own family house and stop renting.
Dorothy is a daring woman who ventured into the timber business, which is predominantly a business carried out by men. She has been in this business for the past ten years. She started as a sales lady for someone in the timber business, then later on, after learning the trade, she started up her own business. She faces a challenge of high fees levied on her by National Forestry officers. Her dream is to own a big timber shop. Dorothy is requesting a loan to buy more timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, es viuda, se dedica a la venta de locerías, con los primeros préstamos que recibió compró mercaderías variada, ella distribuye sus productos en casas y vende también en las ferias, con la ayuda de Finca pudo ampliar su negocio, le gusta recibir charlas ya que le es fácil captar porque es bien dinámico, gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió a educar bien a sus hijos, le gusta su Bamconumal porque las socias son bien unidas y se apoyan entre ellas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su viaje a la ciudad de Lima para comprar mercaderías y poder surtir su negocio. Su meta es construir su casa de material noble para sus hijos.
texts.en: María is a member of the Sarita communal bank . She is a widow and she sells crockery. With the initial loans that she received, she bought different merchandise. She sells her products in homes and also at fairs. With FINCA's help she has managed to expand her business. She enjoys attending lectures and the dynamism makes them easy to understand. This training has helped her to learn how to raise her children well. She likes her communal bank because the members are very close and they support each other. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the trip she is making to Lima to purchase merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to build a brick and mortar house for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Lima.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor is an industrious father of four children. With his determination to send all his children to school, he is operating a farming business as a source of income.
