Natali plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a quantity of merchandise (threads of diverse varieties) that she needs to continue producing. She has various pending orders to fill.

loans.use: To purchase thread in diverse colours; she needs to fill a pending order.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Alim, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a General Store and a fishing businesses. Her husband Felix A., who is 47 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 16 to 24 years old. 

Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 22nd  loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children.

Norma A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Mrs. Song H. is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives in Ampil village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ma Ny, are farmers who own a rice field to cultivate rice for a living. With the farm, they face a problem, because they do not have enough money to grow rice. Thus, Song H. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to cultivate rice. This couple has three children: Two are attending the local school and the third one is just four years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She operates a retail store, selling rice, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fats and kerosene. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Margaret faces a challenge of competition from other retail shop operators and the high cost of transporting goods from the market to her place of business. She hopes to expand and sell as wholesale in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and 50 litres of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and 50 litres of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Cristhian Marlo

texts.es:
Cristhian es un padre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto  a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de dos años, el cuenta con animales menores los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel  de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes  que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Con esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Cristhian desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a 25 year old father living with his family in Tambogrande, a farming district that is part of Piura region located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He has worked raising small farm animals for over two years.  He has small animals that he raises in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.  This activity allows him to support his family.

Cristhian wants to get more animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand his business.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to help him reach this goal.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es: María Adela V. D. P. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el Cantón el Calvario, en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una cafetería dentro D. una escuela en donD. ha trabajado por 9 años. Ella cuenta con muy buenas ventas diarias, por lo que desea poder incrementar los productos que ya posee como: golosinas, bebidas frías y calientes, pan, entre otros más, lo cual pretenD. alcanzar solicitando un préstamo a Integral. La familia D. María es bastante granD., por lo que tanto ella como su esposo deben esforzarse a diario por lograr salir adelante y D. esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en: María Adela V. D. P. is 45 years old and lives in the El Calavario canton in the department of Cuscatlán with her husband and four children, who are in school.  María has a cafe insiD. of a school where she has worked for nine years.  She has very good sales every day, so she would like to increase the products that she sells like: snacks, cold and hot beverages, bread and more.  To do this, she has asked for a loan from Integral.  María's family is large, so both she and her husband have to work hard every day to succeed and proviD. everything her children need.

loans.use: Purchase snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mzee Mbaruku

texts.en:
Mzee Mbaruku A. is a 47-year-old man married to Maimuna, and together they have been blessed with three children. Mzee is a retail shop owner and has been in this business for the last six years. His wife is a businesswoman who owns a water kiosk that generates additional income.

This being his first loan from KADET LTD, Mzee plans to purchase food to sell in his shop. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business.

Mzee’s hopes and dreams are to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell in his shop

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is a long-time business woman and low-income person. She has a small farm, and she grows different kinds of crops which she proposes to harvest and sell to a buyer when the crops are mature. She has been working on the farm since she was single. Her husband earns his profit by climbing the palm trees in and around his community. He has been in this business for a long time and it is a popular job for poor people who live in the province to do. Because their tools for climbing the palm trees are getting old and some are broken, Meas S. would like a loan to assist her husband’s business in buying ladders, as well as some containers for palm juice. Meas S. has six single children, two of whom are staff workers for industry.

loans.use: To buy ladders and some containers for palm juice.

loans.name: Sitar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has  three children. 

In 2005, Sitar opened his own business so he could improve his family’s quality of life. He opened an electrical goods’ store since he had former experience in this field. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his store and expand his inventory. He is working on developing his business.

loans.use: Renovate the store and expand inventory

loans.name: Milana

texts.en:
Milana is single. She lives in Uzhgorod. Milana sells textiles, towels and drapes. She started this enterprise 3 years ago. Currently, Milana has one vending location and her own clientele. She also boasts a wide assortment of inventory and a stable gross income of about 12,00 Grivnyas a month; her average monthly net profit equals 4,500 Grivnyas.  

Milana is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is very determined and hard-working, energetic and enterprising. She doesn’t want to stop at what she has achieved but strives to develop her business even further. Milana is hoping to use profits generated to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: smoked fish, dried fish and fishing. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 100,000. Jasmin is borrowing PHP 40,000 to purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 35,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jasmin aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar L., 33, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past seven years. 

His wife makes clothes at home and his older son attends a local secondary school, while his younger son goes to a kindergarten. 

Ulambayar began making wooden products in 2000. In the beginning, he used to make wooden products at home, and now he has set up an extra ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, and operates his business in there. He has been operating his business for more than a decade and has become an experienced carpenter who has many regular customers. 

He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. He is a hardworking person who takes initiative. He says, "My future wish is to expand my business and increase my profits." 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and necessary materials.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more items for her husband's general store

loans.name: Margarita Amparo

texts.es:
Margarita  tiene  40 años de edad, es casada  y reside junto a su familia en el sector 9 de Octubre, una zona urbana marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de artículos de cuero y badana como correas de cuero, billeteras, accesorios para el cabello y otros similares en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su en el mercado Modelo de la Cuidad de Chiclayo. El negocio tiene mucha acogida en la zona ya que ella es una de las pocas personas que ofrecen estos productos a precios accesibles y de buena calidad. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos universitarios de su hijo y ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de los gastos económicos de su familia.

Margarita desea adquirir más productos de cuero, con diseños nuevos y juveniles que le permita tener más clientes y poder ampliar su negocio. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old, married and lives with her family in the "9 de Octubre" sector, in a marginal urban area of the city of Chiclayo, a commercial area in northern Peru.

For ten years she has been selling leather articles such as belts, billfolds, men's accessories and other items in a small establishment in the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo.  The business is very popular in the area since she is one of the few people who offer this type of product at reasonable prices for good quality.  She uses the income from her work to pay for her son's college expenses and help her husband with the household expenses.

Margarita wants to buy more leather products with new and youthful designs so she can attract even more customers and expand her business.  This is her first loan request through Edpyme Alternative and she has requested 1,000 PEN, which she plans to use to help meet her goal.

loans.use: To buy products to expand her business

loans.name: Bismark Jose

texts.es: Bismark José se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Inicio este negocio, porque el siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para su hogar. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de bananos, sandias, melones, mangos, naranjas y piña. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la mercadería y tener mayor capacidad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Su objetivo a futuro es tener un negocio auto sostenible, que su familia este en mejores condiciones económicas y sus hijos puedan superarse.
texts.en: Bismark Jose has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  He lives with his wife and 2 young children.  He started this business because he was always looking for a way to obtain income for his household.  At this time he requests a loan to buy bananas, watermelons, melons, mangoes, oranges and pineapples.  This investment will help him to increase his merchandise and have a better supply of products to offer to his customers.  His goal for the future is to have a self-sustaining business, so that his family can be in better financial condition and so that his children can do well in life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, watermelons, melons, mangoes, oranges and pineapples

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
María, tiene 56 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y un sobrino D. 13 años D. edad, ella tiene un negocio D. artículos D. primera necesidad,  este surgió debido a la necesidad que tenían en su hogar, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 7:00pm, gracias a este negocio ha logrado mantener su hogar u ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería: harinas, bebidas, detergentes, frijoles y arroz, con esta mercadería podrá surtir el negocio y atender mejor las demandas D. los clientes.
Ella quiere tener el negocio por muchos años más, ayudar a su sobrino en los estudios y pues alcanzar una mejor solvencia.
texts.en: María is 56 years of age.  She lives with her husband and nephew, age 13.  She has a grocery business.  The business arose due to the need that she had in her home.  She tends it from 6:00am to 7:00pm.  Thanks to this business she has managed to maintain her home and help her family.  She requests a loan for the purchase of merchandise: flour, beverages, detergent, beans and rice.  With this merchandise she will be able to supply the business and better tend to the demands of her clients.  She wants to have the business for many more years to help her nephew with his studies and to become more solvent.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as flour, beverages, detergent, beans and rice.

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is a 63-year-old farmer from the village of Boslebi, Dmanisi District. He is married and lives with his wife Naziko. Misha is machine-operator by profession and works in his and nearby villages. In addition to his main profession, Misha also runs a family agricultural farm.  The family has a plot of the land where potatoes, wheat, haricot and maize are grown. Harvested vegetables and corn are sold locally to the retailers. 

The requested loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds. Misha will fertilize the plot and sow the potatoes. According to Misha’s estimations, after fertilizing he will get high quality vegetables and corn and will sell them for a good price. It will improve the income of the family. This increase will be used for renovation of the house and improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, cigarettes and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Renfort Plus Group

texts.en:
Angèle, aged 40, is married and the mother of a daughter aged 22. Angèle is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Renfort Plus” which comprises 22 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Angèle has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. She runs a general store in the eastern area of Kinshasa. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her $100 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. She will diversify her business by adding semolina for resale at profit with this next loan.

loans.use: to diversify her business by adding semolina for resale at profit.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a peddler selling earrings, pomade, men’s underwear, pampers and other items at Elmina. She is married to a farmer and they have seven children. She responsibly supports her partner in the payment of accommodations and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy earrings, pomade, men’s underwear, pampers and other items to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy earrings, pomade, men’s underwear, pampers and other items to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: Catherine de 32 años es una mujer alegre y con ganas de salir adelante en la vida. Es madre soltera de dos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivo para superarse. Vive en la casa de su madre y espera pronto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus hijos.	Para Catherine el negocio de la venta de comida es una actividad que le ayuda a poder tener sus ingresos para poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos, ella realiza esta actividad en la casa de su madre y lleva ya mas de dos años en este negocio, se siente cómoda trabajando ahí pues ella tiene tiempo para poder realizar otras actividades además de tener tiempo para estar a lado de sus hijos y su madre.Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que puede tener tiempo libre por las tardes para así poder realizar otras actividades porque es una mujer proactiva.  Lo que no le gusta es que a veces tiene que dar crédito a algunos comensales y estos se  demoran en pagarle, pero siempre con buen ánimo terminan ella termina recibiendo su dinero. Su negocio está cerca de una empresa grande de la ciudad por lo cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes y por lo mismo muy buenos ingresos diarios. Ella esta empezando a remodelar su local pues así espera dar crecimiento de sus actividades.Para Catherine este es el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que le vaya bien ya que tiene mucha esperanza de seguir trabajando con el grupo que integra ya que hasta ahora todos se portaron bien con ella y se siente cómoda.Con los 1000 soles que solicito comprará calaminas, maderas y otros materiales para poder continuar con la remodelación de su negocio.
texts.en: Catherine is 32 years old and is a happy woman who wants to get ahead in life.  She is a single mother of two children who are her biggest reason to get ahead.  She lives at her mother’s house and hopes to soon be able to improve the quality of life for herself and her children.  For Catherine, the food sales business helps her to be able to earn income to provide her children with a good education.  She works from her mother’s house and has been in this business for over two years now.  She is comfortable working there, as she has time to do other things in addition to having time to be with her children and her mother.  What she likes most about her business is being able to have free time in the afternoons so that she can do other things, as she is a proactive woman.  What she does not like is that she sometimes has to loan money to some diners who take a long time to repay her.  However, she is always in good spirits and she receives her money in the end.  Her business is located near a large company in the city, which is why she has a large number of customers and thus, good daily earnings.  She is starting to remodel her place of business in hopes of increasing business.  This is Catherine’s first loan with MFP and she hopes that it goes well, as she has high hopes of continuing to work with the same group of borrowers.  So far, everyone has treated her well and she feels comfortable.  With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will purchase corrugated iron, wood and other materials to continue remodeling her business.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron, wood and other materials to continue remodeling her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last 12 years Margaret has been practicing farming in Maingi, Limuru town. She is 37 years old and married to Nelson. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid the other loans off well and in good time. She intends to use the loan amount to prepare the land for planting.

In the future, Margaret hopes to practice large scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 48 years old a mixed crop farmer and he is married to Lydia who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children aged 20, 17 and 15 years respectively. He has been in dairy farming as a primary business and mixed crop farming as a secondary business for the last ten years, with a monthly income of KES. 3,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD  after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to purchase animal feeds for his cattle and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be a milk supplier in the area and improve the living standard of their family.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his cattle and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and married with nine children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Basilisa has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Basilisa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla es una mujer de 27 años madre de tres hijos. No está casada y vive en la parroquia de "Río Verde" del cantón Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Desde hace 5 años trabaja de manera independiente confeccionando ropa, oficio que aprendió de su último trabajo. Da trabajo a dos señoras que le ayudan en la confección. Trabaja todo el día y en ocasiones la jornada se extiende hasta altas horas de la noche. Ella desea invertir comprando telas y una máquina para de esta manera extender su negocio. 

La vida no ha sido fácil pero ella desea mantener su ritmo de trabajo y así poder seguir sustentando económicamente su hogar. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y por ello se esfuerza diariamente.
texts.en:
Karla’s a 27-year-old mother of three children.  She’s not married and lives in Río Verde Parish in Santo Domingo Canton.  Santo Domingo is a canton belonging to Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province which is one of Ecuador’s most densely populated.  It’s very attractive because it has several monuments scattered throughout the city.  Among them is the “Monumento al Indio Colorado” [Monument to the Red Indian], a sector known as “Y del Colorado.”  Santo Domingo is a canton that’s blessed with marvelous, hardworking and enterprising people that strive untiringly to develop and make progress; they receive tourists with open arms and show them the marvels of their culture and surroundings.

For the last five years she’s been working independently making clothes, a skill she learned at her previous employment.  She employs two women that help her sew.  She works all day and sometimes the work day extends well into the night.  She wants to buy fabric and a sewing machine to expand her business.

Life has not been easy but she wants to keep up the pace of her work to continue supporting her home economically.  Her dream is to have a house of her own and that’s why she works so hard every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Esther Lily

texts.en:
Esther Lily is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Esther Lily has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Esther Lily has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Esther Lily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Alfred has operated a café for the past eight years; his potential clients are the people who come to the market. He faces a major challenge of seasonality where by during the rainy seasons there are no customers. He dreams of owning a well established supermarket.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bags of rice, sugar and wheat flour for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get financial assistance to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
Don Oscar es una persona de veintisiete años de edad es casado y con tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y todavía dependen de el. 
El acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para gastos personales ya que necesita hacerle unos cambio a su camioneta ya que este  es su medio de movilización para trabajar.
texts.en: Oscar is 27 years old, married and has three children who are still school aged and dependent on him.   He is calling on Ceprodel once again to request a new personal expenses loan because he needs to do some repairs on his pick-up truck since this is his mode of transportation for work.

loans.use: to do some vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children and both go to school. She also takes care of  her father. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

She operates a restaurant in her home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and rainy season. Her aspirations and goals are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stall to work out of.

loans.name: Chalkhaajav

texts.en:
Chalkhaajav has been working as a contract driver with a private company. He has been working as a driver for many years but had an accident with his wife in 2007.  Now his wife is on social welfare and always has to be nursed.  Chalkhaajav only recently got back to his job just a few months ago. He lives with his wife and his daughter in their small house which is built in the early 1970s.   

Lately his house has became very old and damaged in many parts, especially the floor, walls and the roof. Therefore he decided to make renovations to his house in order to live in comfortable living conditions with his family. According to his plan, he will add insulation to the walls and windows before this winter because there is always too much heat-loss by the uninsulated walls and windows. The loan he is requesting will be dedicated to purchasing some necessary building materials to make renovations to his old house.

loans.use: renovate his house

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maura; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y compra  tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida y también la socia vende relojes y radios, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es tener un local para poder vender la comida y los relojes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar relojes y productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maura, 50, is a member of the “Sayhua 3” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  

She has a spouse and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a food-selling business; she also sells watches and radios in Urubamba’s market from 8am until 6pm.  Her dream is to have a locale to sell food and watches.  She’s asking for the loan to buy watches and ingredients to prepare food like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy watches and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Umar's Group

texts.en:
Umar's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Umar is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Umar has been working hard to manage her small art shop, selling handcrafts. 

To help expand her business, Umar has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making crafts, and will help Umar generate greater profits and pay fees for her sisters. Umar hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Umar is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Umar's future prospects by helping her to learn how to budget for her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making crafts

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 29, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a printing house in Phnom Penh city for over three years. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Vanna is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, she could save some money from her transportation expense to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a small printing house at home, build a new wooden house and support her child to higher studies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es: Sonia tiene 38 años de edad es casada con  02 hijos en etapa escolar. En el transcurso de su vida Sonia se ha dedicado a diversas actividades comerciales para salir adelante como a la venta de calzados y de ropas. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bebidas como agua mineral, gaseosas, entre otros. Este negocio nació con la idea de obtener mayores ganancias y de esa manera seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. A futuro a Sonia le gustaría poner unas cabinas de internet, la cual lo pueda alquilar, pues así asegura tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas y agua, y también para algunos gastos familiares. Sonia agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en: Sonia is 38 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.  Over the course of her life, Sonia has worked in a number of different sales activities in order to get ahead, such as selling shoes and clothes.  She currently sells drinks such as mineral water, soda, etc.  She started this business with the idea of making more profits and thereby being able to continue supporting her husband with the household expenses.  In the future, Sonia would like to set up some Internet terminals which she will be able to charge people to use.  This will make her more profits.  On this occasion, she requested her loan to buy drinks such as soda and water.  She will also cover some family expenses.  Sonia is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to buy soda and water

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 35 years old and married. She lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan and is a mother of two children.

Nadia is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to improve and reorganize her home living conditions so it will look more beautiful. She will paint and repair, and also buy some missing furniture.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Silvanus

texts.en:
Silvanus is a 36-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married to Violet and they have three children aged 15, eight and two years old.

He sells new shoes in an open air market, a business he has done for the past two years, earning an income of 7,000 KES monthly. He is taking his first loan of 15,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya to use in purchasing more sacks of new shoes. 

He plans to use any profits to improve the lives of his family members. His dream is to own a mega shop for shoes.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of shoes for resale

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 48 year old married man living with his wife and three young children, who are still attending school. He is the main source of income for the family. He works as a realtor in his town to fulfill his family needs. As for his wife she opened a room in the house to by homemade food. Due to the hard financial situation, Hasan is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. His only purpose is to help them attain high educational levels to help them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: For 5 years my business has sold clothing and shoes for women, men and children, distributing the merchandise door-to-door among my neighbors and friends that prefer to do business with me at the moment because I offer them affordable prices with methods of payment. I also have clients who are teachers and factory workers and I visit some villages around Danli. Maintaining good clients and administration has generated a good income for me, but I need the loan to improve my business and cover the costs of labor.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger assortment of clothes for women, men and children as well as school and dress shoes.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Kayi A. is married and the mother of four. She is in the business of selling various food items in her area in order to help with household expenses. She has gained a great deal of experience from her 10 years in this business. However, given her very limited financial means, she is faced with many customer orders that she cannot fill. She now needs financial support to strengthen her business, particularly for making and selling caramel sauce. The $700 loan that she is requesting will allow her to stock up on various items and to have a significant commercial inventory in order to increase her sales figures.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, Madame A. Kayi a pour activité la vente de divers aliments dans sa localité pour contribuer à la prise en charge des besoins de son foyer. Cela fait 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité et elle a acquis une grande expérience dans le domaine. Cependant, par ses moyens financiers très limités, elle est confrontée à beaucoup de demandes qu’elle est incapable de satisfaire. Elle a besoin aujourd’hui d’un appui financier pour renforcer son activité notamment la préparation et la vente du jus de caramel. Le crédit de $700 qu’elle demande lui permettra de s’approvisionner en divers produits et disposer d’un stock marchand conséquent en vue d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.

loans.use: To stock essential items for making and selling  caramel sauce.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en: Zeynab is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aremenian-occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, she has five children. She started her business in 1995, and borrowed two Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $650. Now she wants to borrow $650.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase two deep fryers, extra tables and seats

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba S. is twenty five years old and married with a child.  Her husband is a teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet family expenses.  Kumba takes responsibility for providing most of the family needs.  Her hope is to provide the best education for her children, and in the future, to construct a family home.  Kumba runs a cosmetics shop in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. She takes the stock on credit from another shop which she said is more expensive than when it is purchased with cash.  She is requesting a loan of $275 to increase her stock and have her own capital.

loans.use: Increase capital in her cosmetic shop

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia Rosa is 49 years old and has three children. Her husband helps her find customers and one of her children helps her make the crafts. She lives in the neighborhood of Saposa in the Huallaga province of the San Martín state. She belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank.

She sews purses and tapestries. She also designs and makes earrings and other handcrafts. She decided to start this business in order to improve her economical situation and work in what she most likes.

With the loan of S/. 500.00($167.00) that was recently granted by Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 quotas, she will purchase more meters of fabric, large spools of thread, hanks of lace, accessories, a display case to display her products and a collection of art craft books. These books will help her create new and varied models in order to reach more clients in the community of Saposa and nearby villages.

Mrs. Julia's goal is to make some adjustments to her home so that she can expand her business and have a better presentation of her products. She also wants to have a room in which to give classes to other community women in order to help them achieve independence.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia Rosa tiene 49 años y tres hijos, su esposo le ayuda en la búsqueda de clientes y uno de sus hijos le apoya en la confección de las artesanías. Vive en la localidad de Saposoa, provincia de el Huallaga, departamento de San Martín; pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción”. Se dedica a la costura de bolsas, tapetes, así como la creación de aretes, y otras manualidades. Decidió iniciar el negocio para mejorar la situación económica y trabajar en lo que a ella más le gusta. Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00) pagadero en 4 cuotas, comprará más telas en metros, hilos en carretes grandes, cintas en madejas de colores variados, accesorios de bijoutería, una vitrina para la exhibición de su producción y una colección de libros de artesanía, que le ayude en la creación de modelos nuevos y variados con la finalidad de llegar más clientes de la comunidad de Saposoa y aledaños. La señora Julia tiene como meta hacer algunos arreglos en su casa para poder ampliar su negocio y tener una mejor presentación de sus productos, además de poder contar con un espacio donde pueda dar clases a otras mujeres de la comunidad y así apoyarlas a que se independicen.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, laces, accessories Purchase one display case

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Raising 3 school aged children has been quite challenging for Hoàng Thị Diện, a 34 years old mat weaver. Despite the fact that she worked very hard, her family living condition was difficult. She joined TYM to borrow money to buy material for mat weaving. She started with a small loan. To date, she had borrowed and reimbursed all her loans totaling a few thousands US dollars. Her family living condition had improved. Her husband, Mr Nguyễn Khắc Thơi, is very supportive of her. This time after discussing with her husband, Ms Diện would like to borrow 375 USD to buy material for mat weaving.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Nuôi 3 đứa con trong độ tuổi ăn học, chị Hoàng Thị Diện, 34 tuổi, dù rất chăm chỉ dệt chiếu nhưng kinh tế gia đình vẫn gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Vì thiếu vốn mua nguyên liệu chị đã tìm đến Quỹ TYM. Bắt đầu với các mức vốn nhỏ, đến nay tổng số vốn chị đã vay và hoàn trả lên đến vài nghìn USD. Nhờ sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả, kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Khắc Thơi luôn là người hỗ trợ chị trong việc sử dụng và hoàn trả vốn. Vòng vốn này, chị đã bàn với chồng đề nghị Quỹ cho vay 375USD đầu tư mua thêm cói làm chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat.

loans.name: Chring

texts.en: Mrs. Chring S., 43, works with her husband on a piece of land, breeding ducks, earning collectively about $7/day from selling duck eggs to the wholesalers. She has four children. Two are enrolled in school and the rest of them are unemployed. Mrs. Chring S. hopes use a loan to expand her livestock by adding more ducks to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her livestock by adding more ducks to increase her income generation.

loans.name: Chit

texts.en: Mrs. Chit T., 36, is a widow and lives with her school-age child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her household, she works selling a variety of grocery products and provisions to the people in her area and makes on average around $5 each day in profit. Mrs. Chit T. hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand

loans.name: Ritha's Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Ritha is 37 years old and is single woman. Ritha sales clothes, she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Ritha has taken out 1successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María belongs to the San Martín de Porras Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of food, clothes and orange juice in Bethlehem Plaza of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 dozen pants, 2 dozen coats, 1 dozen polos and ½ dozen blouses.

She is 42 years old of age, married with 6 children. Her husband does not contribute to the expenses of the home. She alone is the one who pays for the expenses of the home and education of her children. She also changes her business according to the season. For example, she is now selling orange juice.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María pertenece al Banco Comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta de comida, ropa y jugo de naranja, en la Plaza de Belén del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 2 docenas de pantalones, 2 docenas de casacas, 1 docena de polos, ½ docena de blusas.

Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, su esposo no colabora con los gastos del hogar, ella sola es quien mantiene a su hogar y educación de sus hijos, ella también cambia de negocio de acuerdo a la temporada, por ahora esta vendiendo jugo de naranja.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store, such as pants, coats, polos and blouses.

loans.name: Segunda Maria

texts.es:
Segunda belongs to the “Mujeres Creativas 2” Communal Bank, located at Av. Santa Clara Mz. A Lt. 6, in Manaytay, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 56 years old and the mother of six children. Her husband works as a carpenter.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Segunda invested in food sales. Currently she continues selling food outside a sawmill. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. and, with her children’s help, prepares food to take and sell to her clients who anxiously await her delicious stews. She spends her afternoons taking care of her home.

With this loan of $300, which she plans to repay in four months, she will expand her business by buying a blender along with local fruits to make juice so she can have more clients. The rest of the money will be used to buy ingredients to prepare the food she will sell.

Segunda thanks Manuela Ramos for the help she receives to grow her business. She now feels much more sure of herself.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Segunda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en la Av Santa Clara Mz. A Lt. 6, del Distrito de Manaytay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en madera. Segunda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad continua con su venta de comida afuera de un aserradero, se levanta a las 4 am., con la ayuda de sus hijos alistan sus comidas y llevan a vender a sus clientes que con ansias esperan sus ricos potajes, por las tardes se dedica a su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/.800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliara su negocio y comprará una licuadora, frutas regionales para vender jugos y así tener mas clientes, y el resto loinvirtira en víveres para la comidas que venderá. Segunda da gracias a Manuela Ramos por que esta haciendo crecer su negocio y ahora se siente mas segura de si misma.

loans.use: Purchase blender and fruit to make juices along with ingredients needed to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
At the age of 59 years old, Mrs. D. Thi D. already raised her 4 children to maturity and they all build their own families. Before, her family is locally one of the most difficult families. However, after joining the TYM Fund, her family economy improved significantly. After the first time, she talks to her husband and decides to borrow 375 USD to buy more pigs and sedge to weave and repays weekly. Her mats are very pretty and strong, therefore they are used by many customers. Her current average income is 120 USD. She always wants to stay healthy and continue to be a member of the TYM Fund to improve her family economy.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Ở tuổi 59, chị Đỗ Thị Độ đã nuôi 4 con trưởng thành và có gia đình riêng. Trước đây gia đình chị là hộ nghèo của địa phương nhưng sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi hẳn. Sau khi hết vòng vốn 1, chị bàn với anh vay 375USD mua lợn chăn nuôi và cói dệt chiếu để hoàn trả hàng tuần. Những đôi chiếu D. chị dệt ra thật chắc chắn và bền đẹp, nên được tiêu thụ ngay và rất được giá. Đồng vốn vay quay vòng nhanh và có hiệu quả. Thu nhập một tháng của chị Độ là 120USD. Chị mong muốn mình luôn khoẻ mạnh để được tham gia vay vốn Quỹ Tình Thương phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Buy pigs and sedge

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary P. is a basket seller in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her business can generate a small income. Therefore, Mrs. Sary P. is now requesting a loan to start another business in pig breeding so that she can improve her living conditions. Mrs. Sary P. is 39. She is a widow with 2 children, one of whom is enrolling in school, while the remaining one is too young to work or attend school.

loans.use: To start another business in pig breeding

loans.name: Oscar Agostinho

texts.pt:
Oscar Agostinho L. is 38 years old, from Inhambane and is married with 3 children. His eldest is a 9 year old son who is in 4th grade and his second eldest is his 6 year old daughter who is in 1st grade. His youngest is his 3 year old daughter who is not in school yet. He basically supports his family of 5 alone (himself, his wife and 3 children).

Oscar was in school until the 9th grade when he was incorporated into the Mozambican armed forces. After the signing of the general peace agreement, he was integrated into the navy where he remains to this day and where he recently benefitted from a 6 month training course abroad to become an instructor. His house is still in construction and he is currently renting.

Oscar has worked in planning for 3 years and is currently sector chief. He learnt through day-to-day experience whilst still a soldier at the Boane barracks over 10 years.He has a monthly salary of 7015,00 MZN and from this he saves 2000,00 MZN.

This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku which he heard about from colleagues who were already clients and has never borrowed from other institutions. His biggest dream is to see his house being finished.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Oscar Agostinho L. tem 38 anos e natural de Inhambane é casado maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos. Primeiro com 9 anos e estuda na 4ªclasse e a segunda com 6 anos na primeira classe e a terceira com tres anos e ainda não estuda. Basicamente sustenta a sua família que é sua esposa e seus filhos.

Oscar estudou até 9ªclasse e para por missão de serviço, foi incorporado nas forças armadas de defesa de Moçambique e depois da assinatura do acordo geral de paz foi integrado na marinha de guerra onde se encontra até hoje e pouco tempo beneficiou se de uma formação fora do país como instrutor durante 6 meses. A sua casa ainda está em construção neste momento vive alugado.

Oscar trabalha na area de planificação a 3 anos e chefe do sector. Aprendeu no quartel de Boane ainda soldado por experiencia do dia a dia num periodo de 10 anos. Tem um salário mensal de 7015,00mt e poupa deste 2000,00mt.

Este é o quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve doutras instituições e conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que já eram clientes. O seu maior sonho é ver a sua casa concluida.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish his family home

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata Koné a  43 ans et vit avec ses 9 enfants (1 garçon et 8 filles) et son époux dans une famille monogame à Mancourani I  un quartier situé au centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Dès son jeune âge elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus qu’elle fut obligée de mettre en veilleuse pour des raisons de mariage (immigration vers la République du Burkina Faso). De retour au Mali, elle reprend les activités économiques en se spécialisant dans la vente des friperies (vêtements et jouets d’occasion très appréciés par une certaine catégorie sociale.), il y ’a de cela 20 ans.
Elle est en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé ses quatre premiers prêts individuels elle est à son cinquième et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 4 balles de vêtement et 1 balle de jouets exclusivement à Sikasso (capitale de la troisième région de la république du Mali) auprès de grossistes reconnus. 
Elle vend à domicile et de façon ambulante, en détail (au comptant et à crédit) surtout aux salariés. Sa clientèle est composée en grande majorité de femmes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata Koné is 43 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and 9 children (1 boy and 8 girls) in Mancourani, a neighborhood in the center of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

At a young age she started earning income that she was obliged to save for reasons of future marriage (immigrating to the Republic of Burkina Faso). Upon her return to Mali, 20 years ago, she restarted her business activities, specializing in the sale of used clothing (used cloths and toys that were much appreciated by a certain social class).

She has had a business association with Soro Yiriwaso (microfinancing bank) for the past three (3) years. She has successfully repaid her first four (4) personal loans and is presently duly repaying her fifth personnel loan.

She expects to use this loan to purchase four (4) bales of clothing and one (1) bale of toys at Sikasso (Capital of the third region of the Republic of Mali) from a recognized wholesaler. She sells these items from her house and also door-to-door (for cash or credit) mostly to working individuals. The majority of her clientele are women.

She hopes to produce a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA which would allow her to meet the payments of the loan and invest the remainder into her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and childrens toys

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim S. E. is 28 years old and works growing yams on her plot of farmland in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is sometimes employed to take care of other villagers' farms to earn a living. On average, she makes around US$3.20 each day. Her husband, Mea Chet, is a horse-cart driver and is able to make US$4.20 per day. He just started driving a horse cart this year, and before, he helped his wife growing yams.  
Currently, Khim is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of US$400 to purchase another horse. The extra horse will be hired for extra profits. She told a loan officer that on average she spends around US$40 every month on food, US$2 on utilities, US$35 on her children's education and US$5 on transportation. She has four children, one of whom is a student, and three others are too young to attend school. In the future, she wants all the children to get to a higher class in order to get a good job. If she has enough money she will build a better house for her family members.

loans.use: To purchase another horse for hiring.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice O. has 3 children. She has completed her education through junior high school.

Alice sells cosmetics in Kotokoraba, which is the heart of Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1997.

Alice uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Alice will use this loan to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to help her husband with the renovation of their house.

loans.use: Alice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Abdoulaye Samba

texts.fr: Mr abdoulaye samba A. est agé de 32ans il est marié et pere de deux enfants .Son activité principale est la fabrication de meuble en bois .Il a commencer à apprendre ce metier tres tôt apres l' école primaire.IL gere actuellement son propre atelier où il forme en meme temps des jeunes.Pour depanner sa machine il demande un pret.
texts.en:
Mr Abdoulaye Samba A. is 32 years old, married, and the father of two children. His main business consists in making wooden furniture. He started learning this job very early on after primary school. He currently runs his own workshop where he also trains youngsters. To fix his machine, he's seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new machine

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano U. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. She first applied to MicroInvest when she started selling eggs. She started her business from scratch. In time she improved the business significantly and she has her own trade outlet in a central bazaar where she trades the eggs wholesale. Her prices at the bazar are lower than others because she works directly with the supplier. Mrs. U. is looking for a loan of 1700 TSJ for 1 month to open one more trade outlet. This loan will allow her to increase her revenue by adding another store.

loans.use: To open another store.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.en:
Jeny is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank. Jeny is 28 years old and is married with one son. She sells batteries, CDs, DVDs and other music-related materials, among other things. Jeny has a small store in her mother’s house, and employs two people to distribute her products, which she buys in the city of Lima.  Jeny needs a loan of 800 soles to buy wholesale CDs. Jeny dreams of expanding her business and of starting another business. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Jeny es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Jeny es casada, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Yeny se dedica a la distribución de CD, DVD, Discos y todo material discográfico, pilas, entre otros productos, Jeny tiene un almacén en la casa de su mama, cuenta con 2 personas quienes se encargan del reparto de los productos, sus productos los adquiere de la ciudad de Lima. 
Jeny necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de CD por mayor. 
Jeny sueña con ampliar su negocio, implementar otro negocio mas.

loans.use: Buy wholesale CDs

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident dans le quartier  Mancourani I de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais la plus dominante est la vente d’habits pour enfant menée par (2) clientes et à laquelle s’ajoute la vente de fruits et de chaussures.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêts précédents ont été correctement  remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 douzaines d’habits  pour enfant, un chargement d’orange et de mandarine et une vingtaine de paire de chaussures. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako capitale du Mali,  ou sur place à Sikasso et environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 21.000 FCFA par mois qu’elles comptent utiliser, une partie dans les activités et l’autre partie aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi (composed of 4 married women) have an average age of 24 and on average one child. They live in the Mancourani I neighborhood of the town of Sikasso.

They each have different businesses, but the most common is selling children's clothing in which 2 clients are involved; ithe other two are in the businesses of selling fruit and vegetables and selling shoes.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. They are on their 4th solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy 4 dozen outfits for children, a load of oranges and mandarines, and around 20 pairs of shoes. They do their buying either in Bamako, the capital of Mali, or right in Sikasso and the surrounding area.

The items are sold retail and on a cash basis in the markets of the town of Sikasso (Médine and the big open-air market) and in their own neighborhoods, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each hope to make an average profit 21,000 FCFA a month that they plan to use partially for their businesses and partially for the needs of their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy outfits for children, fruit, and shoes for their businesses

loans.name: Thuy Thi's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Thuỷ sinh năm 1976,(Mã số: 010117140007). Chị bán hang giải khát ( nước ngọt, bánh kẹo,…). Chồng chị làm công nhân có thu nhập ône định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ /tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Lê Phương A. sinh năm 1977, (Mã số: 010117140008).  làm nghề thợ may, chồng chị làm tai công ty sữa có thu nhập ổn định. Chị vay mức vốn vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để mua vải mở rộng cửa hàng may mặc.
  Trần Thị Thuý Hà sinh năm 1980. (Mã số: 010117140009).  Chị là giáo viên, chồng là thợ sửa chữa ô tô, có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị vay mức vốn vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để mở xưởng sửa chữa xe.
Nguyễn Thị Năng sinh năm 1963, (Mã số: 010117140010). chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, làm vườn, bán rau. Chồng chị làm bảo vệ trông trường học, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 300.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ để mua phân bón.
 Nguyễn Thị Thuận sinh năm 1958, (Mã số: 010117140011).  làm nông nghiệp , chăn nuôi. Chồng chị làm thuê và phụ giúp chị công bviệc đồng áng và đi đánh cá về bán. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 250.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. T. N. was born in 1976. She sells beverages such as sodas and candies. Her husband is a laborer with a stable income. The family's average income is about 2,000,000 VND per month. She joined the Fund with a loan of 4,142,000 VND to invest in her beverage sales business. She is the group leader for this group loan, which also includes: - Mrs. A. P. Le, born in 1977, is a tailor. Her husband works at a milk factory with a stable income. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to buy fabric to expand her tailoring business. - Mrs. T. T. Tran, born in 1980, is a teacher. Her husband is a car mechanic with a stable income. Her family's average income is around 3,000,000 VND per month. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to help her husband open an auto mechanic's shop. - Mrs. N. T. N., born 1963, works mainly agricultural jobs, including landscaping and selling vegetables. Her husband is a security guard at a school, and her two small children attend school. The family's average income is about 300,000 VND per week. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to buy fertilizer. - Mrs. T. T. N., born in 1958, works in agriculture and raising livestock. Her husband works as labor for hire, helps her in the field, and works as a fisherman as well. Their average income is around 250,000 VND per week. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to trade goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various small businesses

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn Y. is a villager in Trapaing Knol village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chor Phal, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still earn little income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Khorn Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support her family. She is 57 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
M. is 38 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She is a mother of two children who are students. She is married to Huot, 47, who sells charcoal across the commune. 

M. earns a living selling vegetables in the market and has done so since 1999. She needs to travel to some parts of the commune in order to buy the vegetables in bulk. She hires a motorbike for her transportation. She is applying for a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her business transportation. M. dreams that her children will earn their degrees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business transportation.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.en:
Khuê Đào, 57, lives in the town of Hưng yên. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Khuê owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Khuê has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Khuê joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Khuê has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Khuê is requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Khuê from TYM Fund. Khuê plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Buy livestock.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Agée de quarante sept (47) ans, Mme Thérèse M. est mariée avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. C’est une femme très dynamique qui se bat pour le devenir de ses enfants et de sa famille. Pour cela, elle mène comme activité la préparation et la vente de la bouillie à base de mais tous les matins dans son village. Cette activité lui permet de faire face aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Pour accroître ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un crédit pour constituer un stock important de mais, matière de base entrant dans la préparation de la bouillie.
texts.en:
Ms. Thérèse M., age 47, is married and has four children in her care. This is a very energetic woman who struggles for her the future of her children and family. To do so, she has a business making and selling cornmeal porridge each morning in her village. This enables her to address the essential needs of her children. To grow her profits, she's requesting a loan to build up a sizable stock of corn, the basic ingredient that goes into making the porridge.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock corn for selling porridge

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina es una mujer D. 45 años, sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Eleuterio D. 53 años y su hijo Rubén D. 17 años; y lo que más desea es que su familia tenga una vida feliz. Ya son 20 años los que lleva produciendo y comercializando productos artesanales, su negocio está ubicado en una zona altamente comercial, en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donD. se realizan ferias en Juliaca), ella está convencida que la variedad D. sus productos incrementarán sus ventas y con ello la mejora D. su calidad D. vida. Evangelina se divierte mucho trabajando y ese estado D. ánimo lo refleja en los acabados D. su trabajo. Gran parte del día está comprometida en la producción y comercialización, lo que le resta tiempo importante para dedicarlo sus hijos, pero está convencida D. que más adelante su negocio prosperará y que esta es una etapa en la que tiene que impulsarlo, sabe que el camino al éxito está plagado D. incertidumbres, pero que al final del mismo encontrará la satisfacción D. haber realizado un buen trabajo, contribuyendo al desarrollo D. su familia. Con este primer préstamo con MFP ha descubierto la importancia D. trabajar en grupo, está segura D. pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no causar problemas a su banco comunal, en donD. es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad D. tejidos que produce.
texts.en:
Evangelina is an unassuming and hardworking 45-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Eleuterio age 53, and their son, Ruben, age 17. What she would like the most is for her family to have a happy life. She has been producing and selling handicrafts for 20 years now. Her business is located in a highly commercial area in the Explanada Laguna Temporal, on the Juliaca fairgrounds. She is convinced that having a variety of products will boost sales, thus improving her quality of life. Evangelina has a lot of fun working, and her mood is reflected in her finished product. She commits most of her time in making and selling her handicrafts, and she spends the rest of the time with her children. She is certain that her business will prosper in the future, and that it is currently at a stage where she needs to give it a boost. She knows that the road to success is paved with uncertainty, but that in the end, she will find satisfaction with a job well-done, having contributed to her family’s development. With this her first MFP loan, she has discovered the importance of working in a group. She is sure that she will be able to make her payments on time so that she will not cause any problems in her microfinance institute, where she is beloved for her joyful personality. With the 800.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more wool to increase the amount of knitwork that she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool for knitwork

loans.name: Ni Putu Puri

texts.en:
Ni Putu Puri is 56 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Ni Putu Puri raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Puri has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Puri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Puri has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI, which she used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Putu Puri is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Ni Putu Puri's third loan from DINARI. Ni Putu Puri plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Puri - (DNR.M-0689) merupakan 56 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia dewasa.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Puri memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu Puri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Puri menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Puri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Puri meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Puri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has five children. Her children, two sons and three daughters, are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer. Agnes is a trader. She trades in corn dough. She sells from a tabletop stall at the market square. She also supplies to food vendors in her community. Agnes wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She buys from nearby communities. Agnes has been in this business for four years. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena is 53 years old. He is married and father to six children, all in school. He is a trader and he trades in smoked meat. He takes stock of goods from Tamale, in the northern part of Ghana. He buys them in bulk and supplies to the food vendors in the community market, where he lives. In most cases, people place their order and he supplies to them as soon as he arrives. He started his business six years ago with lots of experience and with the atmosphere of creating a good environment. He requests a loan so that he can trek to the north of Ghana to buy stock. He also dreams of providing education for his children.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
A L. vivienda del señor Margarito U. le está haciendo falta terminar L. barda y algunos acabados D. L. casa. 
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y así poder realizar L. mejora lo más pronto posible ya que si familia se queda soL. todo el día. 
Por que el trabaja D. guardia D. seguridad en un rancho que está a las fuera D. L. ciudad y es por eso que quiere L. seguridad D. su familia. 
Cuando fuimos a realizar L. visita a L. vivienda del Don Margarito el encontraba en su trabajo y quien nos atendió fue su esposa L. señora Hortencia Reyes, quien es L. persona que aparece en L. foto.
texts.en:
At the household of señor Margarito U., he needs to complete a fence and some finishing work for the house. That is why he is applying for a loan from us-- in order to be able to buy material and, thus, be able to complete the improvement as soon as possible since his family is left alone all day. Because his work as a security guard is at a ranch that is outsiD. the city he wants to protect the security of his family.

When we came to carry out the visit to Don Margarito’s home he was at work, and his wife, señora Hortencia Reyes, took care of us. She is the person who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completing a fence and finishing work for a house

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 62 años, es una mujer admirable, ya que a su edad es muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Vive con su esposo, quien es carpintero y con la última de sus 6 hijos, quien es estudiante. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en todas las variedades y para los diferentes géneros, actividad que realiza desde su casa. Con esta labor está solventando los gastos estudiantiles de su hija, a quien espera verla, más adelante como una buena profesional. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con varias personas y sobre todo aprender mucho sobre el negocio, pues así se siente útil ante la sociedad.
